text: On tap at Tap and Handle in Fort Collins. Had a few times before, never rated. Excited to have again! Citrus. Pine. Sweet malts. Normal west coast inputs into a strong IPA. Tasty. Well done, as ever, with RR. 14.6

From tap at Toronado, San Francisco. Aroma is fruity hop, biscuity malt, tropical fruit, pine and light caramel. Flavour is above moderate sweet with a firm bitter finish. Body is medium. Pretty great balance and good finesse to this piny fruity malty IPA.
All I can say is Wow Wow Wow. Blind Pig has to be the best IPA I have ever had. Very full bodied and citrus hops just explode in your mouth.
Tasted side by side w pliny at apex in pdx. Much more mild than pliny. Juicier too. Grapefruit. Orange zest.

Bottled 3/14. Pours a clear golden/caramel color. Sweet malt aroma, but the aroma is not as strong as Pliny the Elder. Similar crisp pine flavor with more citrus on the back end

John L - Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Gylden klar skum hvid kort 
Citrus grape korn korn frugt 
Bitter meget sød lidt 
@ r sr

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, orange, pine, bread, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Clear/hazy golden/amber beer with heavy yeast and with a slight/medium white/off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starta medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, orange and pine; ends slightly bitter and dry with bread, hops amd citrus.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Shamefully it is filtered to oblivion, ruining the appearance and palate more than it should. The aroma is good and the flavour is great.
On tap at Saraveza. Pours an orange-ish golden color. Thick white head. Scent is all hops. Taste is piney, citrus. Hop flavor is pretty strong. Tasty beer.
Aroma: sweet and fruity; Appearance: clear, very light gold with thin white head; Taste: very sweet taste, only slightly hoppy; good; Palate: medium body with medium finish; Overall: very nice.

Rating #2471 - 2016.05.03 - Draught at Monks Cafe. First beer in Philly for CBC, and its from Cali. Pours a rich golden, small white head, minimal lacing. Aroma is tangerines, lemon peel, pine. On the palate, similar tropical flavours, mild resin, mild pine needle. Medium bodied and extraordinarily balanced. Superb.
Pours clear golden with a low white head. Aromas of peach, mango, apricot, grass, grapefruit. Taste is very fruity and somewhat bitter. Mouthfeel is light bodied with moderate carbonation.

From tap at Toronado, San Francisco. Clear golden color with white head. Hoppy aroma, grassy, piney and some citrus notes, grapefruit. Light sweet and moderate bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Draft at the source. Clear gold color, white head. Aroma is fruity, with citrus and pine. Taste is citrus, pine, tropical fruit, nice caramel malt backbone. Good balance. Very nice.

Tap at the brewpub. Pours clear golden. Aroma is tropical fruit and citrus. Body is medium, almost heavy, really sweet and also bitter, yet not overpowered. Clearly a younger brother of the Plinies. Beautiful.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2017 Tap: deep golden colour, clear, with foamy white long lasting head. Aroma: crisp, biscuity malt notes, overpowered by intense hop aroma, which takes on tropical fruits, supported with hints of pine & peppery notes. Flavor is very similar. Hop bitterness is very high, but not harsh. Finish is dry, bitter, bitterness lingers in aftertaste body is moderate to medium, texture is soft, carbo medium.
TAP. Clear gold with pub foam head.. Subtle fruit hop nose, but sweet.. Balanced sweet golden malt body with tropical fruit hops.. sourced Russian river brewery

Tap at RRBC. A great west coast IPA! Clear dark gold with a quite thin white head. Very smooth and well balanced with a good malty backbone and pine, resin, citrus, grapefruit and floral notes. Almost as good as the Pliny.
Full pint at the brewery. great IPA with more body than expected, nice and clear.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. A little past its prime, bottled 8/25/2016. Aroma is tropical fruit, cereal, pine, malt, tropical fruit. Appearance is amber golden, white head, slightly hazy. Taste is pine, cereal, malt, some citrus, light tropical fruit, got it too late. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, cereal and pine citrus aftertaste. Overall, Id love a go at this one fresher.
Love this beer! Favorite beer from RRBC... Great taste and always the first beer to be asked for by any of my friends.

Draft 0,33l at La Trappe, North Beach, San Francisco. Pours a golden colour. Aroma of hops and florals. Taste of hops, floral and cream. Creamy texture. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Dark golden, offwhite lace. Leafy, flowery wide hop aroma. Medium full body, sweet crystal, malt, pine, good hop profile, nice.

Hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma is lychee, toast, some berries and flowers. Taste is balanced resin bitterness with fruity sourness and sugary sweetness. Nice low carbonated mouthfeel. Not too heavy, long finish of bitter resin.

Clear golden-orange color with slightly off-white head. Aroma has the classic west coast hop profile with sweet oranges and also a solid malt backbone. Taste starts with sweet oranges but goes into bitter grapefruit pith territory and lingers on the aftertaste. Medium to light bodied with medium carbonation. A really classic but very well made IPA.
Bottle from the source dated 10/21/16. Floral and beautiful bouquet. Love the mango and passionfruit with a hit you in the face hop resin. Nice and nice.
Backlog. W aromacie imperialne. Ciężkie, żółte owoce. Znakomity smak chmielowy, szlachetna goryczka, wytrawne i zabójczo pijalne. Wszystko na swoim miejscu.
Bottle shared at Chmielarnia. Aroma is malty and caramel, only hint of hops. Taste is light bitter, light sweet, oxidation do the work.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Panel RR Rami Rami is drinking a Blind Pig IPA by Russian River Brewing Company at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaPanel2 dziwne jak na ipa, troche chmielu, slodkawe, ciut ziolowe, goryczka fajna. Malo chmielu, po poltora miecha? DziwneOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2017 Juicy piney hop aroma and flavor. Pours clear golden in color with soft white head and excellent lacing. Light bodied, Big flavor, clean finish with a linger dry hop character. 

Notes: on tap at the brew pub, June 17

510 ml bottle, bottled 08/25/16, shared by Werckmeister, many thanks!
Amber, clear body, with a big, creamy, lacing, white head. 
Aroma of pine, passion fruit, kiwi, citrus, orange, flowers, some caramel, some citrus candy. 
Tastes of grapefruit, pine, resin, orange, passion fruit, pineapple, flowers, biscuit, some honey. 
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation. 
Finishes medium bitter, citric, resinous, zesty, a bit piney, floral, a bit sweet malty. 

Tasty. Perfectly balanced and crisp, drinks very smooth. Just the right amount of bitterness and malt body, with a nice mellow, floral-fruity hop profile. Overall not among my favourite IPAs as it lacks the last bit of outstanding character maybe, but still really great stuff.

0,51l bottle at home courtesy of amazngwrldfood, big thanks for this one. Bottled 25.08.2016. orange clear shiny color, small white head. smells of pines, resin, light caramel, spices, light exotic fruits, lemon grass, bit parfumy, light herbs. nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of lychees, lemon grass, light pines, lightly citric, flowery, spices, bit peppery. finishes lightly bitter with notes of lemon grass, flowers and some peppery notes. quite good one, but rather on the flowery / spicy side, I prefer a bit more fruity notes, also could be a bit more crisp, but overall quite nice beer.

Pours deep gold into a shaker. Bright white head with excellent retention recedes leaving spot lacing to coat surface. Sweet pine and citrus aromas. Medium bodied with sweet caramel and toffee upfront turning to pine and citrus before the lasting grapefruit pith finish.

Wow. This is one amazing IPA. the aroma and flavor are strong. Alcohol is low enough so I could drink a few. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Taste at pub. This is the beer for the buddy you bring along that doesnt like anything other then light beer. Its a start I guess. Just your basic blonde ale.

On Tap at Russian River Brewing. 
Tolles IPA mit einer sehr guten zitrusfruchtigen-Pinien-Aromakombination. 
Exzellentes bitteres Finish.
Full-bodied, very hoppy, citrus, pine, fruity notes with nice dry, bitter finish!
Tasted side by side w pliny at apex in pdx. Much more mild than pliny. Juicier too. Grapefruit. Orange zest.

Bottle, 500ml. A clear amber beer witb a medium size white head. Aroma is of floral hops, pine and malt. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with soft carbonation. Medium bodied, astrigent and with a malty character and a bitter hopoy finish. A nice beer from the old days of craft beer (2005).

Bottle, 500ml. Bottled less than 3 weeks ago. Clear golden with a foamy offwhite head. Faint aromas of citrus, pine, light funky yeast. Medium to full bodied, moderate carbonation. Medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Dry and oily. Cereal flavors into a bitter hoppy finish. Underwhelming to be honest. Seems like a recipe from 15 years ago. Still quite hoppy.
amazing beer! Almost clear orange colour, slim offwhite head. Grapefruity, mild orange zest, lightly resinous, sweet and smooth malty backbone. Good body, low-medium carbonation.

En fût au Monks Café de Philly. Robe dorée claire avec un mince col de mousse blanc. Arômes de fruits tropicaux (ananas, tangerine, goyave, mangue et litchi), légers grains maltés et effluves de conifères. En bouche, beaucoup dagrumes: tangerine et pamplemousse surtout, avec une touche tropicale de mangue et pelures dananas. Légèrement résineuse avec pointes de grains maltés très bien intégrés aux houblons. Finale plus amère et houblonnée. Texture huileuse et corps mince. Excellente West coast ipa
Waited in line to get into the brewpub, similar to three floyds experience. Once again worth it.

Excelente aroma. Notas citricas y tropicales principalmente.
Color cobrizo, corona de espuma abundante de buena retención, cuerpo medio.
En boca notas frutales, citricos y tropicales y bien equilibrada.
Al paladar exquisita. Naranja, guayaba, mandarina, piña.
En general es una excelente cerveza. Un must!

Draught at Toronado North Park, 22.4.16. Clear gold with a white head. Soft, guava and a little bit of mango in the nose, bitter and dry taste with hints of tropical fruit and lavender. Full body, soft bitter finish, dry mouthfeel and some dry leaves notes. Quite awesome.
Sample at brewery. Malty citrus aroma. Good hop balance and full body. Could drink.

Cristal clear, golden color, tiny white head, quite steady. Juicy, piney, bit green, grapefruity, orange peal aroma. Taste on the other hand is much more green, much more, leafy, grassy. Still awesome. Great green and bitter aftertaste. Completely dry. Pure west coast IPA. Super drinkable, super refreshing.

Bottle. Lots of mandarines, together with the peel, huge on citrus aromas, toned down piney overtones. Slightly sugary but very crisp and definitely not over the top in the bitter finish. The hype is certainly not undeserved.

Bottle, thanks to Misterburd. Faintly cloudy golden yellow with large foamy off-white head, faint floral hops aroma, low carbonation, very well balanced hoppy taste after initial sweetness, smooth body, medium hoppy finish.A great IPA and a great choice for rating #2000!
On draught at RRBC. Pour is golden and mostly clear. Pine, citrus, lots of grapefruit, some sweet malt. Its good.

This has been a major want. On tap at Belmont station in Portland. Pours golden Amber, white head leaves behind massive lacing powered by plenty of carbonation. Nice pine and resin nose. Taste follows with moderate bitterness. Light to medium body plus the carb level makes it borderline slamable. Pretty fucking good bruhs.

shared bottle by a friend. poured a clear deep golden colour with a white head on top. nose is heavy floral, crisp, sweet fruits, apricots, mango, grasse, grapefruit, less harsh compared to pliny, full bodied, sticky, and fruity. loved this way more than pliny that we had after this, slight bitter aftertaste, but not harsh. lovely

Draught @ Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa, California (20.04.2016)  

W smaku i aromacie BARDZO podobne do Pliny The Elder, tylko nieco lżejsze.
Ogromnie aromatyczne, intensywnie owocowe, cytrusowe, żywiczne, tropikalne. Bardzo solidne nachmielenie. Wyraźny ananas, mango, grejpfrut.
Tekstura średnia, znacznie lżejsza niż Pliny. Bardzo wytrawne w stylu West Coast. Finisz gładki, wytrwany jak po nadgryzieniu skórki zielonego grejpfruta. Fenomenalna piana i książkowy, wzorowy lacing. Fenomenalne IPA! 6,25% alk. 14,5 BLG.

You know, sometimes expectations is no good for you? Aroma is sweeter malts, light bread notes and hops with a resinous touch. Taste is pretty solid maltjuice with pine, citrus and resin. I got an almost soapy touch in the aftertaste? Just bordering soapy, but never really tripping over. Solid bitterness.

Pint from the brewery
Appearance: Dark bright yellow/orange/golden/medium head/lacing
Aroma: Very fragrant, very nice hoppy aroma
Taste: Full bodied, yet balance
Mouthfeel: creamy
Overall: Excellent beer, very good reason to travel to Santa Rosa(among other reasons, mainly the beers at Russian River.

Drank August 26, 2015

Bottle share at Cotteridge II as Russian River Blind Pig. Many thanks to Cloin for bringing this hard-to-find IPA back fresh from the US of A. Clear orange, still, small foamy off-white head. Aroma is toffee, floral, celery, herbal hops. Body is smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is floral, powdery, toffee, salty, tangy, light fruits with a dry finish. A nice clean IPA. (3.8)

Bottle, from backlog. Golden with white head. Aroma has lot of sweet clean malts, bread, biscuit with loads of pine hops. Taste is similar, a clean sturdy malt backbona with a metric shitton of citrus, pine and resin.
On tap, super local. As described, quite hoppy, moderate lacing, low foam. Bitter taste lingers on the tongue, not unpleasantly. Nice surprise, good
Bottle. Cotteridge Beano v2. Big pine hoppage. Toffee malts. Taste is sweet, turning resinous bitter. Some citrus. Nice one to tick off.

Cotteridge Convention II. Bottle shared thanks to Theydon Bois, cheers Colin. Golden Amber beer. Aroma of tangerine and hops. Taste is hoppy, tangerine, passion fruit, pine resin and citrus sherbet. Good body. Excellent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle tried at Cotteridge 2. Golden amber colour with an off white head. Nice orange marmalade bitterness, aroma and taste.

1" bubbly head.. nice cap and a surprising ring of lace.. the brew is only slightly hop-hazed pretty clear honey.. 

nose is lemon and tangerine zest dominated by pineapple hoppiness.. some grapefruit.. and just enough pale malts.

Mirrors the smell identically... huge fruity hop flavors... Kaffir lime leaves.. clean.. yet oily.. just enough pale malt goodness to bring the hops to their full glory... never ever goes over to the bitter side.. just very very drinkable.. body is fairly lite.

Bottle share at Ratebeer meet up, Cotteridge Wines, Cotteridge, Birmingham Saturday 5th March 2016   Pours clear amber in colour, good clarity, nice stinging bitterness, a little bitterness, tasty beer, really good stuff. Nice to try something like this as an alternative to the Imp stouts. A8 A4 T8 P4 Ov16 4.0

Maybe its too easy of a review, but this really does taste like a scaled-down version of Pliny the Elder. Theres the same clean, medium-low bodied malt base, and bright and piney hop presence. Im really glad to finally get a chance to try this -- cheers for sending it my way, Michael!

Draft at Lucky Baldwins in Pasadena. Pours golden orange with a white head. Herbal and mild grassy hops, faint citrus, and mild-moderate bitterness. I dont know if this is just an old keg or what, I mean its not bad, but Ive had like 10 better IPAs this month.

Blind pig 
De facto West Coast IPA. Cracker, dry, Grapefruit and happiness. Dry finish.

From a bomber. Pours golden and makes a beautiful white head. Aroma of citrus, hops, and barley. Some have called it a "Pliny the Youngest". Fitting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with me at The Sampler: pours clear bubbly gold with a white head. Aroma is light pine and angood bit of citrus. I was following a PLiny the Elder with this so perhaps some of the hops became attenuated. Nice bit of bitterness. Light aftertaste. Not very massive. Light bodied. Pretty nice.
Tap at russian river, santa rosa. Hazy deep golden color, white head. Aroma has lots of hops, fruits, citrus. Very fresh hoppy taste, fruity, citrus notes. Good ipa.
Had on tap at Monks Cafe. This beer was very good. Like a slightly lighter version of Pliny. Wish I could score a bottle of this!

Bottle with a BIG thank you to Rob, I actually got this as a gift ! Been wanting to try this for a very long time, heard multiple times its better than pliny . High expectations ! Pours clear blonde, small white head. Smell is intense , bitter ( pine ) hoppy, with a decent amount of aroma. taste is very full, intense pine, corny-malty back, very nicely done ! Hoppyness gives ( besides the pine ) some tropical fruit notes, a good amount of bitterness. The malty base is 100 % what it should be, and so are MF and Carbo. The only minor thing here is the fast-fading aftertaste. but given the ABV, I think its probably normal. Can really stand up agains PTE, I agree. But is it better? im not sure. It is more appreciatable though, since it is lower ABV. 

Thnx again, Rob !!!
Bottle. Pours a dark orange with a white head and strong hoppy, pine aroma. Taste is bitter, lots of hops, pine, caramel, citrus, and fruity notes into the bitter finish.

Pours a muddy orange rusty pour with a beige head. Nose is citrus and hoppy with pine and resin . Taste is hard pine and resin with citrus and bittersweet notes. Finishes dry on the same tasting notes with a bittersweet hoppy finish. Nice ! Quaff Score 8 / 10

Draught at Toronado, San Francisco. Almost clear orange colour, slim offwhite head. Grapefruity, mild orange zest, lightly resinous, sweet and smooth malty backbone. Good body, low-medium carbonation.

Tap at tornado. Mostly cleat golden coloured pour with a lasting white head. Aroma is a nice mixed bag of piney resinous hop, orange and citrus spice. Flavour is pale bready base grains, orange and pine, with a crisp finish. Palate is medium light, highish carbonation, light sticky hop juicy. So well balanced. Ultra drinkable.

Pours a clear golden yellow on tap with fluffy white head that dissipates to leave moderate lace. Aroma and taste are all hops, tropical citrus, pine, and big fruity notes. Clean, dry finish, malt presence very low, great American IPA.

Bottle poured a clear golden hue w/ medium white head. Moderate floral honey aroma. Initial flavor is light sweet w/ a moderate bitter finish. Tastes are grapefruit and clover. Light bodied.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aromas of fresh juicy hops and a sweet light berry sugar aroma. Thick flat white head and a light golden orange body. Flavors of fresh hops, some grassy lemon zest, and some minor rooty birch. Clean and crisp on the palate

Barwa złota, piwo klarowne, piana intensywna, ładnie zdobi szkło. Aromat intensywnie chmielowy, świeże niedojrzałe cytrusy mieszają się z zapachem świeżo skoszonej trawy, która z czasem dominuje. W smaku piwo jest niezwykle smukłe i ułożone. Żywiczne posmaki chmielu, karmel i średnio wysoka goryczka na finiszu.
Draft at Beachwood. Aroma of peach, pine and citrus, nice. Fresh fruity taste of citrus, mild pine, caramel and some tropical fruit. Very good IPA.

Thanks for sharing the bottle Jon. Pours a crystal clear, deep gold with a small off-white head. Light citrus on the nose with a nice deep pine aroma. Super clean on the palate with a watery mouthfeel (not too thin, but really quaffable). The citrus and pine notes are there, with a moderate bitterness that buzzes on the finish. Well-made for sure.

12/22/2009 12:59:38 PM Bottle from Cracked Kettle. Dark orange body with sticky head. Seriously hoppy nose. Taste of caramel, toffee and plenty of hops. A really smooth and delicious IPA. Among the best Ive ever had. Fantastically rich and smooth.
Believe it or not I had this when it was at brewery in Temecula. Still awesome. Tons of hops in aroma of citrus and grapefruit. Light malt balance. Always been a great 5 brew.
fantastic IPA had at Russian river. nose is citrus and Pine. flavor pretty much follows through on the nose. very quaffable enjoyable IPA

Tap / Tirador.
@ Monks Cafe, Philadelphia, PA, USA
A: Hazy golden / Dorado turbio.
T/S: Hops, citrusy, fruity / Lupulo, citrico, afrutado.
Colorful appearance with a good head when poured. Highly recommend even though IPA is not my favorite style. Worth the search if you can find it.
All day drinker ipa fresh oily hop aroma, golden pour bitter and green grass hoppy finish. Greatness.

Poured into a teku showing well filtered amber with sparse white foam. 

The nose shows a lot of sweet clean malts with clear notes of pine in the background. 

The palate is medium bodied and well carbonated. Flavors of light citrus but heavier on the pine and a clear IPA bitterness throughout. Drinks pretty standard.

510 ml bottled on 082615. Exactly two weeks old.

L: Clear golden in color. Small head quickly settled before I even get a chance to instagram it :) very nice lancing. Beautiful appearance for sure. 

S: Big fail. This one is not aromatic. If theres no date on the bottle I would assume this is pretty old. Very light citrus, light caramel and hint of pine. 

T: bland, reminds me of an old english-style ipa. I cant believe the hype of this beer. Theres a light spicy/herbal flavors that I cant describe but noting really unique. 

M: unpleasantly dry aftertaste, very bitter, and very light. Extremely drinkable but not sticky or juicy. Very good carbonation however, I really enjoyed that part. 

O: Maybe the most underwhelming drinking experience. Extremely overhyped beer. This is nothing close to a good ipa, definitely below average ipa.
I could drink this all day, poured an orange color with aromas and flavors of tropical fruit, light bready malt, some citrus, and hops. This stuff is great, wish it was distributed here.

On tap at Monks cafe, Philly. Pours deep golden with fluffy white head and nice lacing. Aroma is of citrusy hops, tropical fruit and bready malt. Body is full and tangy. Citrusy hops dominate the palate, while bready malt and ripe fruit provide support. Finish is long and dry. Excellent brew.

""""..."... """"..."...
"" this at the Russian River brewery. Was definitely

Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle, bottled on July 27, 2015, poured into a glass. Clear light orange with small white head. Aroma is herbal hops, medium/light body, medium/low carbonation, and a little big-bubble lacing. Taste is grapefruit, herbal hops, grassy hops, and slightly dry slightly bitter finish.

Tap pour at Produce Row. Little snifter 10 oz. Beautiful aroma from the onset with a great mix of subtle pine and citrus. Copper color with solid lacing and a quarter finger head. Mouthfeel is slightly oily but soft, smooth and wonderful. Nice blend of bitterness and sweetness almost pushing towards a double IPA. Aftertaste leans on those hops but doesnt feel like an overly hopped effort. Russian River delivers once again.
Light hop scents, and very light in color. Light hop flavors, with maybe a slight hint of malt. Solid IPA, but not quite as good when drinking side by side with Pliny the Elder.

On tap at Khyber Pass Pub in Philly. What else to add, delicious. Solid hop aroma of tangerine and pine. Same taste with lots of citrus like mango. Light amber color with a medium head and lacing. Nice sticky finish with a bit of hop smack. 7.00 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2015 Pours clear copper orange with medium white head. Head retention is good. AROMA: tons of tropical fruit, citrus, caramel, floral/herbal hops, pineapple, passion fruit, mango, slight green grapes, lightly malty, light spice, orange and light peppercorns. TASTE: pineapple, passion fruit, caramel, hop bitterness, citrus, orange, malty, spice, light peppercorns, grape acidity, mango, light herbs and tangerines. AFTER TASTE: spice, hop bitterness, citrus and caramel with an oily crisp dry finish.
Tried this last summer, easier to drink than pliny, went down very smooth, delicious aftertaste
Clear golden, light white head. Pine, honey, light citrus. Bitter, sweet. Medium body, longer finish. Good.

Stymied as to why this is rated so highly, other than perhaps because its from RR... Apricot-gold pour, small white head. Flavor and aroma are fresh, grassy, bitter, a bit floral with notes of toasted malt. A bit thin. Decent but nothing amazing.

Pours clear orange, white lacing. Aroma is pine, resin, hops hops hops. Taste is orange-grapefruit, caramel, wonderfully dry but not unbalanced. A straightforward and delicious West coast IPA that Im very fond of.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2016 Sampler at the brewpub in Santa Rosa. Hazy golden color with white head. Hoppy, not too fruity or resinous, more green. Some grapefruit though. Shallots/garlic, very surprising! Decent bitterness. A very different IPA!

Bottle, 2.5 moths old, courtesy of amazinwrldfood, many thanks! Very piney, grapefruit as well, nice toasty malt body, slightly spicy as well. Dry and soothing. Very classic West Coast IPA. The keg I got was probably not perfect.

500 mL bottle poured into a pint glass. Golden straw colored with a big white head. Hazy, but not sedimenty looking. Traces of head remain with loads of lacing. HOPS. Citrusy hops. Orange and grapefruit hops. No malt smells at all. HOPS. Citrusy hops. Orange and grapefruit hops. No malt taste at all. This is hop juice. The most pared down way of delivering hop flavor. Not even a hint of sweetness to make it easier to drink. As much as I like hop bombs, this isnt balanced at all. Its bitter, then its bitter, then its bitter some more. Because of the low malt character, its thin. Even for a single IPA, its very thin. The carbonation feels high, even though I dont think it is very high. Just the nature of ti makes it seem that way. It is what it is. If you want something that delivers as much hop flavor in a low ABV package as possible, this is it.
Piney, floral, bready/toasty malt backbone. Ultra dry, each sip invites another.

3 oz chilled pour from tap into cylindrical taster as part of Russian Rivers everything on tap sampled (16 beers this time around) at the brewery itself. I realize that drinking 16 different 3 oz pours is not ideal for proper rating, but when will I ever have an opportunity like this again?

Very flavorful, nice layers of hops. Citrus up front, then nice tropical fruit. Dry, sticky bitterness as well.

Draught @ Russian River. Pours clear pale yellow tiny white head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, citrus and fruity. Flavour is sweetish, light bitterness. Medium bodied, smooth texture, average carbonation. Finish balanced, clean, dry and more bitter than before.

On tap at Russian River. The pour is a beautiful golden orange color, clear, with a beautiful white dense head and some spectacular lacing. The aroma is great. Heavy hops and tropical fruits with a beautiful resin. The flavor is just as good. The juicy fruity hops explode on the front end and leave an awesome tropical fruit that rolls through the hops. The mouth feel is great. Viscous enough and softly carbonated so it still falls off the tongue, but slowly. The resin and bitterness come through on the aftertaste and carry out the finish with a touch of fruit. Excellent

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A melhor IPA que tomei até hoje, foi on tap em São Francisco no pub Urban Tavern ao lado do Hilton. Lá também tomei a Pliny the Elder.
Tap at toronado in San Francisco. Light copper with white head . Pine and citrus. Tastes like a really good typical ipa. No Pliny, but good. Would definitely be a standby if I lived here.

Bottle. Honey-colored with slight haze and one finger of sticky, frothy head. Soft fruitiness in the nose: juicyfruit, grass, orange pith, candied tangerine, skittles, a background of cracker malt. Hop flavor is more pithy and bitter, with less candy sweetness. Grass and grapefruit up front before a very clean, balanced finish. Medium body is like cotton balls, with softly peppery carbonation. A solid, balanced, clean IPA. Well-made and very drinkable.

Draught at the Russian River Brewing Co, Santa Rosa, CA.
Clear golden colour with a small white head. 
Cookies, sweet fruits, mild bitterness and small maltiness in the aroma. 
Strong hops, strong bitterness, fruits, pine and citrus hops in the flavour. Dry.
Smell is tropical fruit and hops. Taste is straight hops. Medium body, medium carbonation, and some foam.

Bottle 0.510l at the 7th Belgrade Beer Tasting all together finally.Taste with Alberto, Matt and Vlada.07.04.2015.Thank you so much luttonm for bringing this fresh bottle only 35 days old.Pour it almost clear golden color with small white head.On the nose nuts.Taste and aroma of fresh grass, pineapple, some spices.Perfect balanced and great flavour.
Draft. Darkish gold with a white head. Dominated by citrusy hops with a little pine. Crisp mouthfeel. Bright and fresh. Excellent.

Bottle at the 7th Tasting in Belgrade-Serbia, surprise surprise from luttonm after begging him for this one. Matt brought us a very fresh bottle, bottled on 02282015 just less 35 days old. Anyway...pours a bright hazy golden color, medium and lasting white cap. Nose: indian spices, orange peel (close to the Pliny the E.), lime-tangerine, a hint of amber malts. Mouth: balanced bitterness (a great execution), medium body, malty with a bit of a ham accent. Balanced!
on tap at the brewery; light amber color; citrusy, piney hop aroma; bitter piney hop flavor on a very light malt base; dry, bitter finish

Draught at Apex, PortlandHazy golden color, compact head. It has the lean pale malt backbone required to support a good hopping, with plenty of citrus fruits and a chamomile touch. Fresh.Excellent modern IPA.
Superb IPA great well balanced hops of pine peach mango and grass. Excellent carbonation with white head and lacing. Finishes of fresh hops. Excellent.
Absolutely, positively fantastic! Well balanced fresh hop flavors and aromas!
Bottle. Pours a clear orange with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is strong citrus and pine. Grapefruit, bitter hop bite, crushable.

Bottle into tulip. Minneapolis. 

Pours golden/amber, hazy, small white head. 

Aroma is great. Very tropical. Mango, pineapple, citrus. Apple. A little spicy. Malt notes. 

Taste is mildly sweet with a good level of bitter. Very clean. 

Body is medium, average carbonation. Medium finish.

Bottle. Darker golden, whitish head. Lemony juicyness, fresh summer meadow and tropical fruityness in aroma. Forresty resin notes and citrus too later on. Grassy bitters and some biting spicyness, feels a bit like some vanilla is present in taste. The tropical fruityness steps up a bit later on, still maintaining the bitterness. The drinkability is great here though

Sharp carbonation! Strong floral hops. Not as balanced, but the hop profile is so nice, I don't mind one bit. Just delicious. Nose of pine needles, sweet pineapple, wet moss. Improves as it warms/ loses carb.

---Rated via Beer Buddy App

Appearance: Bottled 26/1-2015. Golden orange, clear. Very nice, creamy head, good amount.
Aroma: Hops, citrus.
Taste: Nice hops, citrus. Very good balance and easy drinking.
Bought: Trade with Gregory - thank you very much!, 510 ml
Info: 14/3-2015

Ive threatened to not like it, because the thing to do seems to be to like it because of who makes it. This happens a lot, and Im feeling rather cynical and anti-establishment today. Of course, when I absorb a truly good brew, theres no helping it.
The cap is cracked with a bottle opener worthy of the bottle, coming straight from Russian River, and I pour a clear, ripe apricot-colored liquid into the glass. The blanket of foam on the surface is soft but dense, and reminds me of a heavily whipped meringue, coating the rim with a deep off-white head. As I drink, it slides down the glass, thick and creamy and never quite making it to the surface of the beer. This is sticky, dank, and the sprucy aroma is already finding its way to my senses.
The aroma is heady grapefruit and resin, a very light backdrop of caramel promising a rich flavor in the beer. I expect a jaw popping bitterness, but enjoy a nicely balanced liquid flowing over my tongue. This is bitter, yes, but also packed with a juiciness that combats that dryness you find in so many IPAs. The medium body is creamy, a bit sticky, and just buzzy enough to keep it from flat, AND from being overbearingly spritzy. The finish is fairly short and enjoyable, the aroma clinging to the taste, keeping it flavorful and very drinkable.
I will have to admit. This Sunday night beer cynic is excited that there is one more Blind Pig in the fridge!

UPDATED: APR 27, 2015 This is a secret weapon of an IPA drink it now! I drank this right after Pliny The Elder and it more than held its own........ too close too call! Neither are the same as the other just a great beer and Im far from a hop lover.
Bottle. Pours clear golden Amber with bright white head. Nose and taste is lots of pine and citrus. Lasting pine bitter aftertaste. Good.
Bottle at home. Color is golden with a light white head. Aroma is fresh, piney and citrus hops. Taste is smooth and very light. Very nice beer!

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2015 On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear golden color. Small white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, but less than the Younger. Mango, pineapple, papaya, biscuit malt. Flavor is malty and hoppy. But very pronounced pine character. Like a less hoppy version of Younger. But still amazing. This is an incredible IPA.

Bottles dated 012615 so about three weeks old. Thanks spence for this. Pours a clear golden with a pillowy 1/2" head. Aroma is dank hops with a huge dose of pine. Some prefer this to pliny and I couldnt argue either way. Flavor is rich, resinous, piney hops notes with sweet bready malt. Theres a slight bitterness on the backend but Id be nitpicking to say this is a detriment to this beer. I love this beer every time I have it.

On tap @ Pi Bar, San Francisco - CA. Color: clear blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: hoppy domination and fruity with grassy finish. Taste: nice hoppy taste, really good equilibrium. Fruity taste and grassy finish. Aftertaste: wet bitterness and strong grassy finish. Really good IPA a must to try.

From bottle to glass. Two weeks old from the brewery. Citrus, pine and moderate sweet malt aroma. Clear deep gold with full white head that lingers throughout. Great combination of citrus and pine, with malt supporting well.

On Draft @ APEX, Portland, OR. Lots of Mango, and Citrus. Another great IPA from RR.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Taster at Russian River. Pours clear yellow; lemon head. Nose is mango, citrus, grapefruit, pine resin, orange peel, and caramel. Flavour is rich in mango, citrus, hops, caramel, and roasted malts. Another awesome IPA from here!
Aroma is mostly mango, very unique... Taste is mango, grapefruit and some pine, very good!

Another perfect brew from here. Great mango hop aroma. Hop flavor continues nicely throughout whole experience. Not super bitter but super hoppy. Nice lively carbonation that brings out all the hop nuances nicely.

23/XII/14 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle from a trade @ home - BB: n/a, bottled: XI/11/14 (2014-1527) Thanks to JefVerstraete for the trade!
Clear orange beer, big creamy irregular head, white, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: lots of citrus, bit piny, pineapple, bit sweet, caramel, malty touch, spicy notes. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: bitter, grapefruit, bit piny, citrus, pineapple, soft malty touch, some caramel. Aftertaste: citrus, little bitter, grapefruit, more bitterness, malty ending with some caramel. Very balanced, nice stuff!

Bottle at home from a trade with fellow Beoir members, couriered by Reuben, cheers all![brbottled 1st Dec 14Pours hazy pale amber, fluffy beige head and bright tropical fruits (passion fruit, yuzu) on the nose. Medium body and carbonation, fruity, moderately bitter, plenty of fruityness with an undertone of digestive malt, very easy drinking.
Arômes de pins, de sapin avec une légère base de caramel. En bouche corps moyen qui supporte parfaitement lamertume et les saveurs bien dosés de houblon sapinés. Excellent

On tap @ Russian River. Pours bright golden copper with thin lacy white head. Aroma is light crisply sweet caramel malt, fresh medium hops with notes of grass, pine, and earth. Taste is similar - crisp light caramel malt and lots of hop flavor. I get notes of grapefruit, pine, and lemon. Super flavorful, and very impressive given the light body and abv. Just like Pliny, this has the flavor that other beers add +1-2% abv trying to accomplish. Really fresh tasting too, not surprising given Im at the brewpub...

Pours clear gold with fairly active carbonation, white head. Aroma is floral and tropical fruity. Very light body, super crisp and clean. All hops, lots of tropical and floral, pine, and even a little cat pee (simcoe?). Excellent.
nice malty backbone...crispy clean...very hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, peach with a heavy dry and bitter finish. Really nice beer.

Draft at Toronado. A solid IPA of the very bitter vs very flavorful variety. Solid malt backbone, on the lighter side, citrus and pine hops and a long bitter finish. On the dry side. Clean and not a hint of off flavors. Went well with the sausages from Rosamunde.

From the tap at Toronado in San Francisco. Pour is clear apple juice golden with a thin head. Nose is citrus, tropical fruits with lots of floral hops. Taste is loads of fresh floral hops and citrus flavors with a long crisp bitter finish. Solid caramel malt backbone. Great IPA!
Pours clear deep gold, white head. Aroma is piney, bread, resiny hop, citrus, faint lemon & grass. Flavor is clean pine & citrus hop, clear caramel malt. so freeeesh and clean.
Another solid IPA from Russian River. Not too intense and not too absent, this is a great go-to brew for nearly any occasion.

Exceedingly fresh dry hop flavors. Surprisingly bright & citrusy while also piney and resinous (without the least hint of syrupy-ness). Killer IPA. So glad to have tried it on a snowed-in night with friends in northern Vermont.

Bottle. Pours murky orange with thin white head that lingers. Nice hop aroma over light carbonation. Hop forward but limited complexity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from a trade. Thanks Wyatt! Orange cloudy colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Aroma of flowers, honey and passion fruit. Light sweet, bitter hoppy finish. Well balanced and easy drinkable. Good IPA!

From draft, very full creamy head. Orange Amber appearance. The look of this beer is tops. Hoppy, not quite Pliney level but a full hoppy balanced beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
solid IPA. One of the few where the aroma is better than the taste. If you are somewhere that has Russian River, get a Pliny instead. this is very good just not as great as the Pliny.

Bottle given by friend kaiser. Bottled on 10/07/2014.

Aroma - Amazing tropical aroma. 

Appearance - orangish color with light fluffy head. 

Taste - Very good taste - missing a titch of body, but very solid.

Palate - lingering fizzy carbonation. 

Overall - a top notch beer. Worthy of the rating.

(bottle) slightly hazy deep golden colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of heavy resin and some caramel, with some hints of green tea, grapes, some gooseberries, cherries and vanilla. flavour is mostly caramel and gooseberries, with more vanilla, herbal hops, a light hint of alcohol, some buttered pale malts and a light-bitter citric finish. medium- to heavy-bodied with average carbonation.
on tap oro intenso agrumata discreto corpo nota fruttata buon amaro finale lieve pepato

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2015 Draft pour at Belmont Station. Pours a golden color with a foamy consistent head throughout. Really piney aroma. Piney bitter hops throughout. A bit of grapefruit as well. My mind isnt blown here, but this is a solid IPA overall. Enjoyed this.

Its been a while since I had tried this, so I tried again on draft at Baileys Taproom.  5 oz pour.  Bottom of the keg, but still very much worth it.  Glowing clear golden pour with a lasting foam head.Very nice hop aroma.  All the same pine that I remember before, but dont recall as much bitterness.  Was pretty good, but less impressed this time around.

Lets start with the good/great: big hops that are fruity and pine. A bit of soap,slick oily mouth feel, a dry finish, and very easy drinking. Orange in color with sticky white head. Would have liked it to be a bit bigger, because it would be the perfect IPA then . However, this is still a damn fine one as it stands.
GABF week, 2014. I think I had this at Falling Rock. Big, fresh hop aroma and flavor. Lots of bitter hops; citrus and pine; giving this beer intense flavor; and light malt sweetness. Excellent.

On tap. Pours a hazy gold/copper with moderate head. Aromas of rubber, pine, resin, tropical fruit and sweet malts. Flavors of muted oranges, toast, pine and gritty toasted malts. Nice. Could be a go to beer if available.

16.9 ounce bottle from the brewery, born 10/23, citrus pine aroma, medium lasting head.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

RR has the hurdle of living up to the hype every time one of their beers is tried for the first time. Make no mistake, this is a great IPA; however, there are a lot of breweries out there that now make great IPAs as well, which can tend to diminish what is a good representation of the style, secificaly west coast IPAs. Nice citrus hoppy nose. Stand caramel color. Bright, crisp palate. Strong bitterness. The thing that stands out is the balance this beer has, which is still tough to do.
Golden color with a white head. Fruit, citrus, and pine hop aromas. Slight sweetness on the palate. Excellent balance.

On tap at Russian River. Pours golden yellow with white head and lace. Aromas of pine and a lingering grapefruit and citrus. Taste follows the nose and finishes crisp and bitter without being overpowering.

Bottle pour. Cloudy orange with white head. Some webbing. Dusty aroma. Caramel malt offset earthy hops. Orange and resin. Rustic and inviting. Taste does not disappoint. Hops pack a velvet gloved punch: bitter yet gentle. Wheat and citrus. Good amount of resin. Very drinkable. Enjoyed.

Aroma: intense flowers, tropical fruits, light grass. Appearance: clear gold, small, creamy, white head. Taste: light bitter and sweet. Palate: bitters intensify, grass and flowers, but a nice sweetness remains of tropical as well, getting a little dry in the finish. Overall: very nice IPA, great aroma and palate. Pint at Neighbourhood, San Diego.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2017 a little light in color, but a nice fluffy white head. a wonderful resinous hop aroma, but at first the flavor wasnt as clean, and bracingly bitter. that, however, did not last long. as the beer opened up, the flavor grew more complex. Fresh piney hop flavor everywhere, with a hint of peppery spice and malty sweetness for balance. the body was a touch thin, but that was more than offset by its incredible smoothness and drinkability. deserving of its place among the best of the "regulaR" IPAs."
2016/17 has not been the same the last couple times.  Maaaaybe a 4.  Gotta doc a tenth to 4.3.
Clear dark gold color. Honey, flowery notes, some citrus in the nose. Taste is similar to the smell. Super super dry. Delicious.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Blind tasting, of Double IPAs & Single IPAs.

List of Double IPAs, in prefered order: The Crusher, Heady Topper, Pliny The Elder, Deviant Dales

List of Single IPAs, in prefered order: Focal Banger, Grapefruit Sculpin, Moralité, Blind Pig

A  Very clear light orange.

S  Grapefruit, classic IPA, with some floral notes.

T  Very much light, fruity, a bit less dry than the others, semi-sweet.

M  Quite thin, medium to high carbonation.

O  The worst of the bunch, but still great.

Draft pint. Clean golden pour, thin white head. Aroma is pine, bright citrus, hints of tropical fruit and a light caramel. Taste is assertively bitter, grassy, lots of fresh orange zest and hints of grapefruit juice. Crisp, refreshing, easy drinking, but full of flavor.

Draft at Torenado SF. Pours a deep golden orange. Fucking hop bomb - loads of pine and citrus on the nose. Taste is piney resin up front with a lasting bitterness that holds superbly. Fucking bitter. Not as easy to drink compared to pliny. Pretty damn tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very piney with a super bitter finish. A hop bomb in all the right ways. Some sweet malt and sugarcane as well. Gold pour with good head and lacing. Tap at Monks Cafe.
Clear golden in color, hoppy, light head, bitters prevalent, very good ipa, fun to try

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2014 Draft at RRBC. Clear gold, head recedes but lingers. Sweet citrus slightly tropical hop aroma, some malt notes. Medium sweet bready malt then fairly big bitterness, resin, touch of floral, orange lemon grapefruit citrus and some mango pineapple tropical. Medium body, softish carb. Really good but pretty understated, very drinkable. Plenty of complexity to keep you coming back.

Bottle. Aroma is a clean, dank hop. Appearance is a light bronze with good lacing. Taste is hoppy with a dank finish. Very effervescent and refreshing. Palate is light hops. Overall, a great IPA. Very much rivals the elder.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A fresh bottle poured into a globe.


A - Pours deep amber orange with a nice pillow one finger tall white head, dissipating down to next to nothing, leaving spotty lacing down the glass.


S - Tons of citric hops up front with a nice lightly toasted caramel malt core. A bit grassy with some sweetness creeping in as it begins to warm up. Very nice stuff.


T - Nice citric hop bite up front is balanced out well with a nice mix of caramel malt sweetness and crisp tropical fruits. Finish is a bit dry with some nice lingering hop bitterness. Much better this time, still one of my all time favorites but I still prefer elder to the pig.


M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Nice light, refreshing, feel on the pallet. Finish has some lingering bitterness but nothing too over the top.


D - Very high. Blind pig has very good balance with plenty of drinkability left over. I love this stuff but I still prefer elder a bit more.

Poured from a 500 ml bottle dated 09/02/3014. 
Aroma is very hoppy with a nice tropical fruit and citrus character balanced by some pine resin. Light cracker and biscuit malt notes. 
Pours a fairly clear, golden color with a hint of orange and copper hues. Moderately sized, somewhat thick, white head. Moderate lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is slightly sweet with a medium light cracker and pale malt character. Moderately strong bitterness with a rather dry finish. Some moderately strong hop flavor with some citrus and pine resin. Faint tropical fruit. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a really nice IPA with some great hop notes. Really nice, light but balanced malt profile that adds just a touch of complexity.
Yuck. What hopheads brewed this? Honestly, I'm just about ready to quit IPAs...

Great aroma of hops, slightly floral with citrus undertones. Great looking with an amber color and a medium white well laced head. Extremely good balanced taste of hops, weed with dry feel and a distinctive weed aftertaste

Poured from a bottle. Clear golden color, small white head. Nice oil floral nose. Medium body with a light hops flavor and a nice light finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a bottle. Small head little lacing. Attractive golden yellow color. Floral citrust aroma.
Bottle - Pours amber color. Smells of grapefruit, oranges, and lemons. Taste is well balance with more citrus flavors. Its so good!!!
Perfection..wonderful pine grass wet lawn and pine with slight minty notes. pretty full body for an ipa, thats why i love this brew. ++++A+++++
500ml bottled on 8/14/14. Golden yellow body. Aroma contains notes of pineapple and (oddly enough) marijuana. Flavor shifts to pine, cantaloupe, and earth. Balanced and interesting, will buy again.
Sampler @ RR. Clear yellow colour. Citrus and pine aroma anf flavour, nice ipa

Draft at the source!! Clear yellow, aroma is awesome!! Little bit of everything, citrus, floral and light traces of pine. I held off on trading for this bottle because I didnt want a bottle... Needed it from the source. Light and refreshing with a lighter body but nice lingering pine bitterness. Light lingering floralness .... Real nice, glad I waited, nice!

Had a little while back thanks to Weezel. Color is golden with anice light white head. Aroma is fresh of piney and citrus hops. Taste is smooth and very light. IPAs are hit and miss for me and no surprise this one hit big for me.

Bottle. Pours a clear, lambent gold with a high, white, lacy head. Nose is elegantly delightful -- kaffir lime, geraniums, fir, and rosemary. Crisp on the front of the tongue, with well-balanced bitterness; butterscotch and caramel malt comes in on the mid-palate, neatly segueing into citrus cleansing astringency on the back of the mouth. The finish is long, herbal, and damn near perfect. Is there, like, someone at Russian River who can talk to hops plants or something? This stuff gets scary after a while.
Amber pour with a small white head. Aroma is big citrus peel, pine, and tropical fruit hops. Flavor is similar with a bitter hoppy finish but not overwhelming. Another great beer from Russian River.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2016 Amber color with a one finger head. Aroma is citrus, grapefruit and tropical fruits. Taste is citrus and tropical fruits. A nice bitterness but well balanced. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Finally get to try this after a trade with mdg164, thanks! 5 week old bottle. Pours orange gold with a big clingy white head. Aroma is soft, grapefruit and pine resin on top of caramel. Mildly caramel malt backbone gives way to grapefruit and pine resin hop. Oily grapefruit peel hop bitterness in the finish. This is essentially PtE light.

Fad: Taster og pint på brewpub. Orangegul klar øl. Meget frisk, med masser af citrus og bitterhed. Gammeldags IPA med for meget bitterhumle. Superfrisk og ellers lidt kedelig i forhold til forventningerne.

On tap at the RR Brewpub.

A: golden amber; excellent clarityr. Somewhat weak head still leaves good lacing. 

Aroma: mild for style; floral with hints of herbs and honey.

Flavor: some light malts evident in the finish and aftertaste. 

Feel: smooth; body is light for style; rather low carbonation. 

O: excellent excepting mouthfeel.
Very nice IPA. Beautiful medium amber color. Lots of pine and grapefruit on the nose. Light malt in taste. Higher carbonation. An excellent beer, but I should have had it before the pliny.

On tap at toronado. Pours a clear gold. Aroma of pine, grapefruit, resin. Taste is similar. Very refreshing. Nice carb and crispness with an oily mouthfeel from hops. Really solid IPA 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At Belmont station in Portland with Taylor, Stephen, and Dina. Pours bronze golden with layer of white head. Aroma is fresh earthy and some spicy hops, mild resinous green notes. Taste is soft hops, full bodies malty grainy bite. Finish is delicious and subtle. I like it a lot. Would session all day.

Draft at monks cafe in Philly. Hoppy, dark citrus, pine, strong bitter finish with a sticky resin note that lingers. Interesting combination of flavors and mouthfeel with a pretty high carb. Strong spice bite on the finish that stands out. Very good. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden (lagerish) pour. Aroma is mild hops, not massive fruits. taste is hops, mild (sessional) sweetness, crisp floral bitterness. Finish is perfect - leaves you wanting more. Overall, a lovely India Pale.

Poured on tap at Urge. Golden amber color with medium soapy white foam. Aromas of pine, grass, bisquit and a little citrus. Taste is much of the same and very resinous. Finish is dry and has a lingering bitterness.

Strange that Ive never rated this one before. Bottled on 060314 - Pours a fine white head. Body is crystal clear light orange. Pine resin very prevalent in the aroma. No doubt this is an IPA! Obvious hop character in the flavor as well. Bitterness lingers on the palate. But, its not huge. Nice normal mouthfeel. I actually like it 100 times better than Pliny the Younger!
had on tap at the brewery. of everything i tried there this was the least impressive. was a good beer but did not great.
Soft piney and citrusy hop aromas. Orange-gold with a mostly lasting white head. Dry, almost perfectly balanced between earthy hops and honeyed malts. Light-medium bodied.
Hops, fruit, pineapple, summer aromas. Very juicy. Smooth creamy body. Refreshing. Delicious.

Pours a nice golden hue with a good amount of fizzy head. Some sweetness in the aroma from the malt with some good citrus and floral hop notes as well. A great balance between hops and malt in the flavor, which has the same notes as in the aroma. Finishes clean. A really great balanced IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Petaluma market. Grapefruit, tropical fruits aroma. Nice clear golden brown, bit of carbonation. Good fluffy white head. Taste is grapefruit and some citrus, bitter finish which stays alive for a bit. Tasty.

Bottle @ home shared with Dutchdrebus and Ansjelaah. Thanks to Lothore. Clear orange golden color, decent sized white head that leaves fair lacing. Aroma is lightly malts, lovely hoppy, floral and fruity all together. Taste is about the same: lightly malts, a lovely hoppyness, a nice floral touch, good fruityness and fruit hops, a good bitterness and quite well balanced. Well, maybe its the night which has been great so far, or the beer is just as good as the weighted average suggests it is, but I really like it!

Bottle @ benzai. Clear yellow with a medium sized white head. Smells lovely hoppy, fresh, fruity, apricot.. Nice! Tastes bitter, hops, fresh, fruity, pineapple, grapefruit. Beers like this are just amazing. Medium body, perfect carbo, crisp carbo. Great beer.

Tasted from draft. Pours a clear gold with white head. Lots of lacing. Aroma is very citrus hopping. Tons of tropical and citrus fruits with a small piney nose. Taste is incredibly smooth and well balanced. Excellent malt backbone with the fruity hop flavor. Medium bodied. Love the citrus and tropical fruit flavors with a caramel malt backbone. Incredible IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Solid beer. Shared with me by a friend. Pour was sort of orange and relatively clear. Aroma of citrus and pine and the taste follows the nose. I picked up on some other fruits in there as well. Maybe some mango and tropical fruits. Easy drinking, medium body, well-balanced bitterness and dryness.

Bottle at home, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small stable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, fruity, bitterness.
TASTE: hoppy, fruity, bitter, florar, nice dry and bitter aftertaste. Very nice brew!
Is there anything Russian River cant brew right?

Bottle, thanks to Bytemesis, pours a clear golden amber with a two finger head and nice lacing. Aromas of citrus, grapefruit, pine, and a little bread. Taste is medium bitter with hints of sweetness with a clean finish. Tasty!

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2015 On draft at Falling Rock. Clear golden pour with thin white head and lacing. Beautiful floral and citrus notes on the nose. So well balanced and smooth. Fantastic IPA... Delicious! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone.  Updated at Neighborhood in SD...  Even better than I remember ...  Great IPA!
Dry finish. Good carbonation. Flavours are citrus and some grapefruit. Some hints of caramel.
Such a well built beer. Great balance of malt and hops. Not particularly hoppy although there is good palate length. Dry with some pine and mild citrus to finish.

Tap at Toronado. One of the big ones, for sure. Light orange no head but quite a bit of lacing. Nose was pretty quiet, some pine. Notes of citrus fruit, some sweeter notes and lots of earthy bitterness. Tastes were full body with lively carbonation and lasting bitterness. My mouth was pretty beat up after a night of great beers, love to try this again with less wear and tear.

Nice golden pour with thick white head that leaves nice lacing. Great hoppy, citrusy aroma and a taste that carries the aroma. Citrusy, piney and carries hop flavor wonderfully. Very nice!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Good beer, pours orange with a large white head, smells of loads of citrus with some fruity notes, the beer is not very bitter for an IPA it taste of citrus up front with some bitterness in the back with some fruit notes lingering.

Bottle courtesy of Mashmaster. Tropical fruit, floral hops, and biscuity malt aroma. Hazy golden yellow with a moderate white head. Tropical fruit, citrus, grapefruit/piney hops flavor. Medium body, moderate carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2014 Pours golden yellow with enough rocky white tiger. Aromas of pine and a lingering grapefruit and citrus. Taste follows the nose and finishes crisp and bitter without being overpowering.

Bottle from Lothore, thank you very much Tyler. Pours a white, froth head, with a honey-golden color.

Fresh aromas of tropical, fruity hops, peach, orange and mango, along with honeyed pine and smooth caramel - finely nuanced with hints of citrus peel.

Fresh, fruity hops are hovering above a sweet, honeyed malt backbone, while hints of lime acidity becomes detectable underneath. Hops sting the palate in a refreshing, dry fashion, without ever getting too aggressive. Honeyed, piny, malts wrap up the hops in a well balanced way, along with wisps of whitebread and grass, still, this beer is huge on the bitterness. The taste results in a smooth, dry ending, which is very bitter and hop driven, as malts tend to vanish. Finishes with hops lingering on the palate for a long time, developing a fascinating pleasant depth, as they turn from being fruity to a more bitter, dry impression. A classic IPA, focused on the bitterness, fantastic balanced.

500ml bottle picked up at the brewpub, bottle date 5.12.14. Golden orange with a good sized, almost white head. Nose was a nice balance of malt and citrus, taste was very dry and on the bitter side. Medium bodied with a nice abrupt finish, for sure one of the best ones.

Stinging bitter eats-through-your-teeth style ipa. Very dry but very good! I had this super fresh and you can definitely tell this is the way to drink it. Its got that brutal yet delicate hop flavor that clearly would deteriorate with age. Overall I like it a lot, its not something you see every day in Michigan and the exoticism of the whole ordeal makes it even better. Im glad I got a chance to try this!

Got a bottle of this from a trade. It poured a golden Crystal clear color with a small off white head. It both smells and tastes interesting. Very hoppy with a mellow citrus/grapefruity taste/smell. Very good.
Poured a golden orange color. Notes of grapefruit and pine. These follow through to the taste with some slight tropical notes. Dry and bitter back end. Nice body to this as well.

Another beautiful looking beer from RR. Pours golden with small bubbles. Looks like a can of squirty cream has been emptied on top the body, such is the proud, stout white head. 
Aroma is a little withdrawn. Watery citrus, pine, a little onion and some spicy notes. 
Flavor is similarly introverted. Theres a gaping hole in middle-palate where taste should reside. Some citrus, a little grass and evolving pine. Malt presence almost non-existent. Maybe a mousy biscuit malt, but nothing more. The subdued flavor allows a cleared gangway for a frighteningly bitter finish. It becomes a little attritional and soapy towards the bottom of the glass. Decent but badly outshone by its older, bigger DIPA brother.

Pours golden with little to no head. Hint of sweet, bitter just like a west coast IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Another incredible ipa from Russian river. Super smooth and hoppy. Pours a bright yellow incolor. Smells incredible 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the brewery. Golden. White head. Hop and grapefruit nose. Medium bitter. Medium amount of frizzy carbonation. A bit thin body. Grapefruit, some lemon, hop, pine, grass flavour. Feels a bit too watery to be perfect.

Aroma: Herbal, Cascade and/or Centennial grapefruit-y citrus. Sweet, light caramel; lightly bitter. 
Flavor :Sweet, citrus fruit. Substantial, pleasant bitterness.

Draught at Toronado, San Diego. Clear golden color, decent offwhite head. Hoppy citrus flavor, pine, grassy, hay, pine apples, mango. Hoppy floral flavor, grassy, passion fruit, hay, rather bitter. Fresh hoppy citrus finish.

Fresh bottle. Pours clear orange with quarter inch of white head. Aroma is orange, lemon, grapefruit, watermelon, dish soap, strawberry. Taste is bold and hoppy...hop presence is great. Slightly bitter draw. Resiny. Juicy and lingers on the palate.
UPDATED: FEB 7, 2017 Great IPA. Really filling. Very refreshing and great with jalapeno?s! Complimented the spicy very well. Citrusy and beautiful. On tap at Churchill?s San Marcos.

On tap in San Diego (CA)

As if making a decision were not hard enough Toronado put this up against some other world class IPAs. Finally I decided to just pick one and go for it. This being the winner I was rewarded with a fantastic IPA that straddles the session line delicately. I cant wait for the day I actually get to make it to the brewery and try these drafts on site.

Aroma / Appearance - A caramel base and offwhite vanilla head trap about 60% of the light that filters through. Like sticky flypaper it idly sits waiting for unsuspecting rays to float past. Warm earthy hops lend a bright feel that is rich in citrus and resin. Aggressive and effective this does not go for subtlety.

Flavor / Palate - Resin and creamy malt accompany a full bodied profile. Wheat, earthy notes, citrus, and more slowly unfold as they travel over the tongue to the back of the throat. The slow release gives everything a chance to build to an even stronger intensity. The bitterness that results is never harsh or acidic. Instead this is a nice go to beer for transitioning between lighter styles and higher gravity offerings.
March 24, 2014 - on tap at the Stone bistro. Clear golden orange pour with some head and lacing. Aroma was piney and citrus hops. Taste was more citrus, but the piney hops came out in finish.
From bottle, pours clear golden color with a white head. Smells of pine and citrus hops. Flavor is really hoppy with some citrus. Full body and a nice dry finish.
On tap @ RR. Hazy orange with a solid white head. Aroma and flavor of resin, pine needles, grapefruit, fruit juice, and light caramel. Body and finish are well balanced between bitter and sweet.
MMMM MMMM good. Another fine beer from Russian river. Excellent example of an IPA.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a pale amber color without much head. Full hop flavor and yet so mild. A great IPA.

Tap at West End. Pours clear light copper with small, fine white head. Settles fairly quickly with sheets of thin lace. Aroma is resinous, floral hops, mild citrus. Flavor is mellow citrus, piney hops up front, fading into a malty, mildly nutty finish. More balance than expected, but also milder than expected. Clean but nothing groundbreaking. Moderate carbonation, light body and crisp texture.

Pours light orange with a light pine hoppy aroma. Body is very floral and citrusy and finishes light and smooth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from the brewery. Bottled 2-24-14 and poured on 3-4-14. Oooh fresh. Pours to my wine glass a mostly clear golden copper color with a very creamy one finger white head on top. Classic grapefruit and pine aroma, some mango and pineapple, more pine and grass. Flavor is sweet tropical fruits behind massive pine bitterness. Resinous mouthfeel, medium carbonation, and extremely smooth. I do see why this is so loved, and it is quite a fantastic IPA with a lot of heft despite the lowish ABV. Good stuff.
im not an IPA person, but as the style goes, this one was pretty mild. better than Pliny, i think.
Great IPA. I'd say it's #4 behind Heady Topper, Pliny the Elder, and Ginger Peach Jai Alai.

Poured from tap to glass. Golden hue with nice white head. Aroma is citrus, pine, sugar, orange, tangerine, lemon. Taste is sweet initially with a nice bitter finish. Mouthfeel is nice with medium body and good carbonation. Overall this is a great IPA.

Bottled on Feb 4, 2014. Thin white head of varying sized bubbles with very minimal carbonation. Light and fruity aroma with lots of citrus, a hint of rubber on a deep inhale, cereal grains and some pine sap. Color is clear bright gold. Flavor is light and crisp and really accentuates the hops. Lots of bitterness and toasted malts, dried flowers, a bit of grapefruit pith and some chalky grains. Not overpowering anywhere. Just really tasty and bitter. Finishes dry and grainy with some lingering pine. A very good IPA! Thanks Fredward!!

Bottle 20 days old from the brewery continuously refrigerated. Pours light gold with decent lace. The aroma is very lovely fresh light citrus and pine, lighter tropical hops. The flavor is perfectly balanced biscuity sweetness, pithy and piny bitterness. The feel is light and fresh but still has substantial body and tight carbonation with a nice cooling super clean bitter end. It seems so simple and common at first but it is also so remarkably clean, well expressed, and in harmony that only outstanding marks are deserved.

510 ml bottle- Pours clear golden with a huge three finger head with great retention. Aroma is hops, pungent and citrusy, grapefruit, sweet malt backbone. The taste is sweet up front, citrus and floral, dry bitter finish. Good beer, like a smaller version of the two plineys.

17.25 oz bottle bought at the brewery. Bottled 2/4/14, a little over two weeks ago. Aroma is dank, piney, lemon rind--totally reminiscent of both Plinys. Pours almost clear golden with a thick off-white rocky head with excellent retention; curtains of lace sheet the glass. Taste is more earthy than the Plinys, but it has the same citrusy piney dank character those beers have. Thinner than I expected, which is fine. Excellent IPA.

Bottle from @VanS. Really fresh hop aroma that spills out of the glass. Color is fizzy golden with little head. Taste is good hop punch up front with a very clean taste. Wish there was just a little more malt in the background, but this is pretty good stuff.

Draft at the brewery. Pours a clear light amber color with a thin off white head. Aroma is quite pungent, lots of tropical fruit hops, peaches, apricot. Flavor is excellent with a slight funk to it. Mildly bittersweet with something else, cant quite place it. Mild bittersweet lingers into the finish with a continued funk. Tasty, but no Pliny.

500ml boostle from bytemesis. Thanks! Pours an almost clear gold with a 2 finger white head. Aromas of tropical fruit and pine sap. Taste is bitter first and foremost, with some residual sweetness. Brings a decent amount of juicy hop expression with its goopy fruit, but you can tell the recipe is dated... not next level beats like the newer trend of IPAs. Finishes semi sweet with huge bitterness, semi abrasive. Not bad, not mind blowing. Perhaps a trend setter back in the day but its old news now.

Pours a clear, gold color similar to the color of a Dortmunder Export lager. Aroma is citrusy with a hint of garlic. This is a fresh beer purchased from the brew pub so I will attribute the garlic to simcoe hops. The palate is wonderfully easy to drink and similar to Pliny's palate. Great, drinkable ipa.

Brillant IPA. Pours yellow to orange Gold with a nice White Head and a Perfect carbonation. Tastes intense but well Balanced. Moderate bitterness.
Big Hype about this beer - was quite sceptic but definetly Worth a try.

From bottle Almost 1 month old. A liitle Too bitter for me. Pine taste not so much the smell.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is a fantastic beer. Nothing Russian River Company does is bad. I had this beer in Portland Oregon. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle (bottled 12/26/13) poured into a tulip. Pours a clear light honey yellow with almost a finger of off-white head, nice lacing. Good carbonation. Aromas of pine/resin, citrus, floral notes, tropical fruit. Tasting notes of pine/resin, floral hops, citrus, light caramel and bread. Semi-dry finish with a medium body.

Glass, 20 ounces, draught, at Twist Wine Co. during a trip to Portland (Oregon), savoured on January 17 2014; eye: orangey with a coppery hue, clear, no effervescence, tiny ring of tan head; nose: tangerine, Cointreau, resinous hops, pine, malt; mouth: tangerine, Cointreau, resinous hops, pine, malt, light residual sugar, finale in hops with presence of orange, medium-full body, below-average carbonation, mildly sweet, mildly bitter, lightly sticky texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Verre, 20 onces, en fût, bue chez Twist Wine Co. lors dun voyage à Portland (Orégon), savourée le 17 janvier 2014; il : orangée avec une teinte cuivrée, limpide, pas deffervescence, petit anneau de mousse blanc cassé; nez : tangerine, Cointreau, houblon résineux, pin, malt; bouche : tangerine, Cointreau, houblon résineux, pin, malt, léger sucre résiduel, finale en houblon avec présence dorange, corps moyen-corsé, carbonatation sous la moyenne, moyennement sucrée, moyennement amère, texture légèrement collante; en résumé : bien
Very good but doesnt hold a candle to the elder. Pleading, great color and texture - but doesnt hace the goods
Loved this one. Nice hoppy piney citrus taste very well balanced and smooth. One of the best Ive had. Smelled of grapefruit, citrus and pine. Nice hazy golden color with a slight creamy head.
On tap at Toronado, SF. Juicy fruity hop aroma - wow! Taste is incredibly well-balanced; fruity, with a moderately bitter finish. I loved this!

500ml bottle shared at home. Hazy orange pour, good white head. Bg hoppy nose, resin and pine, grapefruit. Taste has more bitterness, light caramel malt sweet, but very light. All about the hops. Good.

The beer pours a clean, crisp golden color with orange tinges. It forms a head of eggshell white bubbles of a medium size, which sit nicely above the beer at about a half fingers width. In body, the beer is clean and clear with just a touch of haze. On the nose, the beer smells of big orangey pine. Smooth caramel malt blends over the rich hop aroma, giving a sweet kick to the citrus nose. Touches of grapefruit and citrus rind also make their way into the nose to suggest the more bitter qualities of the beer. The smell is not overly pungent, but is nice and nuanced. On the tongue, the beer tastes nicely bitter with a smooth sweet backbone that brings rich balance to the beer. In terms of Pliny, I feel the bitters more in Blind Pig but I know there are less bitters overall than there were in Pliny Citric acidity is also found in the taste, and is light and playful on the sides of the cheeks. In flavor, the beer begins as aspirin bitters and then opens into rich, bitter grapefruit and orange. Wisps of toast and caramel dance on the sides of the palate, but this beer is all about the bitters, which are strong yet balanced. The finish is of fresh orange juice with a touch of bitter aspirin and grass. In the mouth, the beer feels on the light side of medium with a gently prickly, higher carbonation and a crisp, snappy mouthfeel. It leaves the mouth dry with a light bitter resin and some saliva in the cheeks. Overall, Blind Pig is a great, classic IPA. It is all about the citric bitters, which I really enjoy. Terrific balance is seen here, similarly to Pliny, but in a way that seems to accentuate the bitters more. Head to head with Pliny, I think I liked Pliny more, this is a solid beer with great flavors, but doesnt really wow me in any way. It drinks like a classic IPA, which it is.
Very close to a perfect beer. Amazing taste and aroma and whats best, theyre perfectly balanced. Wow!

Bottled 07NOV11

A: golden ale with under a finger of white soap sud which falls to a broken sheet of the same. Brilliant clarity. Spot lace is rare.
S: Tropical fruits, hints of resin, grapefruit. Sweet, light malt.
T: Good light malt base with bitter, resin, grapefruit, apricot hops. Nice.
M: Thin with lower carb, a lo impact beer. Wet finish.
O: This is a great drinking beer. Its a classically balanced IPA with malt and hop characters complementing one another. Its not what I would consider particularly crafty or even innovative. Its drinkable, and even good, but no better than say, Flower Power IMO. The elusiveness of this beer takes away from its potential for me.

Serving type: bottle

12-10-2011
Real good west coast old school IPA with piney resinous hops coating the tongue. Highly carbonated and golden in color.

Tasted on January 18, 2013:

A: A copper-ish amber. Full head of foam, easily an inch and a half. Nice retention.

S: Very citrusy. Not as hoppy as I was expecting. Slight maltiness in the end.

T: Citrus notes right up front. Still not as hoppy as I was expecting. Slight maltiness in the end.

M: Very bitter feeling. Long-lasting heaviness. Somewhat malty notes on the tongue.

O: A pretty good IPA, but Ive had better. Enjoyed the strong citrus notes.

Serving type: bottle
Tap at Toronado, San Francisco. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, grape, some citrus, hops and malts. Great beer.

Odense Beer & Ball Saturday - Real Madrid vs. Valladolid. BB Oct. 2013 :( Golden with a lasting white head. Big citrus aroma, with lots of lime peel and grapefruit. Dry malty flavour with big citrus hop character. Its obviously a world class IPA, but just as obviously this bottle is too old. Ill rate it somewhat low (compared to what I expect from a fresh Blind Pig) for now and revisit ASAP

Bottle @ Beer & Ball Saturday, Odense. Rating # 13000. 13,000th Tasting. Pours clear copper with a small creamy egg white head. Grass, grapefruit, citrus, peach and marmelade. All about the hops. Crisp and dry. Lovely quaffer although it has a bit of age.

Floral hoppy aroma. Nice balance with the malt. Some piney resinous flavor but mostly a very nice hop aroma and flavor with good balance. Very enjoyable ipa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Apex in Portland. Deep gold color with white head. Aroma of citrus and pine. Hoppy flavor, with a hint of honey, and well-balanced. Good carbonation. I had the opportunity to drink this side by side with Pliny the Elder. Same color, similar aroma, similar flavor. Blind Pig is less hoppy and a bit sweeter, but otherwise a very similar beer. Not sure which I like better.
On draft. Flavors of bitter pineapple. Mild flavor, if anything over-balanced with malts. A very, very tame IPA.

FROM NOTES: August 9, 12. Poured from a bottle into a "Beer Hunter" tulip glass. 

A: Strong IPA smell here. Lots of grapefruit and ripe pineapple. 
A: Pours a golden orange with minimal cloudiness and a finger of fluffy white head that leaves decent lacing.
T: Starts strong with the hops and citrus, and stays consistent. Not as balanced as Pliny The Elder, but very close. 
P: Light body, low carbonation. 
O: Very balanced, well-crafted, and interesting. A well done IPA, interesting contrast between big citric fruity nose and more of a pine emphasis on the palate.

500ml bottle (10/23/13 batch) thanks jarspag! Pours clear golden copper with nice foamy finger of head. Nose is sharp orange zest, lemony, tropical fruit. Mouthfeel is a little malt up front with a smooth, light finish. Taste is bitter fruit, citrus, some pine. Finish is super clean, nice tight balanced bitterness that lasts, with piney notes mixed in. I keep going back for more sips. Really good IPA.

bottle. nose full of citrus. slightly hazy, orange color. medium white head. citrus explosion in the mouth with some fruitiness. moderate malt sweetness, but well balanced. This is great stuff. very well balanced.

Nice pale gold in color with a great amount of bubbly white head that persists. Lacing also fantastic. Aroma is of grapefruit and sweet/bitter grassy hops. Taste is really good. Subtle sweetness that reminds me of fresh cut St Augustine. The bite of the hops is slight, but well balanced. Im surprised that this beer is so drinkable. Ive killed a full tulip already. Mouthfeel is light, bubbly, and has a nice hop sting. Might have to get a growler of this beer instead of Pliny my next trip to RR.

Pours a hazy gold with a longing and defined foam head. The aroma is of fresh citrus hops, mild pine, and malt grains. In the flavor I picked up on grains and a medium to high intensity of bitterness from the hops. The hops have a bit of spice kick to them in the finish. Overall this is a good beverage, very refreshing too.
Draught in Telluride. This is a blisteringly hoppy ipa with a big old wallop of flavour.

Pint on tap at Monks Cafe. Orange-golden with a lasting creamy head. Big aroma of juicy sweet orange, grapefruit, pollen and resin. Flavor begins with the same bold fruity sweet notes that turn to caramel and finish strongly with resin and a touch of slightly peppery citrus zest. Light-medium body has medium-high but smooth carbonation and finishes well dry with a light astringency that makes this one a great session IPA.

Bottle from my friend Jim. Thanks, Jim. Pours yellow orange with a beautiful one finger foamy head. A lot of bubbles coming up through the beer. Lots of retention and lacing. The aroma is incredibly intense. Unbelievable. Makes me wonder what I have been drinking all these years that called itself and IPA. I get some pine (Simcoe?) and citrus on the nose. Slight floral accent is there, too. The wonderful thing about this beer is it does not taste like so many hop bombs I have had lateley. I would describe the bitterness as medium and just toward the low end for the style. Finish is long and smooth. No harshness, just lingering bitterness. A pleasantly light sweetness balances the bitterness perfectly. The texture of the beer is creamy like the head. Medium body and mouthfeel is lightly tingly. Unlike some beers this beer does not improve as it warms. It is best drank in the first 25 minutes. Overall, a terrific beer. I intended to knock this beer down, because I am sick of all the hype surrounding the brewery. I came away from this beer with incredible respect.

Bottle: Hazy orange gold. Light white head. Very Aromatic. Fresh hops profile. Tropical, peach and grapefruit. Very clean. Hops dominate malt. Slight pine profile. Slightly sweet.
