Medium high bitterness. Low carbonation but persistent. Loads of weight and length. A very good beer. Classic bitter West Coast IPA. So much flavor.

Tap at Monks Cafe.
Appearance: Mildly hazy amber body with a dense light tan head.
Aroma: Pretty straight forward hop profile of grapefruit, pine and floral qualities.
Taste: Grapefruit and orange juice with floral and pine overtones. Moderately bitter with a mildly lingering pine tar.
Palate: Medium bodied, moderately carbonated.
Overall: Great west coast IPA. This reminds me of a big pale ale. Really nice balance while having an assertive hop profile. I enjoy this more than Pliny.

Tap on Saturday afternoon. what a great surprise to be walking around and find this in NYC. pours yellow orange and is one of nicest smelling ipas ive encountered. Tons of juicy citrus on the nose begging you to dive right in. tastes of big old grapefruit, some oranges, pine, light caramel malt, peppery, and ginger. touch harsh on palate but pretty great
I had to special order this beer to get it to the east coast. This is a great hoppy west coast IPA. I wish is was available on a regular basis here on the east coast!

The beer pours great with a golden straw color to it, a nice one finger white head, and some lacing on the glass. The beer smells great with a nice grapefruit citrus scent, mild lemon zest and white pepper too. The beer tastes great with white pepper and lemon citrus hoppiness blended together well. The mouthfeel is great as the beer is well carbonated, medium bodied, a left with a bitter mouth. Overall, a really good IPA...but it seems to be over hyped from the masses. Not to take away from its solid taste but beer does nothing to blow you away or make itself different from other American IPAs.

Bottle from the brewery. Pours golden yellow with a little white foam. Small amount of lacing on the glass. Nose is very clean, with subtle citrus and floral notes. Taste is also very clean. Good hop bitterness up front, but not a lot on the back end. Missing the nuance of great IPAs like Nelson, but still an excellent beer.

Tap at the Falling Rock Tap House, Denver. Poured a crystal clear medium amber with a frothy white head and lots of carbonation. The aroma is weak malt with some hoppy notes. The flavour is medium bitter with a big liqourice hop spicy palate. A classic IPA but far from the best. I look at some of the existing ratings and as much as I like this beer I dont see that it justifies such a high rating.

Bottle pour. Blind Pig is one of those beers you just never get tired of. Its smooth with just the right amount of citrus and hops, but its not to high of an ABV that you can only have one. Great beer RR!

Alla spina al brewpub. Una IPA davvero spettacolare! Ha tutte le caratteristiche perfette, bunoa base maltata con attacco dolce, fruttato abbondante, leggero floreale, amaro e secchezza ed un grado alcoolico ben nascosto
UPDATED: FEB 8, 2016 Poured clear yellow with light white head. Good aroma of funky hop. Quite smooth with sharp resin taste.

Pours a gold/orange with little head and left lacing the whole way down the glass.

Initial smells are of grapefruit. 

Taste also of grapefruit with some citrus notes as well. Very little malt (perfect for an IPA IMO). Finishes with strong bitterness that lingers for a while.

Medium body and carbonation for the style. Very good beer that I am looking forward to having again. I wanted to try Pliny and this side by side, but unfortunately OBriens was out of Pliny at the time of my visit.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2013 On tap. This is a delightful IPA, as youve probably gathered. I generally prefer this style to the double IPA, so Im always jazzed to find this one on tap or in bottles -- it never disappoints. I think Pliny is a bit more of a standout in its category due to how smooth it drinks relative to other DIPAs, but Id be hard pressed to choose between the two. Citrus and pine on the nose and I swear Im getting a bit of oak, even though Ive read that its not oaked anymore. Either way, really tough to find fault with this one.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2014 Loved this one. Nice hoppy piney citrus taste very well balanced and smooth. One of the best Ive had. 

Smelled of grapefruit, citrus and pine. Nice hazy golden color with a slight creamy head.

500ml bottle. Pours a clear golden beer with a slightly off white head that falls slowly to a ring. Aromas are big hops with pine, resin, and a bit of citrus. Taste was excellent, with a wonderfully rich combination of bitter pine, fruity hop, and some mouth-watering candy sweetness. Light and creamy with adequate carbonation.
Large botle in the Liberty restaurant in San Francisco. Dark orange body, with small white head, disappeared quickly. Fruity nose with some pine in it. Very bitter hops. Dry bitter finish. ***

Tap at City Beer SF. Hazy gold/orange. Plenty of thick pine, grassiness, and juicy citrus in the aroma, good bit of grapefruit and light tropical notes in there. Taste is pine-oriented, with a nice sharp dollop of citrus and some juicier orange/grapefruit notes. Some grassiness towards the end. Lingering pine and grapefruit bitterness, very very crisp. Only a little hint of semi-honeyed biscuit malt in there to counteract the big hop hit. Great full flavoured use of hops, very tasty.

Poured a two fingers of head on a fairly clear straw colored body.
The aroma is a great mix of grapefruit, orange, touch of lemon and grain.
The taste is bold grapefruit bitter with lemon and a slight orange sweet finish. Nicely done.
The texture is crisp with moderate carbonation.
Enjoyable and bold.
Tiny Pliny, with 6.1% rather than 8% ABV. Hoppy, cirtusy, piney nose with good head and lasting lace. Delivers a flawless IPA experience with a long, clean finish. Very much a Pliny Jr.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2013 On tap at Belmont Station, Portland, Oregon, USA. A golden coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Hoppy, citrus aroma. Tastes hoppy, citrus, pine, quite bitter. Too harsh for me but clearly a well made IPA.
On tap. Pours crystal gold yellow, with a thin tight head. Lushes nose, pine, citrus, dry gasses, fresh hops. Taste is perfectly balanced. Hops, citrus, a hint of malt. Amazing beer.

On tap @ Stone Brewing. Pours golden yellow with very little off-white head. Smell is huge grapefruit citrus, pine, bitter hops and sweet malt. Taste is bitter hops, pine, citrus and fades into sweet malt with a grapefruit finish. Thin to medium bodied brew with good balance. Excellent IPA!
Oranje gouden kleur, ruikt fantastisch naar hop, citrus en thijm. Smaakt ook zo, heftige smaak, bijzonder lekker.
Bottle, orangish pour. 2-3oz sample. Solid IPA, very nice. Probably a victim of predetermined amazingness. Great bitterness, well balanced. Great mouthfeel. Need a whole fresh bottle to myself
Clear pale yellow with minimal white head. Light citrus hoppy aroma and taste.

Bottle. Pours a golden orange white a foamy off-white head. Aromas of citrus, lemon, pine, and sweet malt. Tastes of bitter hoppy spice and transitions into a sweet citrus and lemon then some underlying pine and malt. Dry and bitter finish.

Aroma is similar to a DIPA, but taste is not! An excellent IPA that pours an amber color. A delicious beer that is well worth the effort to get it in my region (Charlotte, NC). A great handcuff to Pliny the Elder.

Wow. This is a hop explosion. Really hitting the hop head spot. This beer poured with very little head, and very clear. I can see perfectly through a gold glow of hop goodness. The hops balance very well with the malts. Not too hoppy or sweet. Also, I dont notice any alcohol taste for this type of beer. Its a nice welcome to the hophead palate. Find one and enjoy it!

On tap at under the sun. Pours very crisp clear pale with a slight reddish tint. Aroma is hoppy and floral. Taste is extremely smooth with hops throughout. Great beer. Almost too smooth, hops are almost covered by smoothness

Bottle 510ml.
Pours bright golden with low-med white head. Intense lacing. Aroma is of pine, citrus, malt, fruits, resin. Taste is of pine, citrus, tropical fruits, nice bitterness. Slight sweetness. Palate: Low-medium body. Nice balance. Overall: Very nice hop features. Tropical fruits are here. Bitter finish, aftertaste a bit harsh.

Pours a clear, orange golden color with carbonation bubbles migrate slowly as if through a more viscous liquid from the bottom. Not much of a head, but there is a perpetual white cap. Prominent pine and citrus nose. A bit of an oily mouthfeel with big carbonation and hop heat interaction toward the finish. Nice depth in the flavor provided by the hop resin. Pine, grapefruit, and a bit if cannabis. Fine IPA.

Hollywood, Ca. - Blue Palms Brewhouse - on tap. Light amber pour, thick off-white head, nice sticky lacing. Very aromatic with hints of resiny spruce and fruity apricot. Flavor has a nice clean bitterness with some requisite grapefruit notes, a touch of mango and a finish laced with spearmint. Thick, sticky mouthfeel. Excellent.
UPDATED: AUG 12, 2015 Wonderful beer nose is floral and sweet. Nice and we?ll rounded beer light and refreshing very sessionable beer.

Draught @ Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa, CA
Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, citrus, peach and orange. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long orange and peach fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2013 On tap at the brewpub. It pours a clear, golden body under a dense, firm white head. The aroma is lovely, although a bit one dimensional. Lots of green pine cones and some peaches. The bitterness in the flavor lasts for a good while, keeping the light malty touch company. Green pine cones and peaches. Full body, nice carbonation, quite dry. Most definitely a really fine IPA. Wont find em much finer than this. Most certainly far from extreme, but very balanced, and highly drinkable. Glad to have enjoyed more of it later on. 130806
On tap at brewpub. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of peach, grains, pine and floral notes. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some pine and peach. Medium body, average carbonation.

12 oz draught at Library Alehouse Santa Monica. Pours clear dark golden/honey color. Aroma of citrus, pine, mango. Flavor is citrus, floral, spruce. Very easy drinking with a slight bitterness and sweet character.

On tap at brewpub on 062013. Pours clear golden/light copper with a white head. Aroma has sweet pineapple, pine, citrus and very light malt. Taste is light malty sweetness with a dry piney bitterness, smooth and easy drinkable.

On tap at Toronado. I think it's better than PTE, so sue me. Pours a little less clear, and has more of a punch on the back end. Really good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Beechwood BBQ in Seal Beach of into shaker pint. Crisp and piney. Good not great.
Wow, this is what an IPA should be. Amazing balance, nice hop aroma, but not a massive bitterness. Very drinkable, with a subtle sweetness.

Bottle poured into a tulip glass. Pours a translucent copper with q big white head of foam. Decent retention. Aroma has notes of grass, herbs, pine, cotton candy. Taste has that herbal, pine sweetness before a medium bitterness picks up and finishes things off. Pretty good.
Tap at the brew pub..Nose is grassy, pine hops, citrus fruits, malts..Taste is tropical citrus fruits, nice malts, cream, spice, pine hops, bubble gum

Pours clear golden with thick bubbly white head. Aroma is crisp hoppy floral citrus. Taste is crisp clean hops upfront with a touch of sweet malt and bitter orange peel on the follow through. Aftertaste is lingering bitter citrus and dank piny hops. Palate is clean and a little sticky. Overall very well balanced IPA.
Well worth the money, even though here in San Diego, Windy City liquor only allows one per customer. Hamiltons in North Park has it on tap. So does Pizza Port in Ocean Beach.

From a 16oz bottle, thanks Devin! Aroma is pine, citra, caramel, and English malt. Flavor is caramel, pine, citrus, English malt, and grapefruit. This is a fantastic beer, so balanced. Wish I had more!

Dark amber colour with just slight white head that laces the glass well. Aroma is strong with pine, spruce and grapefruit. Taste is medium to strong bitter yet smooth. Has notes of citrus fruit and spice.
Tap at the brew pub..Nose is grassy, pine hops, citrus fruits, malts..Taste is tropical citrus fruits, nice malts, cream, spice, pine hops, bubble gum

Pours clear amber with low white head. Aroma of mango, citrus, grapefruit, pine and light passion fruit. Taste is balanced pine to resin bitter. Very fruity with a distinct sweetness behind the bitterness. Body is light and slick with soft carbonation.
Bottle. Pours clear golden with a frothy lacy head. Aroma is pine, hops, citrus and caramel. Rather full bodied with a very good mouthfeel. Fresh clean taste. Medium carbonation. Great IPA.

Light color. 2 finger head. Easy on the pallet. Taste of tropical fruit... And a hint of pine. Good starter beer to build your pallet. 

---Crozier

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2013 Got this tasty treat through a trade with whatsupstairs. Pours a nice light amber. Aroma is STANKY floral grapefruit. Tastes of mango and grapefruit. nice combo of sweet and bitter. Delicious IPA wish we had this down south.

Pours a crisp golden amber with a frothy white head. Hop, citrus, pine and malt aromas. Hop, grapefruit, pine and some malt flavors. Smooth with a medium body and slightly bitter finish. Definitely shows its relation to Pliny the Elder.
Awesome IPA. Nice dank resin aromas. Flavours are very hoppy. Pine and grapefruit. Nice full mouthful. So bitter. So good.

My first Russian river. I had such high expectations that perhaps were too high. I was underwhelmed. Many better ipas coming out or Portland and bend. A good solid hoppy fresh citrusy ipa, but it didn't blow me away.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, bottled on June 11th, 2013 thnx to bytemesis!! Cheers man!! Pours a clear copper colored beer with a medium sized, white head that settles quickly into a small ring. Leaves beautiful lacing. Aroma has grapefruit, lemon peel, spices and some pine notes, typical West Coast IPA as far as I know them. Flavor is very well balanced. The bitterness hits you at the start and finish, in between there is a slight malty, less bitter taste. Very well made IPA, awesome job... wish I had more...
Clear golden pour. Huge white head. Medium mouth that is a little slick. Taste is full of mango, passion fruit and body odor. Dank aroma. A little lace.

Blonde et limpide, nayant pratiquement pas de mousse et réussi, néanmoins, à tracer une dentelle. Des arômes de conifères, un condensé de gomme de pin et une odeur qui me semble minéralisée. En bouche, cest très réussi. Cest intensément amer, très prononcé. Un goût fruité, principalement par des agrumes; du zeste de citron, du pamplemousse blanc et encore des particularités minérales. Un arrière-goût très long en amertume. Très belle surprise. En fût au Toronado (668-031213)

Drank on tap (16 oz) at Monks Cafe in Philly on June 17, 2013. Golden blonde, thin head. Grapefruit hop aroma with a salty herb notes. Orange flavor hops, a little dry, with notes of tobacco, good bitterness. You have to be blind not find it good!

Pours amber with thin white head and lots of sticky lacing. Aroma is bright floral hops. Flavor is nice hoppy bitterness with undercurrent of caramel malts. Medium body. Lively carbonation. Excellent brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice bright color and flavor. Lots of citrus from the hops. I may like this more than PTE. But thats just my personal IPA preferences.

510ml bottle, shared by Jay. Was opened, recapped, and refrigerated several hours ago. Bottled 5/20/13. Clear golden amber color. Good thin off-white head. Nice dotty lace. Real nice grassy, light citrus hop aroma. Medium plus body. Smooth, easy drinking. Good zesty sweet taste, light to moderate bitter. Awesome lighter IPA. Great flavor , super long aftertaste.

510ml bottle picked up in San Diego.  Pours clear light orange color with a small white head.  Nose is citrus, pepper, malt.  Flavor is crisp, hoppy with nice malt balance.  Dry finish.  Nicely balanced; not as good as Pliny for sure.

Bottle (dated May 4, 2013). Alfalfa, pine, and pineapple hoppiness create a perfect, clean IPA aroma thats just pungent enough. Pours a bright golden-orange color with a frothy, half-finger, white head. The bitterness bites early with a pine resin tone and a lingering grassy note. Light body and carbonation with a crisp, clean mouthfeel and a bitter moderate finish. I wish I could get this wonderful elixir on a regular basis.
Bottle from kyle, thanks! pours clear yellow with white head.  aroma is pine and floral hops, taste is super balanced and delicious! great brew

Bottle through trade, golden pour with thin white head. Aroma of citrus hops and some nice malt. Taste is light fruit and some piney hops, wonderful blend.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at monks..nice crimson reddish color..1 finger head..aroma is hop dominant..looking forward to trying this..quite balanced..with just enough lingering bitterness..really tasty single ipa..very well done..one of the better ipas I have had pleasure of having..

On tap at Toronado. Pours a golden yellow with a pale quick dispersing head. Huge hoppy aroma. Best single IPA I've ever had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Croustillante comme seul Russian River sait le faire, bonne résine, malt savoureux, finale moyennement sèche.
Not near as good as Pliny but still an excellent sessionable IPA. Surprised with some of the ratings for this, to me this is nothing special just a good by the book west coast IPA.
Hoppy aroma, very smooth.  Nice pine hops.  Better than pliny, which isnt hard to do.

510 ml bottle shipped from my friend in Arizona.  Bottled 4/8/13.  Pours an ultra clear light golden orange color with a small foamy head that quickly fades.  Aroma is a mixture of citrus fruits, black pepper, and some pale malt.  Taste is crisp and clean with a nice fresh hop taste and a good malt backbone.  This is a very typical west coast IPA and its done very well.  Nothing really complex here but a very nice light sweetness mixed with a light bitterness.  Fresh hops, dry finish (a little too dry for me to love it).  Fairly thin body, light oiliness.  Very drinkable.  Not up there with my favorites but a very nice west coast IPA.

bottle shared by mathieuc, thanks mate! pours clear bright yellow, orange tint, with a decent white head, some retention and lacing. very aromatic grapefruit, citrus, pepper, oranges, candy floss.. very juicy. dustiness. average to soft carbonation, light to medium body, hint of sweetness, relatively short grapefruity finish. nice balance, good drinkability!
Very solid IPA. Has a crisp bitterness with some citrusy notes. Compared to the Elder though it seems to be missing something.

Poured from a bottle. Golden with a small head.  Citrusy aroma. Grapefruit taste with slight bitter aftertaste. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours golden orangish on draft at Brew pub. Fresh citrus pine nose. Nice hoppy bite all around with a good malty back stop. Overall excellent ipa and IMO better than "the elder".
Probably my favorite beer from Russian River.  Nice fruity notes and a nice full finish with the taste.  A highly drinkable brew.
Bottle->tulip.  Light orange-gold with huge frothy white head.  Aroma: strong sweet grapefruit hops.  Taste: bittersweet citrus and pine hops.  Great lingering bitter hops aftertaste.  Very good.
I guess I found Blind Pig to be a letdown after Pliny the Elder and Pliny the Younger. Its a decent beer, but there are better out there.

Bottled on 04/03/13. Pours a clear amber color with a froth medium head with the aroma of mild citrus.  Tastes of a standard mildly bitter IPA, but leaves the palate with a slightly sticky bitterness that quickly disappears.  Overall this is one of the best IPAs I have had.
Bottle. Golden with a big white head. Aroma is citrus, grapefruit and some slight malty salt something going on. Taste is grapefruit IPA. Best example. Great beer.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Bottled 04/08/13 consumed 04/26/13... Fresh! Pours a super clear golden color with a healthy white head that slows to a film. Smell is not a pronounced as I would expect but I do get some nice grapefruit, floral hops, and little caramel malts. Taste shines... Grapefruit again, nice carbonation, a little sweet malt and an excellent bitterness that lasts after the sip has been consumed. Great IPA!
Deep golden color with white head. Aroma and taste of pine and citrus. Very dry and bitter. Finishes hoppy with some grapefruit and similar citric flavours.

500ml bottle. Pours a clear golden amber color with a frothy off white head. Aroma of clean pineapple and grapefruit with a good amount of pine as well. Taste of strong piney hops, clean malts, resin, and orange peel.

Had this at about 9:30 am for some reason. Clear amber pour with a nice white fluffy head. Fantastic aroma of grass, pine and citrus. Taste is piney and grassy hops, witha really nice caramel malt backing. Very well balanced.

Bottle courtesy of kcorum10, thanks man. Pours a gorgeous light gold with tons of head. Aromas are positively massive citrus; huge grapefruit flood my nose with some lighter sweet notes. The flavor is exquisite. If there is another IPA that is as balanced as this I dare someone to sample them side by side. It has just the right hop-to-malt ratio and the hops are not bitter at all but terrifyingly citrus and floral. The mouthfeel is perfect for the style, not sticky like a lot of DIPAs but almost like a strong pale ale which is great for Arizona. Overall the best beer, hands down in this category. I love other IPAs but none even come close.
On tap at Capone's in Norristown, PA. This is a rough comparison because it was tasted side by side with the Plinys, but still held its own.

This is a comparison with Pliny the Elder. Pig bottled 4/8/13; Elder 4/1/13. More hop aroma in the Pig than in Elder, which is nearly odorless. Color nearly identical in both - deep translucent copper. Elder is slightly more carbonated in pour. Taste wise, the Pig is more hop forward, with strong grapefruit taste and bitterness on top of a decent malt base. Elder is more balanced, and dare I say nuanced? Strong grapefruit taste still, but a more robust malt base and less bitterness. More substantial mouthfeel in Pliny than Pig. Overall, both are exceptional, but I prefer the Elder. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from RR. Clear, orange-gold pour with a persistent, short white head leaving moderate lace. Nose is citrus hops and a bit of grass, with a touch of toast. Medium-light body with moderate, fine carbonation. Light fruit and citrus, biscuit, resin and toast. Very well balanced and eminently sessionable.

Draft @ brewpub. Pours clear amber with a nice off white head leaving lace. Aroma is hopoy piny citric fruity. Flavoe is dry very hoppy bitter fruity pungent. Finishes dry hoppy fruity and grapefruit.

A pint from the tap.
Deep clear golden color with a nice white head.
Bitter citrus hop aroma, some tropical notes and mellow pine.
Sweet candied orange peels, piney hops, med-hi bitterness.
Pleasant, medium bodied, nice finish and quite good.

Very good ipa. Very dry and piney. Not as rich as the Pliny of course. Still has a very nice palate and silky texture. 

Case from brewery

Bottle:
Some white small and big airy bubbles on top of a clear yellow colored beer.
Would say its not the standard IPA look.
The aroma is immense fresh and fruity while not being to forward.
Nice crispy hop fruits (pine apple, peach, apricot, fresh squeezed grapefruit), with some resin, light malty, some floral and pine notes.
Flavours of fresh squeezed fruits like grapefruit and red/blood orange, hop flowers and bitter, some peach, apricot, pine needles, good clean bitterness, hint of yeast and herbal fruity floral tones.
Aftertaste of crispy hop fruits with a nice bitterness, light warmth and some fruity herbs.
Low carbo, soft mouthfeel, medium to full body and a creamy texture.
One of the best IPAs I have tasted. Delicious!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: On draught at Toronados in San Francisco.  Amber with a head that doesnt linger.  Hoppy, pleasant, grapefruity.  Good grapefruit hoppy aroma.  Decent stuff.  Typical very bitter US IPA.

Pours amber with a small white head that dissipates quickly. Great aroma, lots of pine, hops, and citrus. Blind pig has a strong hop flavor, with pine and citrus notes. One of the better I.P.As out there.

On tap at The Mayor of Old Town.  Orange and slightly hazy appearance with nice lacing.  The aroma is hoppy, herbal, spruce and light citrus.  Medium body with a smooth dry feel.  The flavor is clean and bitter with very little malt sweetness.  Nice!
Draught at bar. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, grapefruit, floral hops, pine and resin. Dry bitter finish with grapefruit. Excellent IPA.

Bottle @ Bruces. Cheers to Bruce for bringing this back! The pours medium amber with a tiny white head. The nose is lemon, spruce and pinecone. Forest floor. Light pastoral hoppiness. The taste is light lemon peel and pine cone. A bit of lemon cake. Subtle flavors, not overpowering. Light, effervescent body. Really nice balance. Overall, this is pretty great. An easy drinker for sure.

A wonderfully simplistic IPA. Super well balanced and impressive in spite of the hop profile seeming a bit boring. Classic. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2013 Pours clear orange-gold. Aroma is citrus and pine and fresh kneeded bread dough. Flavor is grapefruit and light malt, with more pine and citrus to finish. Lingering dry and bitter on the tongue. Easy drinking IPA, but I enjoyed it much more on tap...

Edit- maybe my glass was dirty yesterday, thankfully I bought two bottles.  Still enjoyed it more on tap, but upgraded the palate and overall scores, taking this rating from a 3.9 to a 4.2.

On tap at Apex bar. 

A: Bright orange with a lazy eggshell colored head. Slides off the glass. 

N: Loads of hoppy goodness. Grapefruit, pineapple, spruce. Very tropical. Some light sweetness. Its tempered and inviting. 

M: Very dry. Does a number on the palate. 

O: An excellent all-around IPA. As with Pliny the Elder, it never overextends itself, leading to a brew worthy of drinking time and again.

Appearance was clear orangish gold with white lasting creamy 2 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are citrus fruits, sweet pale malts, no alcohol present. Taste are sweet pale backbone with lemon, orange, grapefruit  and soft pine resin. Palate was soft smooth creamy CO2 with medium body, lasting citrusy piney pale sweetness for a finish. A easy drinking IPA, you could knock back a few.
Pours golden with medium head. Big pine notes with a little spruce and mango. Tastes of pine and floral almost medicinal notes.
bottle. Golden with small head. Huge hops. Awesome west coast ipa. Hard to believe this isnt the one theyre famous for.

Bottle fresh from San Francisco care of deeblo.  I cant thank you enough Bruce.  A beer Ive been after for the past 2 years.  Pure clear gold colour with a thick cream coloured head.  As I poured it, all I could smell was PNW hops.  As I bring the beer to my nose, its all concentrated grapefruit hoppy.  In the mouth its smooth and well balanced.  Yes hoppy but there is just enough pale malt to keep it in check.  Its very clean.  Not overly bitter on the finish.  Yes big aroma, big hop flavour in mouth, but a clean refreshing finish.  I mean stupidly drinkable.  You could down pints and pints of this stuff.  None of that sweet crystal malt character you get with many US IPAs.  This is clean and showcases the hops perfectly.  Comparing this with Thornbridge Jaipur, BrewDog Punk or Marble Dobber almost seems unfair.  Jaipur probably comes closest. beautifully clean and elegant.  But it has the everyday drinkability that youd kinda like this in your local pub every day and would be your regular beer.  Not sticky nor cloying.  You know you shouldnt meet your heroes but this and the Pliny the Elder were both better than I expected.  And then Once in a Lifetime by Talking Heads came on the stereo........Yep a really great beer.
Bottle. Orange, white head. Good lacing. Nose is very floral,  sticky pine. Taste is flowers, citrus fruits, pine, fresh bread. Smooth, great body, lasting dry bitter finish.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2013 Really solid IPA. Bitter with floral hops, lemon and orange peel flavors. Drink it fresh or not at all as the bottle says.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ Ladyface Alehouse. Subtle aroma of burnt caramel and hops. Golden appearance with a simple foam. Strong hops upfront with a biscuit and caramel malt base combo. Full bodied with lingering hops on the finish. Overall nicely balanced. Think of Pliny with a more metallic taste to it. Id give this an A+ rating.
Poured a golden hue with almost no head. Smelled of citrus and a little skunk. Tasted of citrus with a balanced amount of bitterness. This would be my go to beer if it was more available.
One of the more sessionalbe ipas there are. Great taste hasnt let me down and doesnt fill me up
Pours amber yellow with a white head that lingers around.  Nice legs on the lacing. Aroma of pine hops. Taste is pine and citrus fruits. Crisp with long aftertaste.
Malt and piney aroma. Pours gold with white head. Citrus with pine taste. Little sour on the palate hops finish very good.

On draft at Brass Horse: Pours dark yellow, creamy head, sticks to the glass. Aroma is citrus hops, caramel malts and more hops. Taste is lightly salty, sweet with a bitter hop profile. Smooth and hoppy with an easy finish. Very nice IPA, great flavor and hop profile.

500ml bottle. Golden pour with some floaters and a white head. Leafy hops dominate the nose with a light resinous note. The same things come out on the palate with a balanced dose of caramel maltiness. Medium body and carbonation.
Light, grassy, slightly sour, and hoppy. Not very complex, but still pretty good.
Grapefruit, blueberry, rosehip nose, quite strong. Crystal clear amber, medium head. Not nearly as hoppy on the palate. Drinks like an APA, actually, but a good one.

Bottle. Great stinky hop aroma rising up, manure, horse radish. Clear pale straw color, smooth white head. Wonderful hop attack initial: a complex mix of citrus and pine / more hops, but mellowed, in mid palate, with a complement of sweet maltiness / lengthy, tasty hop finish. Medium body. Hops certainly dominate this one, but not overdone. A great IPA.

Super stoked, this is my first legit non-collabo Russian River brew. Bottle brought back from Cali by a good friend of mine. Pours a perfectly clear copper with a white head that dies down to a film, lacing here and there. Aroma is a beautiful mix of citrus and a light bit of pine hop. Perfume and quite sweet malts. Tastes a very well balanced mixture of bitter sweet and light malt mouthfeel. Tastes pretty damn awesome.
Pours yellow with white head and nice lacing.  Aroma of pine hops.  Taste is pine and citrus hops.  Bitter and crisp with long aftertaste.

Tap at brewery 10.28.12.. Pour is a clear golden amber. Head is half inch and fluffy white. Smell is citrus and grass... Taste is grass, citrus, malt. Light and nicely put together.. Great IPA.. nice bitter finish.

Bottled 12/12/12. Pours dark orange with large white head. Aroma is pine, lemons, sweet grapefruit. Taste is hop forward, bitter to start. Tangyness lingers. Bitter bite to finish. Enough sweetness to balance but hops are definitely the star. Body is medium, definitely not water. Nice mouthfeel, appropriate carbonation. Very nicely put together.
On tap. Clear golden pour with a white head. Scent is hops, citrus and pine. Taste is citrus with a piney finish.

Draft at backcountry. Surprising that when Russian river was in washington we never seemed to get this. Anyway, light amber, clear, offwhite head dissipates yielding irreg lacing. Aroma is pine and citrus with some caramel maltiness behind it. Taste is full of piney goodness but with a really nice malt backing to it. Amaziningly well balanced ipa. Goddamn you russian river Washington is closer than Colorado ... we miss you. Medium body, moderate carb, medium length bitter finish. Overall: just a damned nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma- Very citrus

Appearance - Golden amber color with a good lacing.

Taste- Piney

Overall- Solid beer

has some sediments! aromas of hoppy pine cones but has a real peach aroma as well and a hint of corn chips/ketchup chips. Bitter leafy flavours and a lack of malts make this a tasty but one dimensional brew.

Pours a nice rich golden color with great clarity and a solid two finger sticky foam that laces nicely. On the nose is subtle floral hops, bits of mango, pineapple and a faint toasted malt sweetness. On the palate this beer is focused and clean. The only fault is its slightly watery but the tropical hop flavors roll into a nice slightly earthy pine spice which finishes bitter and clean.

Backlog rating 12-13-2008.  (Bottle)  This beer has a small white mostly lasting head, very little carbonation observed, one ring of lacing, and a golden hue.  The Aroma is citrus hops, grapefruit, some caramel, and malty.  The Flavor is bitter, grapefruit, citrus, malty, and fairly hoppy tasting.  The Palate is sprite and this is a medium bodied IPA.  Overall, a good IPA for hopheads and worthy of a try.
Light blond on the pour. Great clean pine smell. Taste is a crisp hop with a strong bitterness that last through a nice dry finish. Wouldnt expect anything less from Russian river.
Incredibly balanced IPA, beautiful aroma, lovely hue.  Hop bitterness is cut amazingly by the malt character.  Truly wonderful.

Blind pig is a fantastic IPA that screams in your face at first but had a mild finish. Excellent beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep gold color with frothy white head. Aroma is dominated by evergreen with just a touch of grapefruit. Hops as pine and citrus are the central flavors with little malt coming through. Wonderfully unbalanced with a long hoppy, bitter finish. Great American IPA!

Excellent IPA. One of the best beers out there. A perfect amount of hops. It's very drinkable. I could drink this all day. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.5l bottle from Bierkoning. Sweet! This is a blurry honey-orange one with a nice medium sized and somewhat lasting white bubbly top. It smells fresh, sweet and fruity. Green pine cones, some cortex, sweet malty caramel and glazed sweet tropical mango on the nose. Really fresh and good. It has a average carbonated thin oily mouthfeel. The taste is also dominated by green pine cones and a nice bitter fruitiness. More soft cortex and branches, I get a fruity mango and pineapple thing with a nice balanced hoppy and fruity bitterness. Also, something that reminds me of mixed and thinned out strawberry and raspberry syrup. Scary light drinkable this. I could drink many of these before I had to say stop. A shame I only have this bottle. A really nice non-extreme American IPA. 07.10.2012

Draft at Local 44.  Pours a slightly cloudy copper-gold with 1 finger of off-white head and some lacing.  Aroma is mostly hops - pine, grapefruit, tangerine, floral and resin.  Taste of some sweet caramel malts and big hop flavor - citrus and pine.  Great IPA.
one of my favorite russian beers of all time im glad i live so close to the brewery cheers.

Shared bottle through RB user kaufmanised; Clear amber pour, forthy off white head, glorious hop aroma very floral and piney, taste is well balance hop and malt quite bitter, but hints of tangerine and grapefruit. Really enjoyed this.
On tap at Capones.  A really nice, dry West Coast IPA.  It seems like this could be oak-aged or have a touch of sea salt added.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2013 Bottle from joeneugs. Pours a clear copper with white bubbly, fluffy head. Aroma is unreal. A blast of floral hops unlike any else I have smelled. Taste is pungent hops--a mix of floral and pine. I really like this beer. Different than Pliny but very very good.

Very smooth ale, nice fragrant aroma, take a sip and damn that's good.           

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden colour. Aroma is quite piney. Carbonation is low. Flavour has light honey and tropical fruit.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2013 20oz pour @ Toronado, SF. Clear gold, not much head. Piney, resinous hops. Flavour follows the nose. Malty to the point of dryness. Carbonation is quite lively. Long bitter finish, a touch chewy. Nice.
From a trade with boot_legger. Nice golden pour with a light white head. grass and pine aromas. Great citrus taste.

Draught at Toronado - San Diego.  Golden amber with almost no head, just whisps of off-white.  A great straight up west cost IPA.  Piney, floral quite bitter with just enough balance.  Light to medium body.
Pours light golden with a frothy white head. Nice citrus and pine aroma. Taste is crisp with a solid malt backbone framed by pine and citrus hops. Very well rounded beer.
From the tap at Russian River, pours a medium gold with a thin white lace. Lots of citrus and pine aroma. Body is medium with good caramel sweetness and a nice dry finish. I very good IPA.
Pint at russian river. Easy ipa. No overwhelming aroma but very easy smooth . Excellent.

27th September 2012Borefts warm up -bottle in the Hotel. Light haze on this gold beer. Tidy white head. Palate is light and crisp. Minerals. Mellow but fully flavoured hops. Orange, tangerine and floral flavours in great balance. Not a shouty IPA by any means - but very seductive and so very drinkable.

Aroma- citrus, floral notes, slight malt profile, some belgian qualities
Appearance- sunset orange with a pillowy white head and an abundance of lacing
Taste- hop bite upfront followed by smooth, sweet malts, fruit juices, pine, and more hop profiles on the finish
Palate- quality body and mouthfeel but nothing exciting
Overall-  Very nice, super sessionable, but ultimately nothing to rant and rave over.  Not Pliny to me, not even close.

510 ml bottle,sampled during our motorhome tour through California. Pours clear orange with a small head. Aroma of peach and lytchee. Medium body with nice smooth bitterness and some smoky touch to it. Taste of grapefruit and citrus peel. Nice!
Im fairly sure this was the beer I had - it was on draft and the taps were at the back.  It was very nice, well balanced with no overwhelming flavours.
Very good.  Smooth great taste & aroma.  Wish it was eisier to get in the midwest.

Draft at Monks Cafe. Orange gold colored beer. Fruity hoppy nose. Citrus and grapefruit in the nose and taste. Not overdone with the hops but the lack of malty sugars let the bitterness come forward nicely.

Truly Westcoast, this brew is all about aromatics. Intense piney aroma with little to no malt aroma. Taste is intense bitter with a bit of grapefruit flavor and more sequoias. A very nice brew that is even better when it comes in as a bonus on a trade!
Clear golden, nice lacing. Fresh pine aroma, lemon. Hop forward, grapefruit, refreshing.

On tap at monks philly. pours a clear deep orange. Nice white fluffy head. Aroma is citrusy, fresh squeeezed hop juice, sweet malts, pine. Taste is pine, grapefruit, fresh hops, orange, tropical fruits, malty sweetness. Very balanced but yet very nice hop character. All in all a very nice IPA!

UPDATED: APR 25, 2014 Fairly hazy light orange pour. Very little white foam on top. Bright citrus scent, pineapple, apple, and orange. Seems to make my tongue fall asleep momentarily. Super well balanced taste, medium body. Hop taste is piney but smooth, a little spicy like there was the slightest amount of cayenne or chili.  Finish is clean, slightly bitter and sour but void of most flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A perfectly wonderful IPA. Piney aroma and flavor. Tasted before and always a winner.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice blend of citrus and pine, with a bit more sweetness than you normally find in an IPA.  Good beer.

Light gold, clear, little haze, white, medium carbonation.  Aroma is grassy citrus, hint of grain.  Flavor is similar, light on the hop oils.  Medium-light body.  I was expecting more from the creators of Pliny (which I have yet to come across, maybe its not all that great either.)  They need more hop oils in there!!!

Aroma: my god. The smell of this beer is right on. So perfect. Spectacular citrus scent. 

Appearance: beautiful orange amber color. Mostly clear. Two finger white head.

Taste: theres something about this beer that Im not sure how to explain. Ive never eaten a hop, but I think it might taste something like this. Smells much better than it tastes. 

Palate: exceptionally smooth and easy to drink.

Overall: everything about this beer screams amazing, except the taste. Still enjoying it but I really wish I could give it a higher rating.

500 ml bottle received as an extra in a trade. Thanks pandableh! Pours slightly hazy bright orangish yellow with a frothy white head that leaves some lacing and trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slightly sweet, hoppy, fruity and floral with caramel, grapefruit juice, resin, cotton candy, peaches, black currant jam, pine, dried apricots, dry wood, moist grass, bread, pineapple, wet stone and hints of alcohol. Taste is tiny sweet, bitter, floral and slightly fruity with bread, apricots, grapefruit juice, freshly cut grass, pine, resinous wood, peaches, unripe pineapple, dandelions, bergamot, caramel, gooseberries, unripe currants and passion fruit. Mouthfeel is slightly dry, slightly astringent, tiny oily bitter and medium bodied. Finish is bitter, floral and herbal with grapefruit rinds, crackers, moist soil, grass, pine, resinous wood and bergamot. Less than 3 months old but still feel this is much better fresh.

Pours a hazy gold hue, attractive off-white head. Aroma is predominantly resiny and piney, some delicate tropical fruit aromas too. Soft carbonation. More fruitiness on the palate, and a well-balanced hop bitterness and malt profile. Finishes off-dry and bitter. Overall a well constructed and quite delicious ipa.

On tap at Toronado. So so much better than the PtE I had right next to it. Huge herbal merijuana notes (or was it just Haight St?), ornange grapefruit citrus, and nectar fruit lead to a super dry body with a crisp finish. Awesome example of the style and much more deserving of accolades than its more robust brother.

Bottle straight from the brewery. Pours dark yellow. Super dank, fresh cut grass, lots of citrus. Bitter yet fruity overall. Nice, medium-thin mouthfeel. Extremely drinkable. Tried to savor it, but just wanted to slam it. Pretty clean finish. A great, damn beer!

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2012 1) [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ brewpub, Santa Rosa, CA, 13/08/12. Bright, generous-lacing gold. Peach and spliff snout. More of that sweaty, ganja-esque pine and leafiness on the palate; no cloying malt or honey. Slightly stunning. 
2) Bottle at home, bottled 09/07. Shining, brassy gold with a tight white foam. Soapy, flowery aroma with notes of violet, pine, orange Smarties, Turkish Delight, white peach, BJ and liquorice. Excellent, approachable, nicely stewed IPA with Darjeeling and dunked biscuit beneath soapy tangerine, peach and flowers. Exactly the kind of pale, balanced pint of biscuits and hops Id be looking to scoop on a trawl around Leicester, Derby, Sheffield..or even at The Crown of a Saturday lunchtime before watching The Boro dismantle Macclesfield or Wrexham. 848415.

Tap at Falling Rock, Denver - 01/06/12.
Pours a clear golden amber with a medium white head.
Hops, citrus, pine nose.
Hop forward, floral hops, peachy, pine, caramel, pale malts.
Medium bodied, smooth with a fair rasp of carbonation.
Excellent IPA, if I hadnt had Maine Beer Lunch earlier this same week, it would have gone to No. 1 for me!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: SEP 1, 2012 On tap at Monks Cafe. Clear amber pour with white head, a lot of lacing. Aroma is hoppy of course but not particularly exuberant. Some pine, lemon and fresh grass. Taste is bitter but much maltier than I thought. Good but pretty far from what I expected.

Tap @ Russian River. Golden in color with off white foamy head. Aroma is big floral hops and just a hint of citrus and grapefruit. Taste ls bitter, malty, sweet. follows with nice grapefruit flavor. Clean, refreshing dry finishTasty!
Great ipa from Russian river brewery, its a more piney ipa but still very good

More forward skunky herb, pine and resin aromas and flavors then Pliny, with less of a citrus inclusion. Another great example of a "West Coast" style IPA. A very straightforward, fresh, heavily hopped beer. Mouthfeel is smooth and refreshing, with a fine carbonation and lingering finish of fresh herbs, and resin. Overall, this beer displays a great freshness of hops... Which should be expected, given this beer was bottled 19 days ago. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

1 oz pour at Russian River

A - Dark yellow. Minimal head.

S - Almost no smell at all. hints of pine needles but its faint.

T - Dominating pine resin taste, Some citrus and lemon grass. Chewy wheat. Lots of bitterness and some tropical fruits at the finish.

M - Medium carbonation and body. Not a mouth coverer at all.

O - Its no Pliny but its a solid IPA. I was expecting a bit more in this beer.
Poured from a bottle in Virginia.  Beautiful amber color with a fine head. Grapefruit aroma. Smooth and well balanced. Not overly bitter. A really nice IPA.

Bottle thanks to timfoolery: Poured a clear golden to orange with a fluffy half finger off white head. Aroma is nice fresh citrus hops. Nice floral and citrus hops front with a mellowing fruit and malt finish. Stays lively on the tongue through. Very nice beer on a relaxing Saturday afternoon.

10oz pour, Horse Brass. Pours light amber, white creamy head, lacing yet to be determined. Aroma is hops. Flavor is where this batboy shines. Pliny-like floral fruity amazingness. Light, though, and the hops are just brash enough. Creamy mouthfeel, moderately high carbonation, long bitter finish. Amazing-- maybe better than Pliny!?!

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2014 Bottle - Floral hops with some orange notes.  Clear gold with a creamy head that wont go away.  Creamy mouthfeel, nice light bitterness that is very mellow.  Orange citrus and pine, great balance.  Draft - from brewery - As good as bottle.
16 oz bottle.  Yellow orange ipa with a light head.  Assertive floral and pine aroma, strong bitter finish.   Good  all around with strong tones... Nothing understated here.

500 ML bottle, bottle date 10/22/10, poured into a rocks glass

A-- Poured a golden amber color. Small, quick fading off white head. Reasonable carbonation with the pour. Just bits of lacing when working through the beer.

S-- Fresh citrus, especially grapefruit. Fresh pine and good dose of Carmel malt. Good smell.

T-- Carmel malt, grapefruit, orange and fresh cut pine. The freshness of the flavors stand out.

M-- High carbonation, very crisp. Flavors are very bold. Not a hop bomb but very good.

D-- Very good. Not massive and over the top like other IPAs. Well designed and thought out. Flavors are well balanced and the ABV is basically zilch. Would buy another, especially considering the price.

Tap. Pours clear light amber with a small white head and good lacing. Aroma is pliny-esque, dominated by silky smooth grapefruit plus notes of pine; yum. Flavor is grapefruit dominated as well, with some malt body giving backing. Clean on the palate with a light bitter finish and a pleasant aftertaste. Fairly light bodied.

Clear, golden with a white head.  The aroma is quite light with mostly citrus.  It has a light body with oily texture and lively carbonation.  The taste is well-balanced with bittersweet flavor throughout.

Bottle. Slightly hazy deep golden with small lasting white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, citrus and a little grapefruit. Flavour is malt, hops, fruits, citrus, pine, grapefruit, little sweet and quite bitter.

Bottle from Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Clear light orange with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and rather hoppy - peach and pine. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 100812

Bottle to pint (from notes). Looks good; golden orange with white head. Smells and tastes of citrus hops and pine with great balance and a good mouthfeel. Probably better than Pliny the Elder, and one of the best IPAs Ive ever had (if not the best).

Draft at Monks. Had in a half pint glass and noticed it looked orange yellow at the top but a yellow green at the bottom. Big fluffy white top that left lace. Big citrus hop flavors. Slight honey sweetness. Lemon zest. Grapefruit pith. Apricots. Pine cones. Not as intense as Pliney the Elder though nearly as hoppy but with a much smoother finish. More refined. (Pliney the Younger still tops them all though!)

Bottle pours a orange yellow not much head. Tastes smells of citrus lemon orange pine resin. Very nice strong smell. Little malt and caramel. Kind of thin a but of tingle from carb  Dry and very very very bitter to me. That took off some points. Pliny a lot better I could see myself wanting more then one glass of this at any time too much. Good for closer to 6 oz
Tasted at the regal beagle in sd; first beer after a tough day.  Light yellow with little head and little aroma. Quite bitter.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2013 Bottle (510 ml). 3 weeks old. Thanks to NorCalAussie for this one! Clear bright golden with a medium white head and heavy lacing. Aroma of pine, tropical fruits and light malt. Taste is slightly sweet with pine, tropical fruits, malt and light to moderate bitterness Light body. Good carbonation. Clear. Crisp. Fresh. Drinkable aplenty. Superb balance. Good aromatic IPA.
Finally got to try this stuff on draft. PRobably better than pliny. Im sure they have had enough time to really work out the kinks of this one.

Had this on draft at Public House. Hop profile is very similar to pliny the elder, so its a great flavor. In fact, tastes just like pliny with less body. Less alcohol, less of a full taste, but still very nice.

Draught @ Brewpub, Santa Rosa.
Rated on 20120721.
Pours clear golden color with small head. Aroma of fruits, hops, hay and lemon. Flavour of lemon, hints of toffee, hops and grass. Very smooth and balanced IPA.
3615
On draft at Apex.  Piney and Citrus hops with a well balanced flavor and just tastes great.  Glad I finally got to try this!

Draft at craft ale house. Pours clear light copper with a finger of white head and tons of carbonation. The aroma is a monster pine bomb thatwakes your nostrils up quick. Taste is medium bitter and the mouthfeel is perfect for quick drinking.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ clear golden. hoppy citrus aroma with some soap and tropical fruits. tropical fruits and soap in thr flavor

140712. [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours light golden with a small head. Aroma hops, citrus. Soapy feel. Medium palate. Not Bad.

Draught at Blue Palms. Clear, golden liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, lemongrass, pine, orange peel, perfume and grass. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of grass, perfume and citrus. Medium bodied and medium to high biter. Nice and drinkable IPA:
Tap. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, fruits and malt.

Draft from La Brasserie Restaurant in the Hyatt Vineyard Creek hotel, Santa Rosa, CA.. Pours a clear orange color crowned by a small gray-ish white and consistent head. Strong hoppy, citrusy aroma, very perfumey. I got clear notes of orange, pine spruce, lime and refreshing pepper mint. A faint cannabis note is also present. Full taste that is moderately bitter and highly acid with a dense lemony character. Medium body, alcohol well-disguised. Finish is fairly astringent and leaves a fine aftertaste. A good American mild IPA.

Another brew that I cant believe I havent rated yet, had to have had this dank ipa more then 20 times. On tap and fresh bottles, Pour is a cloudy glowing yellow orange. Starts off with a lively big head that fades toa nice film. Aromas are bursting with citrus, resinous hops, tangerine, and grapefruit. Taste is malty, earthy, and of course hoppy. Moderately bitter, coats the tongue with a delicious malt caramel flavor. One of the best session ipas ever created.

Meant to be consumed while fresh. So, if you're visiting the Russian River Valley, CA make sure and have a pint. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour clear golden, with a medium -sized and quickly disappearing white head.
Aroma of citrus, slight pine, slight pineapple. A little dull, and not as frisky as expected. 
Taste is a little bitter, with some malty and rather sweet notes. Semi long, and rather dry n bitter aftertaste. 
Average body, with a semi-fizzy carb.

From a 500ml bottle.  Fresh bottle just 8 days old.  Pours golden in color with off white foamy head.  Aroma is big floral hops and just a hint of citrus (grapefruit).  Taste follows with nice grapefruit flavor.  Clean, refreshing and tasty on a warm summer afternoon.

Received as a gift at a stop in to a local bottleshop. Thanks for the hook up!

Pours an orangy color with a two finger head and nice carbonation. Smell is juicy fruity hops, grapefruit, peaches, tangerine. Taste is very nice up front, bitter toward the tail, leaves a hoppy bite in the aftertaste lingering on the palate. A bit grassy and some pine, a bit like pliny but has some differences too. Very light bodied. A very well done single ipa.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2012 A delicious IPA! Very pleasant citrus and floral aroma. A nice lingering aftertaste, with hints of grapefruit and fresh hops. This beer really has everything Im looking for in an IPA. The drinkability is insanely high. Blind Pig is amazingly tasty and refreshing, and would be easily chuggable. Fresh hops with a wonderfully smooth feel. It would be a regular beer for me, if only it was available where I live.

Bottle generously slipped in as on bonus on a trade from ineedbeer, and Adam if youre reading this... dont worry, I drank the beer within days of receiving it, Im just now getting around to putting my notes in here. 

Pours a pale golden color with a big fluffy white head and good lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is herbaceous and grassy with fresh daisies & mild grapefruit. Very pungent & loaded with fresh hops, but also not overbearing or rude in any way. 

The flavor is bracingly hoppy with about a medium level of bitterness. The mix of hops is nice between herbal, lightly oniony, and grapefruity, all balanced just so. The malt character is toasty and ever-present but fairly buried in the hops.

The palate is excellent, sharp, nice high-ish carbonation, but full bodied... or as full bodied as a beer like this ought to be. 

Easily one of the best Hoppy beers Ive tried.

Tap. Pours a nice golden orange color with a white head. Aroma is of grapefruit, orange, grassy notes and pine with some sweet malt. Flavor is again of grapefruit, orange, tangerine, grassy notes and pine with the sweet malt. The body is medium with a dry mouth feel. Overall a solid IPA.
Bottle shared.  Pours clear golden with a white head.  Aroma is strong grassy, pine, grapefruit and damp.  Flavour is a little sweet, fairly bitter.  Medium bodied with light to medium carbonation.

50cll bottle shared at Android ipa tasting.
Thin white head.  Hoppy aroma.  Slightly hazy blond pour. Citrus bitterness.  Great
Pours a light hazy orange ..small white head aroma is pine and citrus ..taste is awesome very well put together ..grapefruit..pine..good hopps..super smooth and enjoyable to drink with my mouth
Pours a dark yellowish color. Very clean and crisp IPA, pine, fresh, citrus. Thumbs up.

On tap at RR. Pour was a strong yellow with light orange and amber. Light white head. Nice lacing on the walls of the glass. Tons of citrus with a blend of grapefruit, orange, tangerine, and pine to add something else. Very vivid and bright. This was quite bitter with white and red grapefruit up front followed by a pine and orange flavor. Malt body was light and clean. Mild carbonation, light body, slight resin like sticky feeling. This was far more bitter than I am used to with blind pig. Either way, this is still one of the top 3 IPAs in the world. Reviewed on: 08-17-2010

On tap @ Capones.  Poured a clear golden straw with a small white head.  Aroma is piney hops, grass, lemon zest, and tangerine.  Taste is bitter hop flavor well-balanced by caramel malt, grapefruit, and orange.  Very drinkable.

Bottled 5/8/12.  Appearance: super clear golden with big fluffy white head.  Aroma: pine, grapefruit, honeysuckle, sweet caramel.  Taste: grapefruit, floral, dry tea leaves, slightest hint of toasted malt finishes bitter and dry like grapefruit pith. Mouthfeel:  thin with medium to high carbonation.  Overall: its not completely blowing my mind.  1 month old couldnt have done anything to it...right?  Its definitely great, and in the tops of my non-double/imperial IPAs, but the taste is not as "big" as Id expected.  But, honestly, its a heckuva a beer, and I probably just had my expectations a bit high.

Draft to pint glass. 
Very piney aroma with some floweryness too. Pours a clear yellowish amber with a small white head. Big pine beginning with a grapefruit end. Very refreshing.

Tap.  Pours mostly clear gold with average, creamy white head; decent retention and some lacing.  Aroma is grassy hops, lemon, orange, straw and biscuit malt, and light pine.  Flavor is hops forward (medium bitterness) with good supporting malt and faint citrus fruit esters; dry finish.  Medium body, carbonation and warmth.

Another of my favorites Ive yet to rate. Pours a deep orange with about a finger of foamy white head. Thick, dank hoppy aroma. Medium light body, an the hop flavors sit nicely on top of the malts. This is one fantastic IPA.

On tap. It pours clear amber, with a foamy white head. The nose is orange, tangerine, pine, grass, pineapple and sherbet. The taste is soft fruit - orange, tangerine and grapefruit, as well as pine, resin, spice and some alcohol warmth, with a long-bitter finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation.

Bottle. Pours golden amber with a bright white head that left sticky lacing. Aroma of pine, citrus, grapefruit, and some orange rind. Flavor was hoppy and bitter with caramel, grapefruit zest, piney resin, grass and had some notes of citrus with a long and bitter dry finish.
UPDATED: APR 23, 2014 Lightly hazy gold, with slightly resent grapefruit aroma.  Taste is dry, drinkable, and not extreme in any way. $5/pint---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had out of the tap at Pizza Port Solana Beach. Pours Amber with a frothy white head, and has aroma of caramel, citrus and hoppiness. Had a delicious bodty, and sat of the tongue with a beautiful citrus top end. 

Excellent!

Poured into a ccb pint. Pours a golden amber with a 2 finger head. Very clear and crisp, lots of carbonation. Aromas of citrusy hops, smells like summer. Taste has a good balance of malts and hops bitter but not too bitter, just enough to make you want more. Very smooth and refreshing, this is a near perfect ipa! Blind pig flies under the radar due to pliny, but it really deserves more recognition!

18 may 2012, tap. Dark yellow, faintly hazy, some bubbles.grapefruit rind nose. Thin body and lightly fizzy. Taste is grapefruit citrus up front, some bubblegum, orange juice. Good all around IPA. Slightly dry but not really a west coast IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Tap at Russian River. Damn...pretty special stuff here. Rich citrus hop on the nose and taste. Ridiculously drinkable. Fantastic beer.

Amazing. I love this beer. It is a great hippy beer that taste similar to the Elder, yet a more bitter finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Almost overpowering hop bitterness with a simple malt backbone. Very dry mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Ventis South. An outstanding India Pale Ale. Big citrus flavors of grapefruit, lemon and some orange. Lots of pine mixed with a mild malty sweetness in the background. Crisp and well balanced. Bitterness throughout that finishes strong at the finish. A well put together brew. Tasty.
Della grande ipa che fu rimane solo un grandissimo equilibrio in bocca ma per il resto il naso è andato.

50cl Bottle at Adam Houseboat Bottle Share, thanks for everything Frank! Clear golden orange colour, white head. Aroma of fruity citrussy hops, light pine, light malts. Flavour is floral, nice dry fruity citrus, juicy, light pine, well balanced bitter finish that lingers a bit. Light to medium bodied. Very refreshing, great IPA.

Originally reviewed: 5/19/09. Poured into my pint glass a murky goldish orange with a big frothy white head resting on top. This dissipates pretty quicky to a thin sheet on top. Great lacing rings all around glass. Smells great! Huge piney hops all over the nose. Sweet floral tones mixed with definitive citrus, make this a very wonderful smelling beer.

Mouthfeel is crisp and yet slightly wet. A little more watered down than I wanted. Flavor is big time bitter up front, and finishes spicy. This beer is absent of a decent sweet malty balance. This finishes a little harsh and acrid. This could be a little more balanced, but still a great IPA. Glad I had the chance to try it.
Pretty good IPA...not as good as Pliny but close. Thought that counts, right?
Bottle. Pours a relatively clear orange with thin white head, decent lacing. Taste is all IPA, but not overdone. Some citrus & pine. Nice lasting palate, easy drinker.

Pint at AS Taproom,  good aroma, sweet, Citrusy, more grapefruit than orange, but both are there. Clean golden orange color.Bittersweet flavor, medium body, creamy smooth, bittersweet finish.  Well, not over the top, aroma best part.flavor little dull.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: 16oz bottle purchased at Monument Liquor in Concord.  This bottle is 8 days old.  The aroma is very intense with a significant amount of floral and citrus hoppiness.  Mostly floral.  Light lemon zest.  Not much else.  Transparent dark golden body with a medium, strong, fizzy white head present.  Starts with some floral and lightly bitter hop character, before this becomes pretty chewy and cereal-like with maltiness in the middle.  Finishes with more citrus, floral, and lightly oniony hop flavors.  Well-balanced, but this beer is a little astringent, and I am just not a huge fan of the hop profile and the grain bill.

Pours a light orange color with a white head. Aroma of grapefruit and pine. Taste starts sweet with a touch of honey and plums, then finishes smooth with a bitter finish. Goes down easy and medium mouthfeel.

Location/Date:Bottle split with Dave on 4/15/2012.
Appearance: Pours a golden clear.
Aroma: Piney hops with some citrus..
Taste: Medium hight bitterness, some citrus, balanced.
Palate:Medium body.
Summary: Thanks Dave for sharing! I can see why this was one of RRs first beers, it is really really good. I want more!
Exactly what I want out of an IPA.  Thin palate, crisp and clean.  Hops in the nose, piney and very bitter.  Hits your palate, and then its gone.  Extremely refreshing.
Excellent APA. Floral nose with bursts of citrus on the palate. Just eminently drinkable and easy to enjoy, yet complex enough that it keeps you interested. I love beers like this.
Clear light copper with a nice white head. Smell is pine / pineapple. Taste is crisp and hoppy - a very refreshing beer!

From the bottle. Light orange colored pour with a white head. Smells of citrus and pine. Hoppy finish. Really good drinking brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Crystal clear copper colour. Medium off-white head. Grainy malty aromas with a little hops. Caramel malts with rich melanoidins. Some bitterness. Overall quite clean and straightforward. More like a pale ale than an IPA.

I'm impressed by this one. Pliny gets all the hype but blind pig is nothing to shake a stick at. 
Great beer RR!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden yellow colour. Pine and citrus aroma. Grapefruit with a nice straw malt. I heart this shit.

Pours a light orange color with a good sized white head and lacing. Aroma is citrus and pine hops. The flavor is piny hop bitterness followed by nice sweet and malty balancing quality. Good drinkability.

Pours with a light golden color and a thick creamy white head which quickly dissipates, good carbonation, smokey malt flavor, pretty good overall and a light warmth of alcohol at the end going down...

A gift from Matt at 3R6P. I had been looking forward to trying this one for some time but it turned out to be a bit of a disappointment. +++ 3/5/12 bottling. Sampled from a 16.9 oz brown bottle this beer poured a dark amber color with a large creamy orange-white head that lingered and left decent lacing. The aroma was sweetish, tangy and floral with notes of grapefruit and pine. The flavor was strong pine, caramel and raisin with light notes of grapefruit, floral hops and lemon. The finish was long with pine, resin and grapefruit lingering. Fairly full bodied. Solid but not all that.

Big perfumy nose-lots of floral aromatics.  Thick but fast fading head.  Light orange.  Great balance.  I have to compare to the Younger (cause everyone else does) and the nose on this isnt quite as delicate but its splitting hairs.  This is a great IPA and the 6% alcohol makes it sessionable while and if you can get it.

I have always thought Blind Pig is a really good name for a beer and this is one brew that easily lives up to a cool name. Its a big, super fresh tasting IPA. It has a fruity, piny nose and is medium bodied w/ mild carbonation. Anyone whos homebrewed knows exactly what this smells like because it has the rich piny smell of hops dumped into the boil, which is different than how they normally come off in a finished beer. This drinks a bit bigger than its six percent but you can still enjoy a few pints of it. A down the middle IPA done right.
Pale amber with a pretty big off-white head. The nose is floral and spicy hops. the taste is very bitter, bitter hops, floral hops, subtle sweet malts. medium to full body. Well balanced.

Bottle thanks to csteele2144, thanks Chris!  Pours a clear light golden with a thin soapy white head and spotty lacing in the glass, huge citrus aroma with nice juicy hops, the flavor has a ton of tropical fruit on the front end with a nice bitterness in the finish, the balance between the hops and malt is nearly perfect, smooth finish, very nice.

Stellar IPA beer here.  While overshadowed by RRs Pliney beers, this is a beautiful IPA in its own right.  Bright citrus aroma comes with a pour that is a dark golden color.  Medium head retention, but a nice hoppy attack with a full maltly middle and a clean finish pretty much puts this in my top 5 IPAs ever.  A perfect beer-drinkers IPA.

Deep yellow pour with little head. Nose of crisp citrus. Taste has a nice malt backbone to meld with the hops for a very nice balance. Mellow bitter aftertaste. Very nice. Thank God for nice people out west to trade this with me.
Bottle thanks Tom, pours a nice bright yellow, the flavour is quite bitter, very similar stuff to pliny just a bit lighter, overall very interesting stuff

finally got to try a bottle of this: not much in the way of a verbal description here. Packed with citrus hops, sweet caramel balance. Bitter, but not harsh in the finish. But plenty of meadow, floral notes that makes this a delightful treat.

Tap at RR Brewpub. It pours clear amber, with a foamy white head. The nose is orange, tangerine, pine, grass, pineapple and sherbet. The taste is soft fruit - orange, tangerine and grapefruit, as well as pine, resin, spice and some alcohol warmth, with a long-bitter finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. A flavoursome IPA.
Citrus,  not much head,  faint floral nose,  mild grapefruit,  pine,  lemon flavor,  very little bitterness,  super clean finish,  excellent

Pours clear golden orange with a large, fluffy, bright white head. Smells like tropical fruit juice: pineapple, mango, citrus. Taste is soft; bitter, juicy. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and average mouth-carbonation, Russian River Blind Pig IPA finishes with a nice lingering bitterness.
Great beer discovered at a local pizza place.  Nice crisp finish and not overly malty.

Creamy yellow color with nice white lacing. A little bit of lemon peel and orange blossom on the nose. Nice floral feeling. A little bit of creaminess on the palate with a well balanced hop and bitter finish. This beer does not try to be to big or crazy. Great spring feel and perfect time to drink this ale.
blind pig. clear golden with small head. aroma of grapefruit and some sweet malt. flavor similar with bold bitter ruby red. very nice. 838415
Golden yellor color with not much head, but some lacing down the sides of the glass. The aroma was full of fresh hops. The flavor matches the aroma. Full bodied and tasty.

Great IPA. Hits you with big aroma of citrus and pine hops and tastes of grapefruit bitterness that is well balanced for the type of beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brilliantly clear straw color with tight white head. Aroma of hops and citrus. Crisp, clean hop forward, fruity taste with slightly bitter finish. Very nice. Thanks to Peacehammer for sending this my way.

From notes.  First reviewed 10/13/2010.  Poured from a 500 ml bottle into a tulip. 

The first thing I notice about the appearance is how light and bright it is. More of a golden copper color than the deeper orange and amber colors I expect from West coast IPAs. A tightly formed, impressive off-white head forms upon pouring and has the courtesy to stick around, leaving soft lacing on the glass.

Great tropical aroma! Pineapple dominates, with grapefruit, a bit of lemon, and mango all making my mouth water at the juicy hops I can almost taste.

Somehow the pale malt seems to provide a support structure for the wonderful hops instead of trying to match it. A light malty sweetness compliments the juicy citrus hop flavors that dominate most of each sip. Unlike some IPAs that seem to create conflict between the malt and hops, the sweetness sets the stage for the main performers, the citrus hops. It finishes clean and smooth, the sign that the recipe really holds up.

Somehow this achieves a level of creaminess I would not have thought possible with a single IPA. Great work to keep it carbonated, smooth, and deliciously creamy. 

More. Please.

Golden color with a nice foamy head. Aroma smacks you like opening a sack of hops. Pine, a bit of grass, peach, mango, and grapefruit. Flavor is beautifully balanced for such a massive hop aroma. Malt backbone actually comes first with the fruity hop notes and the finish is an awesome piney hop bitterness. Awesome.

50cl, as Blind Pig, Bottled on Jan 6th 2012, American brew, from De Bierkoning Amsterdam, complex bitter brew, malty/sweet and slightly woody/floral, easy to drink, balanced, clear, good head, good brew, yet expensive

Nose is wet grass, orange rind, grapefruit, and some caramel. Body is amber colored with a fizzy white head and nice lacing. Overall this one tasted like wet, fresh hops, grass, caramel and some dirt. This one had a light body and went down quite smoothly.

Pours a nice golden caramel color with a quickly disappearing 1 inch head. I can already smell citrus and pine while pouring. Lots of grapefruit rinds and lemon. Taste has a cold sharp bite of pine needles and grapefruit. So refreshing. Hoppy but perfectly balanced with the rest of the beer profile. I think I prefer this over PtE.

Pale golden colour, nice white head with spots of lace on the glass. Smell is pine and citrus, mango, tangerine, soft malty presence, good balance in the nose. Taste is pine and citrus, dry hop with a nice malt backbone, lots of hops in this one, nice bitterness throughout, IBU is up there, clean and very satisfying. Mouthfeel is very oily and slick, good body, nice light carbonation. Great stuff overall, drinks very nicely, hoppy and well balanced

Thanks to OmegaX for sharing this one. This IPA was light and fresh, light but sharp notes of grapefruit and fresh, dry hops enticed the palate. The malt finish was again, light but also sweet and quickly fading into a lingering bitterness. I really liked this one.

Appearance - Golden yellow with a hint of amber. Poured the last bit of it hard to obtain some fluffy white head which quickly subsides and leaves decent lacing.

Smell - Very obvious pine smell to me with citrus (pineapple) right there with it. I have sat here and smelled it a few times now and am still thoroughly enjoying the scent.

Taste - At first there is a hint of sweetness which is overtaken by citrus, pine, and hops.
Mouthfeel - Thickness is a medium with a bit more carbonation than expected, which is not a bad thing for this brew.

Drinkability - Very high! I thoroughly enjoy this beer (thought I give a slight edge to Pliny the Elder). Overall, an amazing drink and it is hard to stop at one.

Sample from a bottle at the CASK brewclub meeting 2-11-2012, at Seven Bridges Grille, Jacksonville.   Yet another extremely well done west coast IPA.  Aroma of sweet malts and loads of hops. Flavor is strongly hop forward, piney, citric and bitter.  A bit dry and lighter abv than expected.  A great beer.
hazy orange color, mango and grape fruit hops aroma, flavor it citrus hops and slight malty sweetness, lots of flavor for such a low ABV

Odd sized bottle from NorCalGrowler, pour is lighter than expected and bubbly nose is hoppy and the taste is a bitter bomb not as bright or floral but definitely west coast, this is good bottled on 1/6/2012 consumed 2/1/12

Draft @ APEX.  Pours a very clear golden color with a thick foamy white head and nice lacing and retention. Aroma is big citrus (grapefruit and tropical fruits)and a touch malt. Flavor follows suit with the mango and grapefruit up front followed by light maltiness. The only competition in the world of IPAs is Two Hearted.  Damn fine beer and so much flavor for 6%.
Rate from memory. had in bottle. Good season IPA. taste like a less intense Pliny the Elder. one of the better IPAs around

16oz pint pours a clear orange with a lacking white head.  Aromas of.grapefruit, lemons, pine, limes, a little honey and some white grape.  Flavor is sweet, malty, lemon, pine, grapefruit zest, fresh cut wild grass.  Medium bodied, dry, zesty, refreshing finish.

Clear light gold with some head  light lacing
Aroma of sweet hops,floral,candy light fruit mild herbal a little resin, some lemon and dank very slightly peppery.Fairly complex aroma, has some light swwet carmel malt as well.Not strong though but  average intensity.
 Good initial mouthfeel developing into a lighter bodied lightly sweet/ mild light toast malt shortlived with a heavy hop presence grassy,slightly herbal/earthy. Some lemony tartness in here as well.With a very dry finish with strong hop flavor and bittering.Another classic west coast ipa,dry ,hop forward and not a strong malt backbone like its suppose to.Easy drinking but with a strong  more noticable hop presence and bittering.Strong long lingering.

Notes from sampler at RR brew pup
Copper in color with nice head retention. Very nice citrus and malt flavors, great beer and easy to drink!
On tap at the brewery. pours gold with a medium white head! The should rename this to pliny light! its amazing!

500ml bottle from a random liqour store near Rogue @ San Francisco, CA
Bottled on 19.12.2011 - Pours orange with a small smooth white head. Strong aroma of fresh hops, grass, pine, malts and fruits. Taste is extremely fresh and bitter with a lot of fruits, grass, pine and malts. Finish is stingy and quite heavily bitter and dry. Quite nice, but perhaps a bit too bitter IPA.

(Bottle) Pours golden with a small off-white head. The aroma is heavily green hoppy with notes of grapefruit, black currant, pine and resin. Lots of toasted malt as well as a pineapple-like fruitiness in the background. The flavour is light sweet to dry and medium to heavily bitter with tones of grapefruit, black currant, pine, toast and white bread. The mouthfeel is peppery and clean. Lingering resinous afterbitterness. Medium bodied.

Bottle; Pour is fairly clear medium gold with a slightly frothy white head in this glass - the head subsides - leaving a haze, and a ring - and quite a bit of lacing as well. The last time I had this one I figured it was infected - So - I waited on the review, and finally picked up a fairly fresh bottle. The nose was nice out of the gate ;  I thought; a cali ipa ... i miss them. Pine and Citrus really (grapefruit), with a hint of caramel and biscuits, The flavor profile started off positive - albeit slightly muted. More citrus, grapefruit, caramel, piney hop bitterness, slightly muted feel, with a hint of vegetable/astringent quality - which is what I find annoying.

bottle thx frank and Heather drank on my thirty first b-day.  A: grapefruit, citrusy, piney its powerfull. App: clear light copper with lasting white head. T/P : light body with a long... long bitter finish. The carbonation is medium . O : Impressive and sexy. The body especially, leave plenty of room for hop expression. Its simply delicious.
