Pours a lovely transparent golden yellow with a 1 finger head. Smells of fresh grapefruit, citrus, a very small nutty flavor on the end. Perfect amount of bitterness with the sweetness on the backend. Just a VERY well put together beer! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2013 On tap at the brewpub. Poured a hazy golden orange, with a bright white  head and good lacing. Smells of grapefruit, citrus, pine, light caramel, grass, candied fruits, and oranges.  Taste is very smooth and balanced  - citrus,  pine, grapefruit, sweet caramel, grass, and light weed with a medium bitter finish. Sticky mouthfeel with high carbonation. Amazing IPA!
bottle thanks ocbeersociety! pours clear honey orange with 1inch white head. aroma of creamy citrys and hops. taste is not as sweet as arom leeds you to think.
Had on tap. Smooth ipa. Balanced without overpowering you with the hops. My first tasting of Russian river

I always preferred Blind Pig to Pliny TE, which seems like heresy to some folks. That tad less alcohol makes it just about perfect, IMO. Definitely a beer you have to try at least once in your life, wherever you live. Fortunately I,m lucky enough to be able to have it much more often!

A nice gold color with a small off-white head and some lacing. A pleasant citrus aroma with a small amount of resin. The taste of hoppy resin with a sweet aftertaste and the right amount of carbonation.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2013 A - pours clear golden with high white head. moderate lacing.

S - aromas of pine and citrus hops, predominantly grapefruit.

M - medium body with lively carbonation.

T -  strong citrus/grapefruit hops on the nose, with subtle pine notes as well. Hops and caramel malts on the palate. Nice bitterness throughout. 

O - overall a quite good IPA seems standard for the style. 

7
Nice IPA. Full of  hops but not very well balanced. still has a nice aroma. Overall just slightly above average ipa
Had this at the Brewery... Great overall IPA, very balanced but has a nice malt on the back.

On tap at The Daily Pint. Mostly clear golden yellow with a tight bright white head, good retention and very nice lacing throughout. Pine and floral hops and grapefruit on the nose - pretty much the standard by which West Coast IPAs should be measured. Flavor profile dominated by the bitterness of the piney hops, though citrus notes are strong, and a caramel and earthy maltiness checks in. Medium to full body, wonderful creamy smooth mouthfeel, lively carbonation, and a clean, crisp, palate-cleansing finish. The quintessence of the style.

Completely clear golden pour, with minimal head but plenty of lace. Loaded with tropical fruits (especially pineapple and mango), orange rind, eucalyptus, menthol and tobacco leaf. Healthy dark-bread malt spine and some boozy alcohol in the back. High bitterness and deceptively well carbonated, scrubbing the palate for the next sip. Light on sweetness, but still on the sticky side. Very good (if not perfect) American IPA

Bottle. One month old. Clear light orange hue with a frothy white head. Loads of sweet grapefruit and citrus rind a slight floral presence. Grapefruit rind, pungent hops, slight kiss of light fruit. Medium body with soft carbonation.
Poured from the bottle it formed a large head. Aroma of citrus and hops really explodes from the glass. Taste is bitter but smooth. There is some citrus and pine that form a nice balance,
Pours honey with a thin white head.  Faint citrus in the nose.  Medium and refreshing.  Floral/citrus hops with lemon, rose petal, and slight salty pretzel.  Delightful.
On draft pour.  Yellow golden color and a nice white head.  Well balanced hoppy ipa.

Bottle shared by phredrik. Pours hop hazed golden amber with a beige head. Aroma is west coast forward IPA with some pine, bright citrus fruits, ripe pear, sweet peach, orange, rather sweet malty backbone, herbs, braed and some pineapple. Taste is fresh citrusy hops, peach, orange, floral, crispy, slight feel of bready malts and some slight tropical notes. Sick balance!

Bottle sent to me as an extra by mashmaster - thanks! Golden pour with a small white head. - nicely hop hazed. The aroma shows a lovely hop profile with tons of fruity hops - pineapple, pine, sweet pear, oranges and zest, slightly herbal. The hops are very well put together. A tad of crisp malt crustiness. WOW what a taste! So pungent and fruity. Pineapple, passionfruit and oranges come to mind, decently but not overly bitter on the palate, some crisp and slightly bready malts as it warms - but mainly the bold hops and citrusy fruits. Exactly what a west coast IPA is and should be.

Sampler @ Capones. Honey-gold with a small whir head, great lacing. Nose consists of very clean hops, faint citrus, and pale malt. Taste is so incredibly balanced...just the right amount of hops and malt backbone. Green hops, some grass, mineral water, and pale malts. Excellent bitterness and unmatched drinkability. One of the best IPAs ever made.
UPDATED: AUG 1, 2014 Bitter grapefruit...  And some grainy notes.  Tangerine and bitter apples.  Nice brew.
Had at capons event with james, Dallas and andrew. Pour is a nice light holden orange. Aroma is mild to sting hops with grass undertones. Flavor is well balanced hops and sunlight. So good.

On draft at Falling Rock during GABF.
Aroma: hop cones, citrus, floral, resin
Taste: bread malts, resin/pine hops
Firm bitterness. I do not understand all of the hype that this beer has, it is a good IPA but there are many that are better.

Shared bottle into snifter. Pours a nice golden straw with little, white foamy head. Aroma is light hops, light citrus, straw, and orange peel. Flavor is again light hop, not overly bitter, grassy, citrus, decent pine notes. Mouth is really nice for an ipa, with lingering notes. This one may not have been fresh, but Im sure a little fresher and it wouldve been solid, but for not being the freshest, it definitely was still good

On tap in a shaker.  Pours copper/amber with an off-white head.  Aroma strong of citrusy hops with a lot of caramel malts.  The malt is strong enough to balance out the huge hop character.  Thicker than most of this style.  A really good IPA.

This is Pliny with some sweetness and body removed.  It has a crisp, yet very resinous, piny nose, with less citrus than Pliny.  Taste is similar to the aroma.  Strong, hoppy, piny, herby notes, and a very large body for a regular IPA.  This is a really awesome IPA.  One of the best.

On tap at Apex with mcberko, pours a translucent orange / gold with a white head. Aroma of piney hops, orange peel and resin. Flavour of piney hops, orange peel, resin, and caramel malts to back. Palate is bitter, but nicely balanced. Smooth.

Pretty solid IPA.  Aroma is dank and resiny with a little pine and citrus.  Taste is resin, spruce, grapefruit and finishes very dry.  Extremely easy drinking and crisp.  Only complaint is that it lacks depth and a touch more sweetness would have been welcome.
Bottle courtesy of ocbeersociety, citrus nose, dank resiny body, long lasting lingering finish. Like a weak devil dancer.

On tap at Apex in Portland, split with Matts_Property, pours a hazy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of piney, resinous and citrusy hops - not much malt. Flavour is very hoppy, with bitter piney hops - not much malt to balance. Finishes dry and bitter. Not as good as Pliny the Elder, but damn great.

500ml bottle from Woodchopper.  pours a clear honey gold with a big fluffy white head and very nice lacing.  aroma is outstanding with orange, mango, pineapple and a hint of pine.  flavor is sweet bready grains, some caramel and a bit of grass which came across as a little odd.  medium carbonation and body.  I could see drinking several of these if they were available in my area.
floral, citrus, great.  Back to back with Pliny makes this hard to rate. If not it might be rated higher. Soo good

Pours a clear golden amber with huge fluffy white head.  Big hop bouquet on the nose with pine, citrus, grapefruit, orange, pineapple.  Hops are more balanced with the malt than I expected, but still plenty of citrus, grapefruit.  Not the best IPA Ive had, but its very good.
Tap.  Gold/amber pour.  Aroma of pine and bready malts.  Taste is of citrus, pine, and soft malts.  Carbonation level is medium.

En tirador y botella.Color cobre ambar.buena retencion y buena espuma dependiendo como la sirvan.Aromas florales,pino,citricos....Bien malteada aunque el lúpulo predomina.Muy bebible.Buena IPA de sessión.Recomendable.

One of the top IPAs Ive had. Like Pliny, doesnt overwhelm you -  but has a great hop balance with citrus notes for a silky smooth taste. Had it on draft at Pizza Port. Its now one of my standout IPAs

A: Pours light gold, fairly clear, 2 finger tight white head, great retention, leaves a ton of lacing.

S: Freshly squeezed hop juice. Lots of citrus and pine, a little pineapple, some dank herbal aromas, a little bit of caramel.

T: Fairly big orange and tropical fruits, a decent helping in pine riding on top, slightest herbal dankness, a bit of floral hop depth.  Just a touch of caramel sweetness.  Very clean, dry, and crisp finish with some lingering bitterness.  Citrus and a little pine/earth linger.  Fantastic.

M: Medium body, perfect carbonation (moderate, extremely crisp), clean crisp finish, very resinous and sticky.   Quite refreshing and easy drinking, this is the perfect body for an IPA.  

O: This is easily a Top 5 IPA for me, probably top 3.  If you want a clean, crisp, dry IPA thats citrus/orange forward with perfect hop-flavor balance, this is it.
Draft at Backcountry. Nice floral aroma on the nose. Some hop flavor on the tongue. This was surprisingly drinkable. I was expecting something weirder.

A hazy orange beer with a thin beige head. The aroma is super delicious witth hoppy notes of grass and pine needles. The flavor is very much in balance between the sweetness and the bitternes with notes of malt, and lots of hops, giving it notes of grass, pine needles and grapefruit.

Pours a nice deep golden-yellow with good-sized, foamy head that stands up well. Nice fresh, clean, floral aroma mixed with the pine scent of hops. Flavor is a pronounced grapefruit-citrus with the hop bitterness in the background and not as strong or front-and-center as some IPAs. A very tasty example of the style.
Bottle sample thanks to portableparty!  Clear tan/orange pour, very fresh & fruity aroma.  Flavor is light pungent hops, good citrus and a medium malt profile.  Solid beer.

Bottle to snifter. Pours clear bright amber and shows a foamy white soapy head that rests to a sticky lacing and film. Aroma is very clean hops that are piny grapefruit and spruce with a malty mix. Taste is more bitter fruity hops that are very floral and grapefruity with a malty ending. Palate is medium and chaulky and finishes dry. Very nice, but wish I would of had this one before Pliny the Elder!

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2011 Poured from a draft into a pint glass at Toronado in San Diego, Calif. Color was caramel amber. Small amount of head. Minimal lacing on the top. Minimal film on the sides.

Hop heavy on the nose, mainly citrus grapefruit. 

A really good taste. A good mix of hops. Mainly citrus, but not too strong. Very smooth.

Medium body. Average carbonation. Smooth rules this beer.

Another good beer by Russian River. Easy to drink and smooth.

Pours a very clear golden color with a thick foamy white head...lively...nice lacing and retention.  aroma has citrus...grapefruit, mango...and some spicy hops...floral with a touch of light malt.  Flavor follows suit with the mango and grapefruit up front followed by light maltiness and outstanding spicy hop notes.  Mouthfeel is light and lvely and the finish is dry and a tad bitter with spicy grapefruit notes.  Excellent IPA!

On tap at the brewery (also a few other times on our north cali trip).  Is in direct competition for me in the ipa category:  two hearted, pliney elder and this - as good as Ive had.  Different, in comparison to elder though - less vegetal with orange, apricot, grapefruit, caramel - as drinkable as it gets.  Would love to sit down with all three.

In taster at Churchills.  Looks almost clear straw yellow no head.  Smells floral and citrus.  Tastes very citrus and flowers.  Definite bitterness that compliments the chili Im eating with it.  Clean palate.  Overall 9 of 10.
Draught from russian river.  Poured a clear golden amber.  Hops aroma, light caramel notes.  Good stufff

Serving: 500 ml. bottle from McGrupp612.  Thanks Jon!  It pours a nice deep orange color with a slight haze and a nice frothy white head.  Nice head retention.  The nose is simply delightful. Lot of sticky hops with notes of citrus, tropicals, and herbal notes.   The flavor is hops and more hops.  Lots and lots of herbals with tropical fruit in the background.  There is some malt for a slight toasty body, but this brew is all about the hops.  Medium bodied with a slightly lower volume of softer carbonation leading to a long, bitter finish.  The finish is really nice with a lingering bitterness but not overpowering.  Extremely well balanced.  This one may take first place in my IPA world.

Rich light copper color. Big off-white, with almost yellow-green tint, head. Slow to die down and plenty of lacing stuck to the glass. Huge aroma of hops. Slight grapefruit, but mostly just straight up fresh hop aroma. Giant hop flavor with a hint of malt. Bitter, sweet and juicy. A slight roasted flavor in the mouth and in the back. Very good IPA. I could drink this one almost daily. But only one at a time unless I wanted to smell like hops all day after. Thats not a bad idea though.

Pours an orange to red-brown with great piney and citrus nose, first sip is perfect balance of malt and hops with notes of grapefruit and orange pith. Finish is great with pines bitterness. Very nice IPA.

had in 22oz bomber shared. the aroma of citrus and floral hops is wonderful indeed. the flavor starts off a tad bitter but quickly fades to that pleasant feel of hops dancing in your mouth.. somewhat of  a sweet malty undertone that doesnt last to long. just a touch of bready yeast in this but the hops are the stars..

Amber-orange in color.  Plenty of fruit citrus and pine, mild caramel maltiness.  Clean citrus/grapefruit and pine hops, orange zest.  Semi-sticky. Some malt peeking through.  Ultra clean overall, with a nice semi-dry finish.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2016 A: coppery/amber color.. good lacing from a medium white head

S: grapefruit, a little grassy, a little floral... 

T: a smooth spectrum of grapefruit, and floral tones... some sweet malt tones pop in and out... very balanced

M: medium body.. moderate carbonation.. nice hop bitterness at the finish
Poor nice and golden very little head. Aroma very floral and piney. Taste is cites rind white pepper wet grass. Good beer thx darn1207.

8/26/11. Bottle thanks to darn1207! Pretty clear light orange pour with a small off-white head that fades but laces plenty. Enormous grassy and piney aroma with undertones of grapefruit and citrus. Rich flavor (without too much body) with plenty of dryness, grapefruit, pine, grassiness and more. Dangerously drinkable and delicious.

On tap @ Hollingshead Deli.
Deep orange brew with a bit of white head.  Lots of pine and citrus hop aroma with some caramel malt.  Flavor is very balanced with a resiny, oily hop finish.  Solid IPA but I expect nothing less from the brewers of Pliny.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2011 Bottled. Thx to Doodler. Golden coloured. Unclear. Dense beige head. Pine, citrus, grape, light flowers and caramel. Caramel, pine, herbs, grape, light flowers. Medium to full bodied. Grapy herbal bitterness in the end. Yet another great beer from this trade. Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Has lots of citrus taste. Has a peachy sweet taste that is offset ted by hop goodness. I love this one another great beer from Russian River. Had it shipped from Bverages4less. Thanks again Freddy.

On tap at the brew pub, served in a tasting glass. Pours clear golden with a moderate white head. The head mostly remains and leaves a moderate amount of fine lace. The nose has pine, lemon and plenty of grapefruit. It is soft, subtle and quite sophisticated. The flavour is lightly bitter sweet throughout. The finish is balanced between moderate bitterness and soft malts. On the palate, it is light-medium in body with a milky texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a decent IPA. It is very soft and surprisingly sweet. It has a beautiful nose, but is not as bitter as I expected. 2011-06-09

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2012 50 cl bottle. Rated on 27.2.2010
Very hoppy aroma with resin and exotic fruits. Flavour is, suprisingly, hoppy too. It contains exotic fruits, some malt and citrus. Good and balanced IPA with not too sweet flavour, I would call this Pliny lite.
8+4+8+4+17=4.1

Draught @ the brewpub. Rated on 21.07.2012
Aroma is sweetish and fruity with mango and resin. Flavour is hoppy with lots of resin, some mango and passion. Hoppy and good, almost too sweet though.
8+4+8+4+16=4.0

On tap at Russian River. Amber with off white head. Citrus, orange, hops, very creamy and smooth on the palate, medium bodied, nice carbonation, hoppy and bitter with a nice long finish. All the flavours are well balanced - very nice IPA.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2012 500 ml bottle.
Pours a deep orange colour with a head that leaves very nice lacing behind. Strong aroma of pine needles, tropical fruits and floral hops. Pretty complex flavour of pale malts, floral hops, citrus, tropical fruits and grass. Long, bitter, fruity, citrusy finish which leaves a nice dry mouthfeel yearning for more. Top-notch. Wish I could get this every day. 8-4-9-4-16 4.1
Draught @ the brewpub, Santa Rosa. Rated on 20.10.2012.
Pours a rich golden copper colour with a white head. Aroma is packed with floral hops and exotic fruitiness. Flavour is full-on aggressive with massive floral hops, grapefruit, caramel and grass. Medium bodied with a long, lingering bitter finish. The bitterness actually burns a bit as its so fresh. Awesome stuff. One of the best IPAs Ive had and this is really fresh as well.
Pours light amber with balanced notes of pine.  Mouthfeel has great texture and once again a firm balance between earth and citric driven hops and some light malt notes.  A nice dry finish.

Russian River
Blind Pig
Thank you to my customer, a fellow beer geek who gave me this, very kind. Pours light golden with a thin white head and low retention. Aroma of earthy, resiny, piney hops. Flavor is slightly metallic with lingering bitter hops and the prototypical dry Russian River finish. Light bodied. Good, but only that, not great.

Deep clear amber color, steady off-white head, lace. Fruity-piney aroma. Medium-bodied. Woody-leafy hoppyness, some citrus, good balance of hops and malts. Light blackcurrant flavor. Great session beer.

Seriously, this beer is substantial but certainly not worth a 100 point score. Stylistically correct, dry as a bone, highly hopped up, finishes a bit rough. Malt to hop ratio is a bit off. I found myself picking hop stems out of my teeth. Excellent carbonation, medium full on the tongue. For $6 I could spend my money on something much better.

Pours a golden honey color with a good white head that leaves some decent lacing. It smells of citrus hops, pineapple piney hops and fresh cut grass, the taste is outstanding the citrus hops and fresh fruit are well balanced by a malty sweetness very full flavored for such a low ABV The feel is quite good its medium bodied with a crisp-refreshing finish.
Overall this is an excellent IPA it rivals Two Hearted as the best non Imperial IPA Ive ever had.

Had this piece of art poolside at Hadhouse Inn in Solvang, CA. A really good cousin to Pliny the Elder. This one is poured golden with a good head and hoppy flavors of citrus, pineapple and apricots. Really good finish.

Compliments of Brian the beer Pimp, enjoyed with Uncle Steve, Celtic Brew and the Mad DrBayern.  Poured a cloudy yellow with a mild hop aroma.  Lace held to the sides of the glass.  The hop flavor was smooth and mild.  Very drinkable and nice in the mouth.  Good aftertaste.

Picked this up in a growler @ Russian river. Pours very clear light amber color. Nice head with good lacing on my shaker glass. Aroma is the only thing really lacking on this ipa. I feel it could be hoppier but that may also take away from how smooth this beer really is. The palate is not too thick, but not watery. And it finishes nice to, not to dry. Overall a great beer!

Huge thanks to Doodler for bringing me that fresh IPA. Frischer grasiger Hopfenantrunk mit kurzen Zitrusnoten, die sich schnell zurückziehen. Auch der Hopfen zieht sich etwas zurück, lässt seine grasigen Aromen aber im Vordergrund stehen. Ab dem Mittelteil deutlich bitter, dabei aber weich. Passend getreidig, die Bitterkeit zieht zum Ende an, wird aber vom stärker werdenden Hopfen im richtigen Maß gehalten. Dunkler Getreideabgang mit deutlicher Hopfendreingabe, etwas staubig. Rundes, gelungenes und vollmundiges IPA. 7/13/10/12/12/12

Bottle 500 ml 
Aroma of pine and green leaf. Highly aromatic , citric with grapefruit  followed by some sugars behind. Finishing with slight alcohol and honey. 7+
 Appearance  gold, bright amber with light tanned beige top. Very nice shade of this ale. 4- 
Flavor and Palate : Medium full bodied. Smooth, almost oily. Nutty with citric feel , grapefruit with plenty of tannins. Great hop-sugar balance. Mild yet very much of an IPA. Solid drinkability with great noticeable class to it.

Aroma: floral hops, grapefruit, some pine, nice toasty and slight caramel malt note.  Pours a crystal clear straw color, fluffy white head with good retention and some clumpy lacing.  Flavor is slightly bitter up front, but its a very delicate and unoffensive bitterness which does not leave any lingering bitterness on the palate.  Citrus and pine sap hop flavors, some grain, slight sweet malt note, approachable and refreshing.  Light-medium body and medium carbonation.  Fantastic IPA, I could easily get carried away and drink a few... if I had a few...

Not sure how to describe this, but it tastes a bit more "green" than Pliny the Elder. I prefer Pliny to this, but that does not mean much as I prefer Pliny to just about anything. This is quite a good IPA and lacking Pliny, I would take this in a heartbeat.

This IPA is one of the easiest drinking yet flavorful and aromatic beers. Its smooth and refreshing with just the right amount of hoppy bite to it. I use this beer as a standard for how I expect an IPA to taste.
Your perfect, all around example of what any day IPA should taste like.  Fresh malts, hopped enough to meet the malts, piney, and resinous.  Damn good bitterness right here!

Medium offwhite head. Amber body with light carbonation. Light
strawy floral aroma with citric strawberry notes. Dry-sweet
grainy strawy taste with roasty earthy resiny notes. Mid-bodied.
Mild, soft mouthfeel. Dry papery roasty resiny aftertaste with
tropical fruit notes. Nice, but very mild and understated. Also a
bit papery. (0.3l draft at urban tavern, San Francisco.)

On tap at APEX. Pours a clear, honey orange with a thin, quickly dissipating white head. The aroma can only be described as pungent. Very hoppy with citrusy notes and an underlying skunky smell to it. The flavor is good, but very tame. Sweet, citrusy hoppiness on the forefront, a slight sourness in the middle, finishing with a strong hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is thin and crisp with low carbonation. Very refreshing. I can see how this would hit the spot on a hot summers day, but I think Id still choose a Twilight or a Two-Hearted over this. Overall, pretty solid IPA. Nothing to write home about. Definitely not as bold as its older brother, Pliny, but still very good!

Bottle/500ml - Pours an orangish amber in color with a small white head that quickly faded to a very thin rim around the top of the beer... low carbonation.  Aroma is heavy with both pine and citrus hops; though the citrus dominates.  Flavor is medium bitter with lots of grapefruit/citrus hops and just a hint of caramel malt to balance.  Finish is lingering and bitter with some of the citrus hoppiness hanging on at the end.  Really good IPA...

Tap @ Stone. Lightly hazed orangey hue, decent head retention. Fresh piney hop aroma, really enticing, plenty of citrus. Dry hoppy, spiced palate, plenty of citrus and spice. Pretty dry in the finish, sweet lingering lemon aftertaste.
On tap. Crazy bitter. Maybe too much so. Pours a light orange pinkish color. Tons of orange Citrus And pink grapefruit. Very pithy. Hedonistic.
Pours golden amber. Super resiny aroma and flavor. Tons of pithy citrus with a hint of caramel. A veritable hop bomb that remains light and clean.  Awesome brew

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2011 500 mL bottle.  Pours golden copper with fluffy white head.  Cool aroma of grapefruit and maybe some berries; pine hops and a hint of honey.  Subtle hop taste along with citrus/orange peel.  Well bodied; slight lingering bitter finish.  This is amazingly delicious; I like this even more than Pliny.

7/6/11: I am knocking this down a point after having this on tap @ Churchills and being a bit disappointed.  Still a delicious beer.
love this beer! my favorite ipa. i always have to get it when i see it.  great aroma and taste

nice solid ipa. the problem with this one is its second in line to the elder. its only brewed once every couple months as opposed to every week. so even local 3 weeks old is a fresher bottle of this stuff. that said, bottle was over a month old and still is very nice. great aroma, very sweet, grassy and floral. the taste is more bitter than expected, less floral and elicate, which is liekly due to age in this category. ive had this beer before and its never totally blown me away, but theres no question its a solid ipa. it fades a bit quick, and due to the extreme polar shift based on slight age variations, i prefer other local ipas over this one.

Bottle thanks to Owen. Pours a brilliant orange with smallish cream coloured head. As expected hops really dominated the nose with bucket loads of fresh citrus, predominately grapefruit and oranges, coming through. Little malt in support but not complaining. Flavours are likewise dominated by the hops though there is a little malt sweetness coming through. Finish shows lots of resiny hop and there is a strong hop aftertaste. Mouthfeel is a little thin but I do agree this makes the beer very easy drink. Thanks heaps Owen for sharing.

Bottle from a trade with thome50, bottled 1.3.11.  Pours clear orange with a frothy 2-finger off-white head.  Aromas of sweet citrus peel, grapefruit, bready malt, and some pine and sugar.  Sweet orangepeel and grapefruit flavor with floral hops and a bitter citrus rind finish, as well as some underlying doughy malt.  Very refreshing, smooth, and drinkable.  Very tasty stuff; thanks!  [682]
On tap at Verdugo Bar, Los Angeles. Hazy golden. Grapefruity hoppiness in the nose and mouth. Very bitter. One-dimensional, but good.

Clear golden yellow, small white head.  Smells super resinous, piney, with a fair dose of pineapple.  Taste was a bigger hop bomb than the nose, but it didnt put me off.  Something about it was so balanced and smooth, I couldnt help but keep taking sips even though it didnt strike me as awesome.  Big piney resinous hop tones dominate the palate up front, and do not really go away until the very end, when the beer relents to display a mild malt undertone.  Like I said though, it all somehow comes out kinda balanced.  But very resinous hopped.  Very Californian indeed.

On tap at Stone Bistro.  Dark orange pour, one finger head and some good lacing.  This is one puckering beer.  From smelling to tasting, the resiny hops threaten to pull all moisture from any orifice of your body you dare to place near it.  Orange-like flavors, but really, its so dry and bitter its hard to get anything but the resiny hops.  Strangely enjoyable experience despite the fact that my tongue hasnt recovered even two hours later now.  Id opt for this over PtE if Ive had neither and had to pick one to try.

Had at The Monks private tasting. Really enjoyed this one. Pours a clear orange with a couple of bubbles sitting atop. Aroma is amazing. An orange salad, blood orange and orange flesh mould perfectly in this one. The taste brings out all the components of an orange; the skin, the flesh, the juice. Finishes with some resinous hops. Fantastic beer, only qualm is the thinness of the palate, although it shoots the drinkability right up

Pour slight hazy golden orange white head nice lace. Aroma big hop aroma, tangerine, pine, citrus, resiny hops. Taste caramel malty backbone, nice bitter lingering feel, pine and citrus hops, grapefruit, tangerine, orange peel. MF medium sticky chewy body nice prickly carb. Excellent brew very good and terrific example of the style A+. Thank you Waver1!!!!

It pours a very light clear orange with about a 1 finger head thats lasts a couple minutes. It has nice lacing because as the head falls it leaves chunky rings of head around the glass.

The aroma is very nice and balanced. Its light in strength but a perfect match of citrus and hops. 

The taste is pretty light and you get no sweet. The start is pretty plain then goes to a light bitter from mid to finish. Light mouthfeel decently drinkable.

Tap @ Outback pizza and taphouse, Boulder. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of grassy and fruity hops, grapefruit, pine, oranges. Taste is fruity hops, orange, kiwi, grapefruit with a nice malt backing. Medium body, soft carbonation. Very nice IPA, refreshing and high drinkabliity. 270211

On tap at Eulogy in Philly. Mostly clear golden pour with a pretty white frothy head. Aroma isnt aggressive, but has great notes of grapefruit, perfume, floral, and grassy hops; complex and enticing. Flavor is similar, with some pale malt balance to add to the citric and floral hops. Palate is the right amount of bitterness, extremely drinkable. A very good non-imperial IPA.
Bottle. Pours orange amber, white head. Hop on the nose, hop on the tongue, hop delight.

on tap @ falling rock tap house. pours a rusty deep orange. piney citrusy hops smells throughout. very bitter but elaborate IPA. very thick dense white head that lasts throughout a pint glass. has a slight noticable oak finish that leaves your tongue nice an dry. one of my favorite IPAs.

Bouteille de 500 ml, vieille denviron 1 mois. Arômes très invitants de pamplemousse et dananas. Robe dorée et limpide, belle petite mousse blanche qui tient bien et effervescence moyenne. Très aromatique en bouche, le houblon, qui était surtout fruité au nez, développe de belles notes de conifères. Le malt céréalier demeure en retrait. Texture légèrement minérale. Belle finale moyennement amère et bien sèche. Larchétype dune bonne IPA de la côté ouest.

Bottle.  Pours a golden orange with a small white head. Nice, orange rind citrus hoppy aroma, with elements of pine and grass lingering in the back round.  A very light bodied IPA that packs a full flavor.  Citrusy flavor dominates the palate which leads into a subtle bitterness that is very well integrated, especially for a west coast IPA.  Also at a lower 6% abv for and IPA, I could drink the shit out of this for a while.

Bottle bonused to me by thome50.  Pour is clear golden orange with a small white head.  Big resinous hop notes in the aroma.  Loads of grapefruit rind, orange, and some pine.  Much sweeter flavor than I initially expected from the aroma.  Sweet fruitiness, caramel, and a slightly bitter finish make this a solid, but unspectacular ipa.  Fairly light bodied and a tad thin on the palate.  Not a bad ipa by any means, but I was expecting a bit more citrus character i the flavor.  Thanks Justin!

Got this in a trade from Thome50. He got it to me fresh (bottled in Jan 11)  Im so happy this comes in 16oz bottles cause Im thinking a 12 oz bottle would leave me wanting a bit to much. RUSSIAN RIVER I LOVE THEEEEE!. sorry had to get that out of the way. First, the pour is absolutely beautiful. Pours a rich golden color with a creamy thick head. Billions of microscopic specks suspended inside. Tiny champagne bubbles. The aroma is fantastic...everything youd want in an IPA. Piney, floral citrus...a ting of sweetness like youre smelling a honey comb. I was surprised how my body this brew has...actually I shouldnt be seeing how RR pushes out perfect brew and perfect brew. So crisp and clean.This is a perfect straight forward and balanced IPA. 70ibus...session....Tons of sweet malts and an perfect ending. The amount of dryness on the end is so satisfying and ideal. Its no ruination but thats not the goal right? Pine resin, grapefruit...cascade for sure. I love it.

Bottle. Pours a golden orange color with off-white head that immediately starts to dissipate and leave lacing. The aroma hits you with citrus, grapefruit, pine, and a small amount of malt. The flavor of course includes grapefruit but is also very earthy tasting and includes a dank bitterness. I dont think the dankness is supposed to be there and I am sure its from the beer not being as fresh as intended. The bitterness is really great though and the finish is nice and dry. I really want to have this beer fresh as I am sure it will knock the taste score up to at least an 8.

slightly hazy, light yellowish straw

Grapefruit blast followed by dank weed skunk. a touch of pine resin and some cat piss

super bitter all the way through. dry, extremely over-hopped. metal pliars twisting tongue bitter. tastes dank with some grapefuirt rine. very faint sweetness of caramel and almost non-existence cracker/biscuit.

mouthfeel is dry with a slightly thin body.

drinkability. I wouldnt have more than 1. my tongue can barely taste anything after one... a 2nd might cause permanent damage.

dissapointed.

I just loooove a good IPA and this is definately a good one! Lots of fruity/piney hops in the aroma which follows through to the palate as well. the malt brings it all together and makes it a wonderful, full flavoured IPA.

Lovely clear golden color with medium white head light. Very sweet floral nose with a hint of resin. Light body, candy malt and floral hops with a little resin. Easy drinking but doesnt pack much of a punch. Could be a great session if the price was right. A little sweeter than I like but nicely balanced in general. Nice.

Received in trade from TexIndy, Thanks for the opportunity!

Pours a clear golden amber color with a huge fluffy white head that sticks to everything. Smells of caramel, biscuit, citrus, kind of sweet and malty with a bit of catty, citrusy hops thrown in. Tastes about like the aroma, lots of sweet caramel malts and lots of pine and citrus hop bite. Amazingly balanced brew! Mouthfeel is sticky and resinous, carbonation is crisp, body is medium. Great Ipa I wish I could get this more easily. Great balance great aroma.

Bottle dated 010311, acquired via trade!  Aggressive pour into a tulip glass results in thin white head that begins to lace.  Color is light golden with some carbonation.  Aroma is hops!  Taste is bittersweet at first then quickly turn bitter and finishes with a piney taste.  Very light tasting and a thin texture.   I really enjoyed this one and would trade for or purchase it again!

Got a 500ml bottle in a trade with StumpyJoeJr (thanks, Ryan!). Poured into a tulip glass. My bottle was about a month old at the time.A: Clear gold/pale color - which is unusual for an IPA. Almost completely tepid after pouring. Forms a generous frothy, bright white head which retains pretty well but doesnt lace the glass much.S: Very fruity smelling and similar to Russian Rivers world-famous Pliny The Elder DIPA. Yellow grapefruit and some tropical fruits plus light, perfumery flowers.T: The first few swigs are fantastic and exemplify West Coast-style IPAs with strong, citrusy bitterness. The palate is notable dry, though, and the hops definitely linger. It seems like this beer was dry hopped and maybe a little too much so. Theres also an iced tea-like flavor present to impart some sweetness and make it slightly refreshing up front, but for the most part its a rather simple, 2-chord palate.M: Surprisingly flat and dare I say watery. I would not call this a crisp beer nor a refreshing beer as a whole. For so much flavor it should probably be more full-bodied.D: As is the case with many beers of the style, Blind Pig is quite quaffable at first, until the hops saturate your tongue and dry your mouth out. The thin body makes it a smooth beer to drink, but the dryness becomes cloying turning it into a sipper. Overall a good American IPA and a great example of the West Coast style. Probably a great beer to have with a hearty or spicy meal. The 6.1% ABV is amazing since it has the robustness of a much stronger beer, but I wouldnt recommend drinking more than one bottle at a time.

NOTE: Watch the video version of this review at:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vulhJHiWPI4

On tap at Falling Rock tap house pours golden orange with a medium white head. Aroma of pine citrus and hops. Taste is very crisp and refreshing well balanced flavors similar to aroma. Simple flavors but very pleasant and drinkable.
UPDATED: JUN 25, 2013 Draft. Pours orange/gold with a nice white head. Aroma is fruity citrus hops, grassy and piney notes. Flavor is a nice balance of malt and west coast hops with a smooth finish.

Considering a fact that I dont like IPA and this is the first one that surprised me with non overpowering bitterness and lots of flavor I give it top rating. Great beer with everything you want from IPA with addition of perfect taste. Strongly recommend it

Clear coppery gold pour with a thin but sticky head. Some sweetness up front, with a flood of citrus, pine, and grassy hop flavors to follow. Finish is modestly bitter. Palate is light and crisp with perfect carbonation. Fantastic. Like a better version of DFH 60 minute.

Clear light golden body with short head. Fruity aroma mainly citrus hops. All hop flavour, didnt really get to much malt, grapefruit bitterness,  medium body, a little bit of grassiness in there as well. Drinks too well.

Pours a mostly translucent golden approaching copper.  White bubbly head that collects unevenly.  Lace coats the glass, almost like a film.

Beautiful aroma!  Flowers, pineapple, grapefruit, some pine.  A very light, sweet, tart, and sharp scent.  Something about this aroma is different.  Pure hop.

Taste follows the aroma but is more bitter, and piney on the back.  But mainly a big floral hop taste followed by pineapple juiciness and a piney, bitter dryness.  Some butter and white bread malt but its far behind the hops that dominate this beer through and through.

Dry and sticky aftertaste that makes me want more.

Great, immense hop flavor without getting very big as a beer.  Its not so much a truck load of hops as it is enhancing and isolating the hop flavors.

Bottled poured into a tulip glass.  The aroma is to die for.  The sweet sticky citrus and bitter pine come through on the nose.  The appearance is a clear light yellow with a thin white head that vanishes.  Taste is dead on for an IPA, grapefruit and spruce.  Just like I like it.  The palate is a thin mouthfeel for an ipa, but that makes this one sessionable.  Oveall, a tremendous offering that you should pick up when you see it...which is not that often.  Cheers!

The aroma is near perfect with an scent of fruit followed by hops filling the nose. The appearance is a very light golden/yellow color with an essence of orange buried within. The taste is exactly what Id expect an IPA to be, the finish is the only thing that leaves more to the imagination. I understand this beer is meant to finish clean and smooth, but I prefer a more hoppy finish. Although I will always choose Pliny over this beer, this is still a high quality beer that I enjoy drinking

500mL bottle poured into a pint glass. Received from a trade with jamesm7485. Bottled 09/30/08.

4.0 A: Very pale orange in color. Ive never seen an IPA so light. Two inches of thick creamy head that retains well and leaves lots of lacing.

4.5 S: Fabulous aroma. Very hoppy with floral and herbal hops. A slight citrus tang with orange most pronounced. Not a lot of malt character.

4.0 T: Tons of hop character, though not very bitter. Bitterness comes out mainly on the finish. Grassy hop flavor with a touch of citrus. Malt bill is lacking in complexity, or at least to the point where it cannot rival the hops.

3.0 M: Medium body though on the light side. Easily the worst attribute of this beer. Lacking the creaminess I want from an IPA, though quite smooth.

4.0 D: The mouthfeel is a bit distracting, but the taste is so good that it makes this beer sessionable to say the least.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-23-2009 00:47:37

Has a nice light golden yellowish color and a delicate white head. Very nice citrus and hop aromas, lighter than Pliny the Elder but still very noticeable. Tastes extremely light and well-balanced, with hops and citrus strongly evident, but not dominating, as the beer kind of flows along very smoothly from taste to taste. Very easy on the palate, and incredibly easy to enjoy. Bottle goes fast.

Smell is very fruity and citrusy! Can smell hoppy aroma. Its like smelling fruit juice. Orange to golden orange in color, with half inch whittish head and minimal lacing which goes away quick. Citrusy in flavor, pineapple and other tropical fruits! Malty with sweetness. Bitter but not as hoppy as a double IPA like its sister Pliny the Elder. Smooth and dry, very, very drinkable. Wish the store lets me take out two or more bottles when its available. So delicious and highly recommended.
On tap at falling rock. Amber gold with quarter inch cream head. Nice floral and citrus aroma. Flavor is grapefruit and pine. Delicious and smooth. Most sessionable IPA Ive ever had.
Great ipa, really great. Pale gold, smells hoppy with light fruit tones. Full ipa flavor, lite bitter an dry finish. Light fruit, really great

On tap at the Hopyard. Pours a clear orangish gold with standard white head. Aroma is primarily of perfume, orange peel, and red fruit potpourri. The flavor is an intense rush of flowers, orange peel, and grapefruit. A perfect IPA finish: hop rush that gets more and more intense while somehow maintaining good balance, then it slowly fades for soft citrus sweetness. An excellent IPA. Russian River does it again!

On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, San Francisco.Clear yellowy orange colour with a smallish white head. Nose was as anticipated, fragrant hop in abundance, with further notes of citrus and sweet malts. Fresh, fruity character in the flavour and some good balance stopped the hops from completely dominating affairs, although they are most certainly given a great platform to shine from. Really drinkable. Top notch beer and would love to try again, but the Pliny gets the nod over this. The white stick pump handle is a great little touch though, and Ive thoroughly enjoyed all that Ive tasted from RR thus far.
Big hoppy aroma with earthy piney notes. Slight citrus in the flavor, bitter, but nothing over powering. Slightly heavy in the mouthfeel, but  wont destroy the palate.

Thoroughly enjoyed from a 16.9oz bottle in a wine glass.  The beer pours a lightish amber hue, with a moderate off-white head.  The nose shows aggressive Simcoe/Columbus character, along with additional complexity that seems to come from additional late and dry-hopping with other west coast varieties.  The palate shows an extremely refined and complex level of bitterness initially, before showing a level of hop resin and flavor that is unique, even for American-style IPAs.  The finish shows lingering hop flavor, but remains crisp and dry enough to allow the beer to be eminently drinkable.  Overall, perhaps the most refined, complex, and drinkable example of the style Ive experienced.

Huge thanks to dave! Bottle pours orange gold with a white head.  Aroma is exploding with massive hop depth showing citrus(orange, grapefruit), stone(peach, apricot), and tropical fruit (pineapple, mango) balanced by a sweet caramel backbone.  Flavor shows the same.  Overall body is moderate, sticky, and finishes with a balanced, lasting bitterness.

From notes:

Pours a clear golden yellowish orange color with burnt orange hues when held to a light source and a 1.5 finger frothy white head that has decent retention, only slowly fading into a lasting ring. Sporadic chunks of lacing left behind.

Uber fresh dank resinous hop aroma that is bursting with tropical and citrus fruit notes as well as some earthy pine and subtle malt. Hints of grapefruit, pineapple, mango and lemon peel.

Chewy body thats on the fuller end of the spectrum with lots of extremely fresh juicy hop flavor and slight bitterness that lingers throughout. As in the aroma, there are lots of tropical and citrus fruit notes as well as some earthy pine needle and slight malt characteristics. Again, Im picking up hits of mango and pineapple as well and grapefruit and citrus peel. Slight earthy resinous hops balance out the sweetness and their is just a touch of pale malt to balance out the bitterness. The ABV is extremely well masked makng this delicious beer dangerously drinkable. Highly recommended!

Tap @ Pizza Port Carlsbad. Tropical Fruit. LOTS of it. Bracing bitterness. Medium bodied. Not overly complex but really quaff-able. Great lacing and really well crafted. Well balanced for such a hop monster.

Bottle in trade with mikedashg.  Thanks Mike!. Pours a beautiful yellow amber color with a thin white head and nice lacing.  Aroma is citrus hops.  Medium on the palate with nice carbonation.  Flavor is an incredible balance of malt and hops.  I would definitely drink a lot of this if it were available where I live.

Poured a lite golden color. Little cloudy.  Aroma of fresh citrus hop flavor.  Frothy head.  When I drink this I notice first off that it goes down creamy and frothy.  Med bitterness.   Finishes bitter.  But a very smooth ipa overall.

Rich gold color.  Bubbly off-white head. Strong scent of hops and orange
Extreme hops from start to finish. Dry crisp finish.

Loaded with fruity hops on the nose.  A bit darker than a typical IPA.  Smooth and dry with an astringent, bitter, hoppy flavor.  Vegetable and roasted malt notes.  Other IPAs seem to better match my tastes.

A mild hazy lite amber with thin white head and some lacing. Smells of fruits, pineapple, oranges, grapefruit, pine...I could sit and smell this all nite. Taste if more hop forward, citrus and piney. Sweet fruits not a present as in the nose. Malts are smooth and lend a nice balance. Body is medium, medium carbonation, medium  hop bite and dryness. An excellent hoppy brew with nice citrus, fruit and malt notes that any hop head should love!

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2012 Tap @ Falling Rock. Completely clear, golden orange appearance with an off white head. Potent resiny, mild piney, citrusy, organic hoppy aroma. Somewhat bitter, resiny, lightly piney, citrusy hoppy, smooth flavor. Very ready drinking and not nearly as assertive as some IPAs.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2010 On tap at Beachwood BBQ, Seal Beach. Deep golden pour with a fine off-white head that leaves a wonderful amount of lace on the glass. Nose and taste are citrusy, grapefruit hope with an elegant malt backbone. Finish is just the right amount of hop bitter without being too biting. An excellent IPA.
My first beer at RR, served by true professionals, in the company of friendly locals.  Who can ask for anything more?  Oh, and by the way, its a very nice IPA.

On tap at Russian River.

Pours a nice orange-copper color with a good white head. The smell is of powerful hops and a bit of sweet malt. The taste is much the same, with overriding citrus and floral hops with some pine in the background. Mouthfeel is very good with the medium body and moderate carbonatinon, and this is one of the best-drinking IPAs that Ive had. Solid work.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 09-24-2009

On tap. Clearish golden with a small pure white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, pine, cat pee, flowers and light bread. The flavor is tons of bitter hops with just enough malt presence to balance it out. Medium to light body with active carbonation and a dry finish. Excellent beer, this is my style of IPA, very dry with tons of hop aroma and a strong bitterness.
helt makalös doft, kan inte bli så mycket bättre. Otrolig mängder tropiska frukter. Smaken höll inte riktigt samma klass dock god som fan.

Golden brown pour with a small white head.  Small amount of lacing and minimal retention.  Piney with a citrus hoppiness starts off the aroma, giving way to a caramel malt finish.  Hops to start, hops in the middle, and hop bitterness to finish.  Citrus and piney just like the smell, all based on a nice subtle maltiness.  Light and smooth, crisp and clean.  Very enjoyable drink.  Wish I could have it more, but itll be a long time until we see this sold in PA I suppose.

A citrucy hop bomb!!!!! Its all citrus all the way. Very little malt, no pine notes to speak of. The bitterness it wild, and gripping. Leave an unbelievable citrus aftertaste. Incredible stuff! Man i wish i could get it all the time. Vive russian river!!
On tap.  Very spicy IPA, resinous with citrous notes.  Sampled along side RR IPA.  Very different flavors.  My palate injoyed the RR IPA more.  Nice example though.

bottle courtesy of luckyhank, thanks. pours a hazy yellow with a thick frothy head. foam dissipates rather quickly. tastes like a delicious pine tree with some floral notes. very bitter and it lingers for a long time. fantastic beer

Pours a golden amber with a thick white head. A very mild hop aroma although I have been quite stuffed up lately, due to Wisconsin weather. Light sweetness, medium bitterness. A very mild and unoffensive IPA. A fantastic dinner beer. Received in a trade.

500ml bottle. Pours golden amber with a thick rocky head that seems to last forever. The aroma consists of caramel, cereal, resin, floral, grass, and citrus. It tastes fairly sweet with an intense bitterness that dominates yet doesnt overwhelm the palate.

Bottle courtesy of Stefan, thanks much.  So anyway, my mouth came...... can I say that?  Anyway, one of the top IPAs Ive had.  Its unfortunate, most of the best IPAs are on the west coast and I live in Michigan. I shouldnt complain, we represent and things could be worse.  Job well done!

.5L bottle via Stefanje the fantabulous. Pours a medium semi hazy amber with an initial lofty white head that settles to a ring rather steadily.  Fine lacing.  Substantial nose of piney hops.    Creamy and gentle up front.  Piney hop nose surprisingly translated into a whole hop genteelness.  Duration is quick.  Slightly undulating finish. Thank you comrade.

500 ml. bottle  Pours a cloudy golden orange with a nice fluffy white head.  Aroma of piney hops, floral hops and citrus.  Taste is incredible.  Nothing overpowering, just very well balanced.  So very drinkable.  Exceptional.

1. On Tap at the Vine Street Pub, Denver 14/09/2010
Big hop aroma. Golden coloured and very hoppy with pine and citrus flavours. A hint of dryness in a bitter malt finish.
2. On Tap at the Vine Street Pub, Denver 14/09/2010
Big hop aroma. Golden coloured and very hoppy with pine and citrus flavours. A hint of dryness in a bitter malt finish.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2011 From notes compiled on a recent trip to northern California: Silky smooth, incredibly well balanced, and prominently hoppy in the nose (both aromatically and while drinking). This is everything an ipa should be except available in my home town. If this fought with Pliny the Elder, who would win?

Bottle. Bright golden colored with a half inch of fluffy white head. The aroma is a sharp and fragrant blend of grapefruit, resinous hops and pine. The taste starts with strong floral hops and ruby red grapefruit flavors along with dried mango and pine resin. Theres also some toasted malt flavors in the background that nicely balance the aggressive hops and citrus flavors. The finish is extremely dry and crisp with a strong bitter aftertaste. The overall flavor is wickedly bitter and dry with loads of juicy citrus and potent hops. Easily my favorite West Coast style IPA.
Bottle brewed last month.  This beer is really dry.  Its good, but not Pliny.  The piney and resiny notes are not as crisp.  I also thought it was a little more floral.  Did I mention it was dry....
Bottle:  Pours a clear golden with an off-white head. Fresh cut pine tree, citrus aroma. Medium body with sweet pine fruity taste.  Dry pine citrus bitter finish.

Finally able to get a pint at Brouwers during Hopfest. Simply great. Hazed golden pour with light foamy head. Sweaty, bready nose. Tasty, body is hugely flavored orange, hearty bread. Roundly bigger finish. very solid.

On draft at stephanies. Pours a hazy yellow with a foamy head. Smell is slightly floral, mostly a woody hop note. Flavors are a musty, thick hop syrup with a sticky finish. Still light and bouncy on the tongue. Really nice ipa

Had on draft.  Smooth amber pour with a white head. Aroma is hoppy with a hint of  citrus.  Medium bodied with a dry finish. Taste is crisp and a bit bitter, but overall a good balance. overall a very good IPA.

500mL bottle pour.  Thick foamy head with outstanding retention and lacing.  Body is medium amber with a white head.  Aroma is pine and citrus hops.  Flavor is citrusy and bitter.  Definitely feels like Pliney Jr.  Overall, an amazing brew!

From a bottle. Pours a golden amber color. Clear with little head. Aroma is very hoppy with some grapefruit. Flavor is very well balanced, lots of hops and some citrus. Palate is a little dry. Overall an excellent IPA.
huge grapefruity nose. Moderately hoppyouth , hood balance , dry, hoppy a bit chewy. Very nice. Would love to have it fresh.

A: snifter. nice amber color, more orange than yellow. pure white head with outstanding retention, and nice hanging lacing.

S: huge high alpha hops aroma. tons of citrus and pine, grapefruit and spruce.

T: such a well-balanced AIPA. wonderful malts with a huge amount of citrus hops, mostly grapefruit surrounded by some big pine and spruce trees.

M: so well-balanced. perfect carbonation level. clean, crisp, and extremely smooth.

D: I could drink tons of these, I just finally found a beer that could possibly replace Two Hearted as my favorite.

Bottle from Pizza Port store in Carlsbad. The aroma has citrus, grass, pine. Clear, yellow colouredbeer with a lasting, white head. The taste is crisp, clean and bitter. There is a combination of citrus, flower, grass and pine on a light malty background. The beer is medium bodied and has a dry end. Very straight forward IPA, great one for the hot summers.
Bottled @ kloneo, thx skortila. Golden colour, white head. Aroma is hoppy, flwery, citric and pine. Flavour is hoppy, citric, flowery.  Fairly bitter, dry finish. Good drinkable.

Nice golden pour with some foamy white head that dissipates somewhat quickly.  Aroma is very grassy with a little sweetness and some pine coming through as well.

Flavor is a good balance between the  slight citrus elements and the biter hops.  Very well balanced with the same profile as PtE, but definitely more drinkable.  Good beer.  Would drink this again.
Thnx Skortila. Golden colored brew. Melon and floral hoppy aroma. Flavor has pine, melon, floral hops. Strong hops. Nice brew.

Bottle thanks to JohnnyJ. Pale gold and a white head not lasting too long but average. Big nose of grassy hops, cirrus, pineapple, sweet malt, and fruity hops. Taste is fruity, citrus hops, and nearly no malt to speak of. Really smooth and not too bitter, really great.
Piney aroma, medium bodied IPA, with a sharp citrus flavor.   Could invoke blindness in a pig.
Sincoe and citrus hops in aroma.  Light copper with thin head. Nice hop flavor - amarillo? Great

At the brewery.  This one really blew me away.  Its like Pliny the Elder except with a bit less alcohol and possibly even more resin.  I tasted them side by side.  And while Pliny is absolute perfection overall, Blind Pig is a better session ale.  If you just had this one by itself, you would find a nose of grapefruit and pine resin, and a delicious crisp, long, bitter finish.  This one is like a mouth full of tree sap.  My favorite of all the tasters.  I even took a growler away for the rest of the trip.

Served from bottle into a Stone nonic.  Pours a clear golden yellow-orange with a two finger off-white head.  Maintains excellent lacing throughout.  The aroma is comprised of malt, tropical fruit, and  malt.  The flavor is of bitter tropical fruit, smooth hop bite, with a big hop bite upon swallowing.  It is medium on the palate with high carbonation.  Overall this is a very nice IPA.  Another one from Russian River that I wish it were available in my area. One of my favorite American IPAs I have had.  Very nicely done Russian River...

( 16.9oz bottle).  Pours dark yellow with chunky white head.  Aroma of grapefruit, mango, lemon.  Taste is sweet with hopiness following.  Light bodied with thin texture.  Finish is bitter and very much like grapefruit.  This is an excellent IPA-maybe my new favorite!
bottle. Right to the point, hops and more hops. pine and citrus nose. Flavor is also pine and citrus dominated. Another great IPA from Russian River.
0.5l - Pronounced alpha nose, sweet citrus too.  Orange liquid with white head.  Hops dominate on palate, a bitter pinch and bitter finish.  Kind of one dimensional, even for an IPA.

500ml Bottle. Hazy and deep golden in color. A small head leaves some heavy lacing as the glass empties. piney hop aroma with citrus notes.  Medium bodied, a bit oily with a light bitter finish. Straight forward IPA flavor really a benchmark of the Cali IPA. Overall a decent offering.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text:
I split this bottle with a college buddy who started to get into craft brews and liked IPAs so it was even more of a treat. 
Bottle poured into snifters produced a nice two finger white head that settled down to a thick lace. The body of the brew was cloudy golden amber in color.

It had a great hop forward nose plenty of citrus and floral grassiness. It was just what I expected in a RR brew. The flavor was well balanced for a west coast IPA which was surprising to me. You do get the hops bitter first but the sweet malt balance was a shock to me but pleasantly so. It had a medium feel to it with good carbonation.

This was a great drinking IPA one I was proud to share with a craft brew newbie I was glad to try this one and wished I had more

Aroma:Sweet grapefruit and apricots in the aroma.

Appearance:Pale gold in color, nice head retention and lacing.

Taste:The hops hit very hard on the first sip. After that, mild malty sweetness make a pleasant pairing with the citrus flavored hops. The flavors drop away quickly through the midtaste and aftertaste.

Palate:There is some astringency because of the huge hop bill in this beer, but aside from that its very drinkable, almost creamy. There is a moderate amount of carbonation, that makes this beer refreshing to drink.

Overall:I really enjoyed this beer, the malt gives it a mildly sweet palate upon which the brewer was able to paint great hoppy flavor. Its got so much flavor, that while it might be able to be sessionable, I believe it would be a waste to drink it that way.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2010 This is a rating of a fresher bottle than my original rating.  From notes.  Tasted from a bottle purchased at the brewery, bottled on 09/07/10.  Pours clear pale orange with an average white head that leaves spotty lace.  The nose is mango and pineapple sweetness with some caramel malt and a green hops component.  The flavor is intense resin bitterness with the malts and fruits acting as a backbone.  The back is dominated by bitter hops along with lemon and orange peel.  The body is medium and sticky with average carbonation and a long bitter finish.

On tap.  Enjoyed this - particularly impressed by the skunky (in a good way) hop aroma.  Amazingly pungent hop flavor.  Gold appearance with small head.  A little thin on malt for my IPA taste but takes the crown for hop blend.  Very nice.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2011 500mL. Poured a clear to slight hazy orange, glowing with a large, rocky, cream head that left massive lacing of Jesus. Aroma is massive mango pulp, resinous hops. Taste is dry, void, saw dust, bitter, thin. Not fresh (?). Ill take another Sculpin and Alpine Duet. K thx bye. 7/9/2010 8/5/6/3/12=3.4Tap at Toronado SF. The pour is a clear orange with a small but sticky white head. Aroma of fresh citrus, pineapple, and caramel. Taste is dry, earthy, potpourri, bitter, lemony. As it warms, sweet Valencia oranges come into play for some sugary body. Less full and less fruity compared to PtE. But overall it is super fresh, quenching, and neither malt forward or malt forward. Yum! 2/4/2011 8/4/7/4/14=3.7500mL thanks to OaklandBrewer. Consumed exactly one month after bottling. Pours a crystal clear light orange to deep gold. Thicker, off-white head. Thick rings of lace. Looking good. Nose is thick orange peel, rich citrus, melon character. Approaching an 8 for nose. Taste is sharp, bitter, lots of citrus rind. Nice stuff, could use some extra butterscotch thickness. Perhaps a little dry with nice hints of kumquat and meaty jackfruit. Nice refreshing, lighter mouthfeel. 3.7 is about right. Nice stuff though there are plenty of better IPAs in the sea.

Bottle. Pours yellow-gold, with sediment and a slight, filmy head. Portent aroma of earth, pine and light grapefruit. Flavor is a little less intense than the aroma, comparatively. A very nicely balanced IPA with myriad hop characteristics, like pine, resin, citrus, and florals. There is also a good amount of sweetness to anchor it all. Medium bodied, very smooth, with modest carbonation. Not aggressively bitter. The finish is citrusy and sweet, with perfect bitter memories. Superb IPA.

Bottle thanks to PeteinSD. 
Holy shit this is one damn good IPA.  My favorite non-double IPA used to be Two Hearted.... until I cracked this one open.  Awesome hoppy aroma and extremely flavorful while remaining easily drinkable at the same time.  Flavor is full of juicy piney hops with a good amount of resin.  The best regular IPA Ive ever had.  Its a damn good thing this isnt sold in my area since I would likely drink multiple bottles on a daily basis.

On tap at Monks in Philly.  Pours a bright orange with a generous white head, nice thick lacing.  Aroma is pine and citrus, very earthy quality to it.  The flavor is amazing, it starts with a grassy hops burst with nice but not intense bitterness, followed by a wonderful sweet and malty balancing quality.  Not a hop bomb, this one is easy drinking and probably one of the most balanced IPAs I have ever had.  Very smooth and enjoyable.  Top notch.

The little brother of the Pliny, this is another excellent beer.  The malt and hop profiles are just as broad as the Pliny, but just not as intense.  This brewery does an excellent job of balance, which is rare in the hop arms race that is currently occurring in the west coast breweries.

This was quite a treat to find on draft in CO. In the middle of a five day road trip I found this on tap and the initial taste screamed west coast. Theres just something about these west coast beers. Hoppy, crisp, and saturated with citrus, but medium light in body, I could drink this one all day long if only I didnt have a girlfriend. Or a job. Or, other thiiinnggggsss. Excellent crisp brutally hoppy IPA thats as balanced as a crotch shot on AFV.

Pours a hazy orange/amber color with a good tan head. Very nice lacing. Big hop aroma of grapefruit, pine, and other sweet fruits. Taste is highly sweet without being too cloying. Bitterness cuts through perfectly. Good body and carbonation. Ill look for this again soon!

OK, I buy the hype but this is one great beer. Grapefruit, pine, everything great in an IPA aroma is here. Same as the flavor. Bitter, lip puckering hops with a shit load of other stuff floating around.  Looks great with a clear amber and a nice lacing head. Dont let the in-laws get too close to this one. The best part is the great after taste that lasts and lasts. Thanks Hawthornes in Philly for getting this one.
Pours orange with white head, aroma is florals, pine and grapefruit.  Taste is bitter with a excellent dry finish. Extremely smooth. Awesome beer.

Light gold in color, clear, quarter-inch long-lasting head leaving great lacing. Strong citrus hops presence, grapefruit. Medium body, smooth, long-lasting finish. Some sweetness in the malt, strong bitter hops. A darn good IPA.

Draft @ Brouwers; clear orange with creamy white head lingering; mango and pine on the nose; sticky sweet, thin mouthfeel; much more pine than I remember previously; lots of bitterness up front but never becoming harsh or astringent; some oranges mixed with mango, light caramel and white sugar; sticky and reminding me a little of liquid jello

Original Rating 8/27/08 (Score - 4.2): 12 oz. bottle @ liquid sunshine; thanks bitbucket; while I was a little underwhelmed by this at the brewery, a bottle a few weeks later really knocked me out; pours dark amber and mostly clear; huge aromas of sweet pine hops and citrus; smooth and bitter, but never overwhelming; a little chewy and syrupy; wow, a great IPA

Pours a clear light golden amber colour wih a medium frothy white head. Aroma is of pine and grassy hops with a very prevalent cirtus smell; oranges. grapefruit and peach. The taste is sweet with the citrus fruits evident as well as a strong hop bitterness throughout. Creamy mouth feel, medium body and good carbonation. Overall an excellent IPA, one the best I have had no question.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2010 Draft at Teresas with pat. Pours a slightly hazy yellow copper body with small white head. Aroma is nice, fresh pine hop. Mouthfeel is medium and dry dominated by grapefruit rind and seed.

Teresas - draft into standard pint glass
Pours a cloudy, golden amber with a two-finger white head which dissapates into a frothy coating. Lacing is abundant, lasting and beautiful. Nose is a mild hop aroma with some grassiness and pine and some citrus, especially oranges and grapefuit. Taste is a wonderful hop bitterness, oranges, grapefuit, pineapple, mango. Bitterness never leaves but never completely overcomes some sweetness in the back that holds as well. Mouthfeel is really interesting rough edges on a medium to light brew - great fun. Finish is somewhat dry and bitter but never too much. Drinkability at this reasonable ABV is guaranteed. I want another NOW

Bottled on 041610, so says the bottle. Pretty fresh so I am really excited to try this beer! 
Pours a light colored orange/yellow color with a fluffy white head. Head settles down nicely and sits atop this great looking brew. 
The aroma is of strong citrus and pine.
The first sip is smooth with a nice bite from the hops at the finish. Citrus rind is the prevalent bitterness with slight pine.
West Coast IPAs seem to have less body than those here in the midwest which is a nice change from most of the malty IPAs I find here. There is just something about them that makes them different than anything else, not better or worse, just different.
Good overall IPA.
Pours a clear apricot amber with nice white head. Nose is very pleasant floral hops and citrus. Taste follows suit with satisfying pine needle finish.

Bottle. 

Hazy orange amber, quite a lot of sediments. Medium-sized off-white head. 

The aroma is of exotic fruits, mostly pineapple and mango, grass and mild tobacco notes. Very hoppy, not a whole lot of malts manage to get through. 

The flavor is tightly held and centered around exotic fruit aromas, crisp citric hops and grass. Do I also pick up some elder flowers? Medium sweetness and notes of caramel in the background. The finish is slightly perfumy and very bitter with resiny hop notes. 

Moderate body and quite a lot of carbonation.

Lovely IPA. Actually comes out as the Mini-Me of of Pliny the Elder.

Appearance: A bit more golden than most IPAs Im used too. Nice oily sheen across the top of the beer once the creamy white 2 finger head relaxes. Head has good retention and leaves a fine layer of lacing everywhere.

Smell: All floral hop oil goodness here with citrus undertones that range through lemon, pineapple, grapefruit, and orange. Beautiful smelling beer.

Tasting: An excellent tasting IPA with hops dominating and no strong malt profile to counterbalance which is a good thing. Especially considering this low malt high hop style IPA is extremely drinkable and astringency free. Nowhere near as hoppy as Pliny the Elder, but its not a DIPA so it shouldnt be.

Mouthfeel: Perfect carbonation makes this gem creamy and medium bodied. Very nice mouthfeel indeed.

Drinkability: Probably one of the most drinkable IPAs that doesnt disappoint on the hops. Could suck these back all the time if I had more access to them.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-10-2008

This is the perfect session IPA.  Pours a golden orange color with a soapy white head.  Has an aroma of grapefruit and pine, with hints of peach and perhaps honey.  Has a nice sweet start, then comes the bitter hit with a nice creamy finish.  Some sweetness through the finish.  Vinnie knows his pale ales.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2011 500ml bottle.  Bottled on 3/2/11.  Pours a clear copper with a one finger white head with good retention that leaves a lot of lacing on the glass.  Aroma is huge resinous pine with a bit of grapefruit.  A little bit of pineapple and some orange peel as well.  A little bit of bready malt comes through in the aroma.  Initial taste has a hint of sweetness going into strong pine hops with a bit of grapefruit.  A little bit of orange as well.  Finish is some of the bready malt with a strong, but not too strong bitterness.  Medium body.  Medium carbonation.  Great beer.  One of the best IPAs out there.

I can find no fault with this IPA.  First had a bottle in 92 pre-Russian River in Temecula, CA - golden, citrus elixir and it is just as good now.  Succint, dry finish that leaves no doubt as to the uncommon skill of brewer.  My personal preference over a sledge hammer hop bomb.   Liquid art.

from crackedkettle.com - slightly hazy bronze-orange colour with a modest head retention; fresh hoppy aroma of quin ce and peach, slightly piney; gently oily on the tongue and with a medium to full malt backbone; fair but not aggressive bitterness; long aromatic hoppy finish, bitter and fruity - straightforward and very well-balanced

bottle.  pours a nice golden orange with a nice pillow white head.  Great hop flavor with pine and grapefruit notes.  light carbonation with a dry but creamy finish.  Very refreshing and a well refined IPA.
bottle thanks to blutt59.  poured yellow with a white head.  aroma was a good piney citrus.  flavor was pine resin and weed juice.  medium body with low carbonation.

Draft. Second pour, of the day after a Pliny the Younger(well limited to one). Golden orange pour with some white head. Seemed fresher than PtY, and a great single IPA, citrus, and grapefruit along with piney hop flavors, nice.
Tasted at brewery and out of bottle.  A great IPA.  Nice hops... well balanced.  Multiple layers.  One of the best IPAs I have ever had.

500ml bottle from blackwells online.  bottled 03/10/10, drank 04/21/10.  aroma is fresh cut grass and juicy georgia peaches with a savory backnote.  i may be reaching, but i also seem to pickup a hint of fresh cut warm baguette.  appearance is a touch hazy, golden skyline 3 hours before dusk.  flavor is a hint salty, then overflow of peaches cut with grapefruit, a new hybrid fruit not known to man.  somewhere, to someone, this is so readily available it is sessionable.  while many artists failed life in the chesea hotel or other derelict spots in drug binges, one day i hope to punch out with a few cases of this stuff.  thank you vinny.

(500ml bottled 1-13-2010 thanks to blutt59) clear pale yellow with oily bubbles. Nose of citrus oils and grapefruit. The hops seem faded. Taste of very faded hops, light grapefruit, earthy with an oily finish. I definitely need to re-rate an example thats less than 30 days old.

Amazing hop aroma and taste.  Its not too bitter, heavy, sweet, or overpowering.  The hops are more prominent than in Alesmiths IPA, which I like.  Clipper Citys Loose Cannon has a touch of vanilla which Ill keep coming back to and Bells Two Hearted has a creamy quality which I like but if I had to pick one, this might be it.  Maybe thats because this is the toughest for me to find, but I like it!  (Id like to compare it to the Plinys though).

Just got this today in a trade. Thanks for the opportunity to try this! 500 ml bottled on 9/30/08.

A- slightly translucent diluted golden color with a slight orange tint. Pours with a healthy white foamy headwhich eventually fades to 1/2 finger and leaves plenty of lacing all the way down the glass.

S- Wonderful. Big, bright, and hoppy. A perfect blend of pine, citrus, and spicy goodness.

T- The flavor doesnt measure up to the smell but its still decent. Mild spicy hop flavor is the main character upfront with a bit of citrus and grassy flavors in the background. Some pine citrus resiny bitterness comes through for the finish with medium strength and linger for awhile.

P- Medium carbonation and smooth,oily body. Oily characteristics are great, but a bit on the thin side.

O- I was really looking forward to trying this one. My 3rd RR brew. Good IPA overall but it doesnt really stand out to me. A bit over hyped IMHO.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-11-2008 01:51:14

Trade with BrianJames1.  Slightly hazy pale/amber color, white head.  The aroma is gorgeous, peach, citrus, caramel.  The flavor is citrus, pine, caramel malts, light fruits.  The hops are forward in this beer.  Strong, enduring resiny hop bittering at the finish.  Smooth, slick, medium in body.  Excellently crafted beer.  I havent had much for Russian River, but this beer lives up to the hype.   Thanks, Brian.
Smells nice poured nice tasted good with a very nice aftertaste very good beer to my introduction into russian river

Bottle via trade with phaleslu, thanks Peter!!! Pours a very hazy peachy amber with a 2 finger somewhat chunky off white head that has excellent retention and leaves nice lacing. Aroma is huge on citrus and tropical fruit, caramel, yeasty bread dough, prarie flowers, toasted grains and hints of biscuit and vanilla. Flavor is toasty biscuit and yeasty white bread up front, sweet caramel, lots of grapefruit, tropical fruits, namely mango and papaya, some tart citrus, some pine and cane sugar comes out near the finish, but the playfully bitter grapefruit leads the way. Palate is light to medium bodied, farily creamy up front, with a moderate though somewhat sharp carbonation and a fairly dry, lightly chalky finish. What a great, hugely hop-forward IPA that works on every level.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy, orange color with a moderately sized, white, frothy head.  Lacing is above average to good.  Aromas of grapefruit dominate with hints of lemon, malt and wheat.  Palate is smooth and creamy to start, almost like a stout, with a lingering finish of hops that leaves the mouth a bit sticky.  Tastes of grapefruit, citrus, and a nice bitter middle that satisfies the hop head at heart.  A simply amazing beer.

Bottle.

Fantastic aroma, really fantastic! A lot of tropical fruits! The taste was also very good but not as good as the aroma. Still a very tasty beer. Nice balance, very refreshing. I want an other bottle.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2015 Looking about exactly how I picture a good IPA, the beer pours relatively clear and beautifully golden with thin lacing. It smells of citrus and pine, not the overwhelming floral explosion of Pliny, but pleasant in its own right.  Blind Pig has great taste and feel for an American IPA. It is light and pleasant without a single sour note. The hops are delicious, and the alcohol highlights them well. The beer is crisp and refreshing in both feel and taste and leaves a pleasant bitterness on the tongue.  Blind Pig doesnt overwhelm your senses or knock you over with flavor. Its just a great hoppy beer that could be enjoyed anytime.

The aroma is delicious, the sweet is a bit stronger than the bitter hops which I really enjoy. There is a beautiful bright golden color in the light,  but the beer pours cloudy orange with a nice foamy head on top. The flavor of the hops settles very nicely, much quicker than expected. It is floral hop flavors, some citrus notes, and just a tad dry on the palate.

Thanks to BMan1113VR for this bottle.  As a hops fanatic, this was simply the best hoppy beer I have had in a long, long time.  Exceptional hops without it being obnoxious, great flavors, and yet, the alcohol levels are not too high.

Bottle from LtDan. Pours a cloudy orange hue. Think Tang on steroids. Small white head that hangs on the glass. Aroma is hops.... All glorious, aromatic hops. Taste is very hoppy obviously, but also sharply bitter. Having tried Pliny before this beer, I would say the Pig is more bitter even though it has less IBUs. This may in part be to the hop schedule. A very good beer! Thanks again Dan!

Pint at The Tap Room in Pacif Beach.  Aroma is sweet hops and floral juicyness.  This IPA pours a cloudy golden...this all bodes well early on.  But, when it coms to palate, dont throw a jab when you can heave a haymaker, or damn at least a right cross with somethin behind it.  Some bitter hoppiness and citrus flavor but the package plays it too cool for school. This is where "smooth" gives way to "boring" in my opinion. Not a line you want to tread.  Now all that being said, in general its a decent IPA but after having both Plinys, my Russian River bar was set pretty damn high.  Does get better as it warms up, as Ive found with the other RR IPAs and is enjoyable but it gave me a kiss on the cheek when I thought I was gonna get to 3rd base at least.

From memory, bottle from High Times, Costa Mesa, CA, kind of difficult because comparing to Pliny the Elder and seemed like a lighter version, Elder is light for an Imperial IPA and this was a bit light for an IPA, good nonetheless, west coast IPA orange hue, nectory cirtus fruit hops, not too bitter, seemed to lack some depth and complexity but I would go back for seconds and thirds
Great beer.  Huge citrus/grapefruit aroma with some pine. Bitterness with bite but not unpleasant. No overt alcohol. Good maltiness backing.
