tap at toronado and bottle that was 2 months old-maybe i need to have a fresher bottle of this ,but between the bottle and the tap sample, this beer was a very good ipa, but not great.  on tap fresh at tornoado, this beer was a pine monster with a huge cascade/grapefruit nose.  in the bottle, its a bit more subuded and malty.  more citrus flavors out of the bottle as well compared to the tap.  bright orange with a small white head.  i need another fresh sample of this beer.  decent for what it was.

Bottle. Can I move out to the west coast where all the great IPAs are? This one was amazing. Poured a beautiful orangish color with a pillowy white head. Left lacing on the side of the glass as it went. Aroma was amazing. Citrus hops, pine, spruce, cloves. What a great IPA should smell like. A great balanced IPA. Sweet up front then bitter aftertaste. Medium bodied. Great hoppy IPA. I love this beer.

Pours out golden with tiny sediment floating all throughout the glass and topped with a dense, pillowy, white head from the 500ml bottle. Great head retention, great lacing. Powerful aromatic notes of pine, florals and sweet ripened citrus. Flavor notes of sweet fruit, soft herbs, chewy dough and just full-on bitterness all in one sip. Feels so fresh, and the hops taste so raw, lending itself to big time fullness, with a surprisingly light finish... close to almost no finish. Fine carbonation. This is a real treat. Drinkability: Wow. Perfectly balanced, and full of contradictions. Pairing:  Perfect with a BBQ burger. Rebuy:  Oh yes. #344 on 150302010, DG.

This is just a simple but classic West Coast IPA. There is a reason why Russian River has a cult following, when it comes to the style, they nail it and put out a style standard. Big hops on the front, smooth throughout, but still citrusy hops dominated like i like. This beer is so well made with the consistency from first sip to the end. I may be biased since im from sonoma county, but this beer is the goods.

On tap at Monks Cafe 9/21/09.  Deep transparent orange with a bit of foamy head.  Smells like sticky pinecones and citrus.  Tastes like piney hops, well balanced between sticky and dry, if anything a touch too sweet.  Makes me yearn for PTE.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2010 This delicious brew offers a wonderful floral bouquet of fresh hops and grapefruit. Its true that you taste with your nose first. Each sip shoots off signals to the Olfactory Bulb, where the brain translates this experience as pure beer awesomeness. A full on hop blaster, packed with bitterness, and citrus. Orange fruit pokes through as well. Not to be forgotten, a sweet malt layer says hello and disappears in enough time to create a great balance. Drinkability? God Yea, I could drink this everyday. Definitely a top of the class type IPA.

Draft at Monks for Russian River Day. Pours hazy orange with a thick, fluffy, two-finger head. Aroma is lovely; floral boquet of lavender and hops, with notes of honey, pine, soap, grapefruit, and anise. Body is fuller medium with a tangy, moderately bitter palate. Finishes slowly, with a nice clean burn down the throat and into the belly. Awesome IPA.

500 ml bottle bought from Russian River.  Pours a clear gold with a fluffy white head.  Fresh hops mostly pine and citrus with some grapefruit and sweet malts.  Smooth body, nice bitterness from the lemon, grapefruit, and pine against sweet malts.  Similar to Pliny minus the obvious lack of doubleness, but also a little more sweet in relation to the hop bitterness.  A great beer.

Bottle  Dated 1-13-10  Pours a hazy light amber with a good white head.  The head lasts well, and makes some spotty lacing.  Has a good hoppy aroma of pine, citrus, and candy.  Has a good carbonation.  The flavor is good.  Not as bitter as expected but good hoppiness.  Well blended and alcohol hidden well.  Has a medium body.  The mouthfeel is real good.  An oily texture.  Has a nice finish and a good aftertaste.  This is a real good beer.

Bottle, shared with hobbersr and Cole. Pours mildly hazy amber, medium white head, great lacing. Nose is spice, fruit, grapefruit & spruce berries, lovely balance. Flavors of simple malt, multi-faceted hops. Basically, this is Pliny Light, and in absolutely no way is that a bad thing!

Beer #5 of IPA night in good old Lethbridge AB. This one thanks to Savvy1982. Pours a golden yellow with a small white head. The aroma is very citric and piney with soft fruit and white sugar showing through. Lemon, orange, spruce, and soft fruit on the palate. Very fresh and bitter. Damn tasty.

looks great hazy orange with a thick foamy head. Amazing aroma so fresh and citrus. Lemons and grapefruit .  This is a great smelling IPA. Nice flavour very hoppy citrus and complex. Nice bitter aftertaste. This is a wicked IPA!

Notes from last year.

Bottle dated 020209, got as an extra, thanks! I was afraid since I have had fresher BP that this would pale in comparison, it kinda did. The hops werent as lively and the citrus, although bright, wasnt quite what I remember it to be. This was still a great drink, the color was fantastic, aromas were very good lots of grapefruit. Id be drinking this fresh if it were more available.
Pours an opaque amber gold. Aromas of cannabis and citrus peel. High toned on the palate with a shortish finish.
excellent ipa. great color, aroma and bittnerness, well balanced IPA. a great alternative to PTE

Received in trade with mkade8883.  Thanks, Matt!  Hazy, copper color. "Glowing".  Moderate, off-white head.    Awesome nose!  Citrusy hops, some marmalade notes as well.  "Jolly Rancher candy smell" like what I associate with DFH Squall. Nicely bitter and dry in the mouth.  Not the sweetness expected form the smell.  A little grassy and grapefruity.  Sharp finish.  Very nice.

My Blind Pig was bottled 1/13/10, just a little over a month ago.  Aroma is citrus, grapfruit a bit piney.  My first pour left the sediment in the bottle giving me a fairly brilliant gold ale with a white head.  The taste is hop forward that match the aromas note for note.  Dry on the palate with slight malt viscosity and long in the finish.  You will know youve been drinking Blind Pig because the flavor stays with you some time after youve finished your pint.  Drink it as fresh as you can get it.

A: The pour is a slightly hazed golden orange in color. A nice fluffy white head sites on top with excellent lacing.

S: The nose has an excellent fruit character with lots of citrus and perhaps even a touch of tropical fruits. There is a mild pine note to this as well.

T: The fruit flavor really shines through here, much more so than in Pliny. A nice juicy grapefruit flavor with some sweet caramel malt and a nice bitter finish.

M: The body is medium with a moderate carbonation (which could be affected by the growler).

D: Its too bad that this is the same price as Pliny, because it would be a top rate IPA if it was made by a different brewery.

Pours gold into the glass with a white head.  Aroma is grass, resin, and citrus all coming out at you.  Flavor is a very simple, but good bready malt with intense hop bitterness and flavor.  Medium bodied, and very drinkable.  Just wish I had more to drink.

On tap at The Toronado 
Appearance: Golden/amber in color with a nice off white head 
Aroma: Citrus, candy & pine 
Taste: Citrus, pine and malts 
This is a great beer. I enjoyed the citrus and candy aroma, well balanced with just enough malts so the hops arent to much.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2011 Had a pint on draft at Teresas after a couple of the Russian River sours. Everyone says this thing has a pine aroma, but it smells like cow patties and grapefruit to me. Aside for the funky aroma, it would have been a great IPA. I definitely prefer their Pliny the Elder.

11/3/11 - Had this again at UJs. Completely different experience. Pours cloudy copper with fluffy white head. Citrus aroma with just a hint of manure. Fairly malty, though not like a double. Quite bitter, crisp, and enjoyable. I dont know what was wrong with the pint I had a TND.

Bottle enjoyed at the NSSRQSOSLT, 1/10! No idea who brought this, but thanks! Pour was freaking awesome, as pretty as the IPA gets, big pillowy head, great retention, great lacing. The aroma was strong and full piney-citrusey hops, you could smell the bitterness for sure. The flavor was again big full mouth bittering piney-citrusey PNW type hops, raw-to ripe in character, big malt backbone behind it all, herbal and doughy almost, lighter fruits. Mouthfeel was big, in your face fullness, accentuated by the carbonation, whamo yum! Need to get back to this one someday!

For an IPA to be this well balanced and smooth is a testament to the brewer. While I love Pliny the Elder, its a little more forward on the hops and jumps from the sweetness of the malt to the bitterness of the hop rather suddenly. With Blind Pig however this transition is sliky smooth. Flavors are pretty similar in this beer however if youre looking for a less hop forward easier drinking, but still full of flavor IPA this is it. In reflection Im thinking this smoothness is partly due to the lower ABV as well. My favorite single IPA followed by Pliny the Elder as my favorite double IPA, just need to get some Pliny the Younger and Russian River may have the IPA hat trick!

Bottle.  Pours a light, golden honey, with just a touch of amber coloring. Full-bodied aroma is of floral hops, pine and resin mixed in too.  Flavor is tremendous, and matches the nose very well.  Very reminiscent of Two Hearted and Sculpin, in terms of body, creamy mouthfeel without being cloying, and well-balanced finish, its just right up there in that same range of high-quality IPAs.  Russian River, I am a devotee.

Hands down, this is one of the best IPAs I have ever tasted.

The beer pours a light orange/gold with a white head. The smell is very piney and very pungent. Very resinous. The flavor is similar with a huge resinous hop flavor. The hops also provide some earthiness but not a whole lot of bitterness. The mouthfeel is medium to thick and very drinkable. I wish I could drink this more often.
Bottled 50cl. Possibly not in the best state; sampled almost 4 months after it had been bottled. Definitely dissapointing. I expected a better IPA.

A full figured IPA with enough springloaded hops to send beer patrons over the moon. Russian River confidently boasts this ornery beer as their flagship indian pale ale - and with good reason. The mouthfeel is warm and comforting; the taste is malty and character driven; and the pine aroma hits your nose like a billy club to the temple. Highly recommended.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2010 Beer pours a clear orange color with a white head that retains itself quite well. Aroma is very citrusey. The beer is not too bitter, very medium in fact and goes down pretty smooth, definitely malty.  Overall a very solid IPA .

Bottle, bought @ Cracked Kettle, Amsterdam.
Pours light hazy golden with a big, frothy, white head with rather big bubbles. Fine duration. Nice crisp hoppy aroma, piney, citric, resiny, apricot, melons. Just a hint of crisp malts. Low, but prickly carbonation, very dry mouthfeel. Flavour is nicely hoppy, apricot, grassy, grapefruit, piney. Very hoppy, though the primary flavours arent really that bitter. The aftertaste, though, gains a lot of lingering bitterness with it sticking in my throat. Very good IPA.

It poured an light orange color with a thick white head. The aromas are citrus hops and grapefruit. The taste is initially bitter, lots of bitter hops, like a grapefruit rind with some malt to help balance it out. Overall a very good bitter IPA.

Bottle dated 09/15/09, courtesy of Secret Santa. Pours a pale gold with a 1/2" white head that recedes leaving random lace. Strong citrus hop aroma.  Moderate in body with average carbonation. Flavor is grapefruit hop with pine resin. Not much in the way of malt for balance, but very good.

fresh bottle.  very fruity hoppy aroma, grassy too.  flavor is similar but more one dimensional focusing on the grapefruity hops rather than piney ones.  flavor profile reminds me of union jack, which is good, but mouthfeel is less carbonated.   i wouldve liked some more malt balance and more carbonation but thats just me personally. didnt finish very clean, but at least the 70IBU rating seems accurate.  the lack of malt balance irks me more and more as i drink it.  very nice but seems overrated, and like another reviewer said, why would you get this when pliny is available for the same price?

Bottle - approx. 45 days old. Nose is fantastic - grapefruit and resiny hops. That it holds this kind of pungency after 1.5 months is a testament to the quality. Flavor is less pungent/oily/fruity than the nose, shows more grapefruit and some toffee and caramel. Finish is a little dirty/ashy for the style. All in all - this is a really tasty beer, but @ the price point, I cant see why Id ever buy this if, as it normally is, it is sitting next to Pliny.

Lightly gloudy golden color with a medium white head. The aroma was absolutely fantastic...plenty of piney and citrusy hops...bitter orange, lemon, and aloe vera. The flavor was a little disappointing...somewhat hoppy (not nearly as much as the aroma would make you believe) with some ashy tones, pine tree, with just a touch of toffee. The feel was a little too thin and watery for my tastes. All in all this is a good IPA, but I think with a thicker feel and a hoppier flavor this would make a phenomenal double IPA.
Bottle from Cavie.  Same sickly yellow pour as Pliny, but the head is much bubblier.  Aroma is big pine hops and citrus.  Taste is a little bitter and off.  Some grain flavor and a little hops.

Bottle dated 10/30/09 courtesy of alagnak. Clear orange color. Smells very hoppy with sweet and sour hops present. Taste is large hops. Some sappy elements but mostly rough on the palate. This is really big for a standard IPA.

Bottle:   Very pale golden, moreso a darker straw, moderate to large frothy white head, nice lacing, light carbonation.   Big strong floral hop aroma.   Some citrus rind, very faint earthiness/soil.   Tangy and tart on the tongue.   Certainly hoppy but not overly biting.   Bark is harsher than the bite, so to speak.   Very flavorful.   Body and mouthfeel are moderate to full.   Finishes long, lingering hop smoothness with hints of soil and rind.   Liked this one more than all their other examples.

Such a great beer.  Aroma is intense fresh hops.....lots of citrus/grapefruit.  Gorgeous yellow and not too clear to look thin.  Taste and palate are incredible...big and intense flavors but soft and delicate at the same time.  Lots of hop flavors but not harsh.....very smooth.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2009 Courtesy of northernbrews
Bottle:  The aroma has lots of grapefruit along with mango and pineapple.  It pours a transparent golden-orange with a small soapy white head.  The flavor starts with a quick dose of mango.  The finish has lots of grapefruit and light pine.  Light-medium bodied with mild carbonation.

Bottle.  Pours sparkling golden with a lasting 2 finger off white head.  Aroma is pungent citrus and pine with a touch of fruity floral sweetness.  Flavor is resinous, citrusy, pine, and a clean, surprisingly mild bitterness that lingers nicely.  A slight malt backbone.  Medium bodied and well carbonated.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2009 This beer was fantastic. Even upon opening I could smell a wonderful bouquet of floral hops and sweet malts. Poured a golden orange color with a fluffy, moderately fast declining head, was probably my pour. Later pours into my glass rendered only a small white head. Aroma is grassy, malty, with a wonderful, but not an overpowering hop hit. Flavor is a nice balance of citrus, pine, and malts.

500th rating, and its a good one.  Bottle from South Bay Drugs.  Pours a clear orange-gold color with some haze and a white head.  The aroma is perfect for an IPA.  I could smell this all day.  "Pine and pot," as described by one guy smelling it, the aroma has spectacular floral notes, citrus, pineapple, pine hops, caramel malt- wow.  Pine, citrus, hops, and malt all show up in the flavor as well, which has a nice bitter bite to it along with some fruit and caramel sweetness.  Light-medium bodied, so easy to drink, and refreshing any time of year.  Get one of these fresh and enjoy.

Fresh bottle from Nick D, thanks! Blonde. Grapefruit, melon, pineapple and oily hops in the aroma. Firm oily citric, grassy hopbitter but also very fruity flavor. lemon, pineapple, mango. Thinnish, but with loads of flavor. Fresh and very drinkable. Excellent!

Bottle shared by phaleslu- Thanks a ton Peter.  Pours a orange with a small white head.  holy shit.  this is off the hook.   Aroma of pineapple,  orange,  flowers, fresh fruit, citrus.  this is tight.  flavor pine, grapefruit, citrusy hops.  this is awesome.  very drinkable.  out of this world nose.

Courtesy of ygtbsm94.  Thanks for sharing, Brad!  Gold, foamy white head.  Soft pine and grapefruit zest aromas ride a light foundation of toasty malt throughout.  Bright bitter citric-pine flavors round with a touch of back end sweet malt.  Has a light Pliny tone to it.  Medium bodied, soft carbonation, moderately bitter finish.  A very nice session IPA

A: Poured with a big, white, creamy head... dissipated to about 1/2-finger or so over time. Very good lacing, left in sheets on the sides of the glass. Body is a dark golden color, and clear.

S: Mostly hops and pine, with some citrus pushing its way through all the hoppiness.

T: The citrus and pine needles are whats prevalent at first, and then it finishes moderately bitter and hoppy. Its all very clean and smooth, however... excellent balance.

M: Light-to-medium body with a slightly creamy texture and average carbonation.

D: Thats a damn fine IPA... I was excited to try this beer (had it at the Uber Tavern in Seattle... the keg had just literally been tapped) after all Ive heard, and it didnt let me down at all.

Bottle thanks to glouglou. Pours hazy amber with a medium head. Short retention. nose is nicely hoppy. Hops are earthy and piny. Hoppy and resinous taste. Finish is dry. Dries the mouth. Hints of small fruits. Carbonation is soft. Truely sessionable.

Bottle. Nice orange copper hue with a yellowish foamy head. Great aroma of piny and citrusy hops. I have had this many times and just got around to rating it. This is up there with my favorites despite the towering shadow that The Elder leaves over it. Fairly sticky and resiny, but extremely drinkable. Great citrus flavor with a solid malt keeps it fairly balanced. Finsih is Bitter, but not extremely bitter, with a touch of sweetness.

bottle, thanks to wavers1!  Pours light orange with a medium frothy white head.   Pine and grapefruit hop aromas.  Sweet pale malt and a slight toasted/nutty maltyness are cut sharply by a very nice hop bitterness more on the pine/peppery side than citrus.  Nice and dry finish, a solid IPA.
Hazy amber. Striking grapefruity nose. Punishing soapy oily hops makes my tastebuds distort. The mouthfeel is fairly soft but the bitterness is relentless and inky. Hardcore IPA.  too bitter for me
Pours a hazy orange with a nice white head. Aroma is citrus, hops, malt. Flavor is oily resinous fresh green tasting hops, malt, biscuit, citrus. Fantastic IPA.
a very good ipa.  Probably top 3 for me.  Nice crisp bite to it.  Hops pronounced on the nose and flavour but not hit over the head with it.  It has a nice clean finish.  Nice brew

Pours a golden yellow-orange with slight haze and sudsy thick white head.  Huge aroma of pine, grapefruit, pineapple. Taste is a quick sweet malt initially then all hops- grapefruit, lemon, and piney resin, huge bitterness in the finish. A very solid ipa.

Bottle from a transAmerican trade with Ryan, RAGE brother. Beautiful pour. Nice, fluffy white head. Strong and complex aroma -- fresh hops. Caramel, pine, citrus. Finish is long and sweet. Very well balanced. Great lacing. In the same league with Two Hearted (and thats really saying something, as that might be my favorite beer). Fairly light bodied, in a good way. A great one.

Bottled 500ml. -from City Beer Store, San Francisco. Orange/golden coloured, medium sized white head that went away slowly, grapefruity hoppy nose. Piney hoppy and fresh citric with touch of spices. Pleasant bitter finish and long-lasting artertaste. Decent IPA.
pours hazy golden with a bunch of white head...nice resin, pine, citrus nose...flavor is much the same...very dry
Ive had this fresh of the taps at Russian River. One fine IPA. I believe this is one of the best IPAs around. Great Aroma!

Bottled, thanks Vode! Copper color. Thick juicy hop aroma with pine, orange, lemon and herbs, excellent! Dry bitter flavor with pungent piney, orangey, grapefruity and herbal hops. Excellent fresh hop aroma and flavor!

Draft. Poured golden orange in color with a medium fluffy white head that left fantastic thick sticky lacing on the glass. Aroma of pine, grapefruit, sweet fruit. Nice body... Taste is resiny, with piney hops, grapefruit, caramel.  I could drink this all the time. Fantastic.
draft at The Drafting Room, Exton PA.  Aroma of hop/pine... strong rich flavor of pine, hops with a bit of a grapefruit aftertaste... great balance between the floral and citrus notes
draft at fallingrock.  wow.  nice resin nose with floral notes, very drinkable.

Bottle from Liquor Mart in Boulder. Pours a hazy gold with super-fine suspended sediment and a fluffy, pitted, white head, and patchy lace. The nose is outstanding: a beautiful blend of "juicy" citric and mildly resinous hops and a candy sugar-like supporting malt note. Medium-bodied and tongue-coating with a significant bitter hopped finish. Citrus hops hug your tongue along with just enough malt sweetness to keep the hops from destroying your palate. The finish is a nice, lingering, slightly resinous, bitter/hoppy parade across the back of your tongue. This is a damned fine IPA. I wish we could get it locally.
Pretty tasty. One of my fav. ipaS AS WELL. cAN DRINK THIS UNTIL THE SUN GOES DOWN. Very very tasty and hope it comes to texas soon

On tap at Falling Rock - Pours dark golden with a mostly receding white head. Notes of fresh hop resins, grassy, citric grapefruit, mango, and intense aromatics. Medium to full bodied, lively carbonation. Very delicious.
Interesting grapefruit and pine mixture.  the hops just glide across the tongue with minimal bitterness.  truly an excellent IPA
Tasting at GABF. orange beer with tan head. big hop taste and smell of grass and sap from tree. ie. very floral. Big bitter finish. grassy nose. great brew.

On tap at Local 44 in West Philly.  Pours with a finger of white fluffy head.  Nice golden/hazy color.  Smell is of pine and citrus hops, a good blend between the two.  Taste is more citrus hops than pine but also a good blend.  Mouthfeel was actually light for this type of beer, which was a refreshing surprise.  Overall, a very drinkable IPA.  I was expecting more of a hop bomb but it really isnt.  This beer is a fairly, but not overly hopped IPA with a crisp and clear mouthfeel.  Not overly sweet and not overly hopped.  My first of what will hopefully be many Russian River beers.
On tap at Johnny Browns Dtown SD. Pours clear pale golden/orange. Big hoppy citrus nose. Solid hop taste that is a little on the fresh, citrus side. Very good.

Thx to Glenn @ Alvinne, last saterday 12.09.09.
From bottle 50 cl.
Almost clear golden color, with creamy white head. 
Aroma flowery, sweet, fruits, hops. 
Medium body.
Taste flowers, sweet, caramel touch, honey, fruits, hops. Good IPA.

Draught at the Horse Brass. 
Copper color with alce. Crisp hoppy aroma with citrus and pine. Medium light flavor of malt, aromatic hops, fruity, with good bitterness. Balanced and drinkable IPA, good but not overly special.

This beer is awesome.  Had to hunt it down even in SoCal.  Ended up finding it in bottle at the PIzza Port.  Brought a bunch back to b-lo.  This is a kick in the pants IPA but has a nice hearty malt backbone to balance the beer.  Better than Pliny?  Eh, close but not quite. :)

On tap @ Toronado.  Pours a ever-so-slightly clody orange with a decent sized white head.  Big citrus-hop aroma, lots of orange on this one.  Suprisingly light bodied, in a good, drinkable way.  Bright frutiness dominates the mouth; lots of grapefruit, hint of watermellon, pear.  Great bitter hop finish.  Welcome to west coast IPAs...

Orange with good, creamy off-white head / Nose of weed, earth, cut pine, and citrus / Medium body, sharp biting hops, with good balance and finish / Flavors of weed, cut pine, grapefruit, peaches, caramel, and resin / Outstanding.

I think I enjoyed the Blind Pig a little bit more than Pliny.  Its a little weird to say that, but I think its true.  This IPA really blew me away.  It poured a light amber color with a very generous white head.  The head leaves a great amount of lacing around the glass, as well.  The nose is full of grassy and floral hops, as well as sweeter notes like caramel hops and citrus.  Theres even a little wood note with some bread thrown in for good measure.  The flavors are downright delicious, featuring a big hoppy and spicy profile, but balanced terrificly with an outstanding malty backbone.  Theres definitely enough hops to go around in the body, with hints of bread, caramel malt, wood and citrus.  The finish beckons you to get another glass, with spicy and dry notes, along with the same sweet malty balance.  This is one heck of an IPA!

Thanks kiefdog for the share.  Very nice IPA- its a nice medium between Pliny and a light IPA like Little Sumpin Sumpin.  Pours clear gold with frothy white head.  Nose is caramel, malt, honey, sugar, with pine, floral, and citrus hop blend:  killer bouquet.  Flavor tastes like malt, honey, peaches, apricot, grass, pine, and citrus.  Finish lingers with grass, and pine/ floral hops.  Very good IPA.

50cl bottle courtesy of mfielden. Pours a generally clear yellow golden with amber highlights and a one finger creamy and foamy head that settles slowly. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of ripe citrus, honey, floral esters, pine, grapefruit, floral hops. Flavor is sweet and floral with notes of floral citrus, pine, grapefruit, caramel, honey, floral esters, hops. Generally light to medium body with a pleasing floral hop finish. Nice IPA.

A golden IPA with a lacing proteinaceous off white head. A super fragrant aroma, with loads of c-hops, grapefruit, resinous and pinhey...a real hop bomb. In mouth, an onctuous and classy IPA, pungeant, funky, with grapefruit notes, no harshness. Top notch.  On tap at brewpub, August 17 2009.

This beer I found to be a truly fantastic IPA and I cant wait until I get the opportunity to drink it again. Very aromatic with grapefruit and other citrus. An excellent strong bitterness throughout. Just great stuff.

Pours deep yellow with a dense head. Huge pine and cedar aroma. Grapefruit and tangerine notes as well. Strong bitterness, slight astringency. Grapefruit and pine in the flavour as well. Bitter finish.

Superb aroma of resinous, citrusy hops and exotic fruits. The pour reveals a cloudy golden color with a thin white head. Solid flavor of resinous, citrusy hops over a light, creamy body. This IPA is amazing, I want more and more of this.

This 9/5/08 bottled brew from a rating party at JSquires poured a medium sized head of foamy fine to medium sized bubbles that were and left behind a transparent very softly carbonated yellow-orange colored body. The strong aroma was hoppy. The mouth feel was very tingly at the start and at the finish with a strong hoppy aftertaste. The strong flavor contained notes of hops. Delicious and one I would certainly like to have again.

Location: .5 liter bottle via trade from NickD717,  8/28/09


Aroma: Pine, citrus hops, fresh and juicy hops, grapefruit

Appearance: Clear golden-orange color, fluffy white head, nice amount of lacing

Flavor: Nice (not huge, but well done) hop profile - juicy grapefruit/citrus and pine hops, medium sweet with a long finish

Palate: Medium to full body, semi-dry, fresh, crisp, drinks really nicely

Overall Impression:
Thanks, Nick!  This beer is darn tasty.  My first Russian River beer, and now Im really looking forward to the Pliny you sent me.  I figured I would drink it first from this trade as the label repeatedly warned me not to age it.  Figured I would follow instructions just in case the folks at RR are watching me big brother style.  (If you are watching me, Im sorry, it must be boring to watch me drink this beer and watch preseason football.)  All kidding aside, this is a seriously solid, well-made beer.

500 mL bottle from South Bay Drugs ($4.99).  Pours a clear light golden-orange with three fingers of fluffy white head.  Aroma of sticky pine, grapefruit, and other light sweet citrus.  Flavor is hops, of course -- grapefruit mainly but also some pine and soap.  Mostly bitter -- it could be better balanced with the malts.  Surprisingly light mouthfeel; kind of watery.  I really like the Plinys but this doesnt quite measure up.  I prefer our local San Diego IPAs over this.

Pours a clear golden orange color. Very small head with some lacing. Aroma is sweet with some apricot and  very earthy.  Flavor is earthy and kind of dirty. A nice mild hop flavor. Gives a good bitterness on the tongue. A Russian River brew for sure.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2010 Source: Bottle from Keg and Bottle

Glass: Tulip

Aroma: Wonderful piney aroma, with some grapefruit.

Appearance: Light amber body, with beautiful clarity. Two fingers of white head.

Flavor: Fantastic IPA. Some nice malt sweetness to back the hop flavor. A really great single IPA.

Palate: Good full mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Overall Impression: One of my favorite IPAs. Shouldnt be overshadowed by big brother Pliny.

Pours a clear amber with a tiny bit of head beautiful piney aroma its like a junior pliny the elder perfect hop from start to finish in the flavor and has a dry hop end great citrusy/piney taste well balanced
On tap at the Rose and Crown. Smells AMAZING, hoppy with a touch of sweetness. Tastes great. Theres a great, full mouthfeel on this one. Russian River impresses me again.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2012 pour a golden orange color with a good foamy white head.  aroma is hoppy with alot of citrus, pine, and has some a slight bread aroma in the background.  flavor is of citrus hops, pine, and a slight sweet malt in the background to balance out the hops.  body is medium and it has a nice dry finnish.  overall, another great hoppy ale from Russian River.
leave it to Russian River to make 3 of the most delicious IPAs and double IPAs in the world. This one is the third best of their trifecta and its absolutely fantastic.
On tap at Capones. Pours an orange color with a nice amout of white head. Has a citrus hoppy smell to it. Has great citrus hop taste it. Not to bitter on the finish.

Tasted 8/13/09.  500ml bottle.  Bottled on March 3 2009.  Mildly sedimented with a deep golden hue.  Brain and ring of off-white head.  Good nose with hints of citrus grapefruit and sweet breads.  Nice earthy note.  Medium bodied and rather sharp on the initial sip.  Astringent effervescence.    Tingling hoppy flavor.  Solid palate.  Good roast on the malt aspect.  Finishes sweet with a mildly cloying aspect.  Good flavor and on the dry side.  Fruity and tasty.  Big bitterness but still with a solid sessionable quality.

I am finding out I am not an IPA man

way too much hops for me

Great color, aroma - just couldnt handle the hops

On tap at Naked City. Holy stuffings Batman! This beer was great. Nice peach/gold/copper color. Very little head but leaves some nice lacing. Fresh and pungent citrus hop aroma. Not hard to smell this one at all. Very lovely IPA aroma, and I cant get enough of it. Focuses heavily on the citrus hop aroma. Nice smooth beer, and a very fresh and clean hop profile. Nice citrus hop flavor that is amazing and nice. Also, there is a slight malt sweetness to balance it out. The malt is VERY subtle. The bittering hop is just so nice along with the rest of the hop profile. Truly and amazing IPA, I hope to try this again soon.

500 ml bottle from bhensonb. pours hazy orange with an everlasting white head. nice balanced hoppy and malt aroma. mutiple hop varieties. the flavour is balanced but complex. not much to say here really its just a damn tasty very solid IPA. thx bill.

500ml bottle, bottled on 7/23/09, poured into a tulip.  Pliny Jr!  Pliny Light!  Pliny the Younger...no wait, thats taken.  But definitely Pliny-esque, on a smaller scale.  Pours a clear light amber with off-white head.  Aroma of big resinous hops, pine, and grapefruit.  Tastes of grapefruit and piney hops, with a bit of sweet malt backbone.  Mouthfeel is crisp and dry, very quenching.  Definitely a great IPA!!
Yellow pour with white head. Very hoppy aroma of grapefruits. Very flavorful beer. Piney aftertaste. This beer provided the nicest lacing on a glass that Ive ever seen.
grapefruit/nectarine turning resiny on nosing. the malt backbone in relation to bitter hop content is nearly perfect. very long clean & dry finish. this is fing fantastic!!!!
Poured orange/yellow with a lacing white head. Not as big of an aroma as Id like, but smelled of sweet citrus hops. Huge hop forefront that finished nice and bitter that lasts. Excellent IPA!

Pours a medium golden color with a think white head made up of small bubbles.  The beer is fairly opaque in the glass.  The aroma is a combination of hops and citrus fruit, and those characteristics carry over into the flavor.  The beer is crisp in the mouth and has a number of small bubbles.

Bottled on 12/15/2009.  Found in a small beer refrigerator in the back corner of a local wine shop, hidden behind a couple sixers of Stone Ruination IPA.  Pours a nice straw color, a little hazy, with a medium, white head.  Nice lacing.  The first thing I noticed was the smell  as soon as I cracked the cap.  A potent mix of pine and citrus.  Light carbonation, medium bodied.  A very refreshing, enjoyable beer.

9/10/2008:  Russian River Bling Pig looks thick, has a hacy golden color, fine sediment, and an average white head (good lacing).  The aroma has lots of orangy hops, some resi,t toffee malt, and PINEAPPLE.  The bitterness level is high, but not too much.  Its a good blend of bitterness and hoppy flavors dominated by PINEAPPLE.  I think there is also a some Cascade hops.  This beer is definitely more hoppy than malty and thats okay.  This beer has amedim-light body, soft palate, and is really drinkable.  Overall it is a great IPA.
500 mL bottle (Bottled on: 070908 / 6.10% Alc. by Vol.) shared by alexsdad06.  Thanks Brad!  Rating 538 for this beer.
Rather nice, almost copper color.  Little head, smell is very nice.  Very smooth drinking IPA, bitterness is there but it comes at you softly.  Tasty beverage.

On tap at the brewpub on 6/30/09. Pours nice thick gold, little head.  Now were getting into the good IPAs.  Great citrus and pine hopes, touch of vanilla.  Little sweetness balanced very well by the bitter finish.

(bottle) Pours a cloudy golden color.  Small, off white head - fair lacing.  Fruity hop aroma.  Light, citrus flavored hops, perhaps lemon.  Slick texture, soft carbonation, average duration.  Light bitter finish.  Delicious!

700th rating.  Bottle from BMan1113VR who was my secret santa for the summer secret santa thing.  Pours a lightly hazed orange honey amber with a large beige head that sticks around for a while.  Nice big pineapple and grapefruit aromas with some beautiful resiny pine notes.  One of the best smelling IPAs Ive had.  A little thinner than medium body, smooth and with some nice spicy qualities.  Finishes with a big thick tannic grapefruit bitterness.  Lovely.  Just lovely.  Big thanks to Andrew for this one.  Excellent choice.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2013 Tap at RR. Hazy yellow body, with a small white head. Aroma is hops, citrus, pine and banana. Flavor is hops, grapefruit, citrus and fruit. Very good.
RE-RATE: Clear yellow body with a small white head. Hops, fruit, citrus, dry, dust. Unfortunately its not fresh.

Draft at Rons.  Pours hazy dark straw toward copper.  Nose is grapefruit and tangerine, heavy hops, malt.  The taste is bitter, very hoppy and resiny, with hefty pineapple and grapefruit flavors, and black peppery hints.  Smooth and crisp, with a niice complexity, this one is a hop heads wet dream, literally and figuratively.

Thanks Jason!  Six week old bottle.  Blind Pig pours a hazy honey brown color with a smallish off white tan head.  Light carbonation is visible.  Aroma is not big and offers citrus, caramel, and pine.  Flavor begins with a tart and bitter hop bite that is sweetened by caramel.  While the hops are assertive they are also pillow soft at times.  There is some nice pepper spice that shows up as the beer warms.   The hops are so delightfully complex and well crafted.  This is what an IPA should be!  I was sorry to see the bottom of the glass.

Aroma: citrus, gratefruit, slight pine or spruce. Apprerance:  transparent, golden, medium carb, unfiltered.  Flavor: Pure hops - watery start but pure hop slow finish.  Lemon zest. Palate:  watery, weak throughout.  Overall: very subtle IPA.  weak, watery, but very pure hop.

Bottle purchased from City Beer in SF.  Pours a golden bronze color witha nice head and great lacing.  The aroma is hoppy, but also somewhat mellow.  Just a hint of the alcohol, but not near as strong smelling as other IPAs.  Tangy light citrus flavor.  More of a "lighter" IPA mouthfeel.   A nice overall IPA

Bottle, generously shared by NachlamSie. Pours orange with long-lasting light beige head. The aroma is nice, dank, herbal hops with a strong tangerine and lemon verbena note. The flavor is smooth, but assertive hops. Tangerine, pine, assorted herbs, and an excellent level of bitterness. Theres a little bit of honey and toast behind it for some balance. The finish is fruity and hoppy and tasty. Great beer.

Bottled on June 9, 2009. Split with Tronraner. Pours a hazy bright orange with a delightful head. I love IPAs that look like this. Damn, this is hoppy. Very fresh stanky hops. Lots of grapefruit, sticky herbs, very little malt going on. The mouthfeel is dry and sticky in a sublime way. Lots of herbal bitterness, grapefruit, assorted citrus, wood, pineapple. This is one serious IPA that is all about the hops. Im really glad I got a fresh sample this time.
Dark amber with fluffy white head.  Extremey herby/woodsy and slightly fruity hoppy aroma.  Nice bitter hop bite with overwhelming hop flavor.  Tastes just like PLiny the Elder with a bite.

Bomber thanks to Jim. Bright gold with a small white head.  Nice hop nose. Taste is overall a hop bomb with very little/no malt profile. Very fresh taste. A bit thin on the palate and it leaves a dry taste on the end. Overall a good beer but not groundbreaking (like it was when it first came out).
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Yellow golden in color.... Sweet floral hops aroma... Flavor is gently sweet and malty, minimal hop flavor up front more like a pale ale, but with a nice gentle finish that intensifies on the palate, hints of grapefruit and citrus... Pretty good beer, Pliny the Elder is way better though.

Appearance: Pours out a lightly hazed, faintly-hued, dull copper body with a wispy, white head.

Smell: Pungent nose dominated by robust hop notes of pithy grapefruit, earthy lemon rinds, pineapple, and flowers.

Taste: Starts with a subtly sweet, restrained pale malt base from which to launch yourself into the hop field. Soon, a full-on barrage of sharply citric hop character and bitterness pushes its way onto the palate. Strong accents of white grapefruit and rustic lemon, with somewhat lesser undertones of fruity pineapple and pressed flowers. Medium-high bitterness. The beer remains assertively bitter all the through (and beyond) the very dry finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium carbonation. A bit oily, a bit sticky even.

Drinkability: Well, theres no question, its certainly one for the hop fiends. About as reasonably easy to drink as a cuttingly bitter India Pale Ale can hope to be.
Large head that leaves lacing as dwindles.  Aroma of pineapple.  Orange clear.  Wonderfully bitter from beginning to end.  Balanced flavor.

(Bottle from Highland Liquor in Denver, CO). Cloudy copper/yellow color. Medium off white, frothy head. Hoppy grapefruit aroma.  Strong hop flavor. Avg duration. Slick texture. Moderate lacing. Slightly astringent and bitter finish. Good lacing.

Bottle 500ml. @ [ Tasting by cgarvieuk ].Clear medium to dark yellow orange color with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate to light light heavy malty, caramel, fruity, heavy hoppy, grapefruity, orange, light perfume. Flavor is heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20090411]

Yeah, this is a top notch drink. One small, teeny, tiny, notch below the Elder but still and incredible drink. Tasty grapefruit and citrus hops. Blast of orange peel aroma. Cloudy orange color with a creamy white head that gives an added texture to the drink. Lots of hops here but I completely missed the malt profile and wonder if that could be put up front a little more for some balance.

Bottle (500ml) shared with HogTownHarry, garthicus, GregClow & tupalev -- c/o tupalev. Pours a slightly hazy orange with an average size bubbly white head. Lovely aroma of resiny hops, fruity and malty as well -- amazing! Flavour: Delicious, juicy hoppy goodness, so easy to drink, the alcohol is totally hidden. Nice full mouthfeel. Fantastic!

Bottle from Dillon Ridge in Dillon, Colorado.
Pours a color gradient, from orangey-copper under the huge cap of infinitely-lasting white puffy head to a cloudy gold at the bottom.  Strong smell of both clean piney hops and citrusy hops.  Flavor is smooth and incredibly bitter at the same time, with a warming finish.  Flavorful, wheaty malt makes a great base for the apricot and grapefruit citrus notes.  Easy to drink for an IPA!

Bottle courtesy of Summer Santa 09. Good mix of citrus and floral notes for aroma. Copper body big white head and good lacing left on glass. Dry resin grapefruit and some sweet citrus orange flavor. Cool and crisp on the palate mighty fine refreshment. Thanks BuckeyeBoy.

Bottle from IrishBoy. Thanks!  Just found this rating hidden in my ratings book.  Pours a deep, thick, lively apricot orange with a nice white head.  Aroma is sweet citrus tempered by a definite sour grapefruit and semi-sweet pine resin.  Hints of orange juice in there as well.  Flavor is a cornucopia of grapefruits, oranges, peaches, pine, and a touch of strawberry.  Thick, lingering mouthfeel that simply sticks the flavors onto the tastebuds.  I will never turn one of these down.  Ever.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: On tap @ RR. Pours a deep gold. Tons of citrus nose. Big fruity grapefruit as well. Flavor is a nice malt, some bready notes, big grapefruit, orange, citrus zest. Amazingly balanced and finishes dry with a slightly lingering hop sweetness.
Thick, tangy pineapple, spice and toffee aroma. Perfectly balanced and drinkable, with resiny, sappy hop character of pineapple, apricot, and melon, with a pleasant bready malt to balance it.

500ml bottle. Bottled on 3/26/09. Served in a shaker pint. Poured a pale gold with two fingers of white head. Citrus hop aroma. Light to medium bodied with medium amount of carbonation. Crisp hop bitterness up front. Dry hoppy finish with a good amount of mouth pucker. Very easy drinking beer.
Woohoo! Just moved to the west coast and I cant even tell you how much of this delicious beer Ill be drinking in the next year...

Bottle, $4.49.  Pours cloudy orange-gold with a nice frothy head.  Aroma just hits you with luxurious grapefruit-citrus.  Flavor holds the citrus note  lemony, grapefruity, flowery  adding some toasted and toffee malt flavors and a hint of salt.  Finishes cleanly bitter and flavorful. Flavors are surprisingly mild, however.  As far as the palate of Blind Pig, it is light and clean overall, finishing dry.  The head froth on Blind Pig is noteworthy.  For some reason, the froth is as airy and puffy as any beer Ive ever encountered.  It is remarkable, actually, and adds tremendously to the enjoyment of this beer.  This is my IPA for a hot summers day.

Draft at Toronado. Pours golden orange color, minimal head. Huge bright and floral hop aroma, grapfruit, citrus, apricot--really nice. Taste is all of those flavors and then some, huge hop presence, backed up by soft malts, finishing with mild bitterness. A nicely balanced IPA (which is not my favorite style to begin with), but a few points off since I enjoyed other RR IPAs more

Gold-orange pour.  Aroma of orange, apricots, grapefruit, and bitter plant, so strong on the hops.  Tastes similar to all those above hop notes, with a little bready malt.  Finishes earthy, floral, and bitter grapefruit aftertaste.  Medium bodied and creamy.   I hope you like hops, because youll get them, with just enough malt presence to make this drinkable.

Bottle. Large light creamy beige head that mostly lasted. Good display of lacework. Somewhat cloudy golden amber color. Aroma of pineapple, grapefruit, peach, caramel, mild toasted malt. Quite nice and smooth with a twist of dry. Medium bodied with an average carbonation. Moderated bitter and sweet flavor. Lingering dry bitter fruity finish.

Hazy yellow pour. Head is nearly white. Thick with minimal lacing. Nose is bright with grapefruit dominating. Taste brings out a woodiness with hops abounding. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean, but a bit on the watery side. Finish iis mild.

Bottle, with Alaskanwarren in Denver. Shiny copper, white head. Fresh woodsy nose, grapefruit and a surprising peppermint brightness. Crisp, bright hop flavor, something sharp and wintery about it. Cold steel, mint. Light/medium body with a gentle touch of sweet. As much as this is a beer with a lot of flavor impact, it isnt just a shouting matchit really has an excellent sense of poise. Remarkably good IPA.

Bottle served in a tulip. Pours slightly hazy sunlight-orange. Nearly the color of the label. Good sized white head. Mostly hops on the nose: Sweet, floral, orange, pineapple, and pine. Fresh and lively. Very nice. Grapefruit and orange flavor. Medium body. Creamy and sticky texture with soft carbonation. Spotty lacing. Bitter, lengthy finish.

Pours an apricot orange with a fluffy head that recedes slowly. Aroma is very hoppy and crisp; Grapefruit and other citrus, citric acid, and a little flora. Flavor is about the same as the aroma; The hoppiness is delicious, grapefruity, other citrus. Malts balance it out toward the end. Just a pinch of sweetness, not too much. Mouthfeel is full, medium carbonation. This is basically a slightly smaller brother to Pliny The Elder; This turned out to be exactly what I expected when I saw "Russian River" and "IPA". Very high quality IPA thats hard to find anything wrong with. Overall, excellent.
From the tap poured a golden color with a fair amount of head.  Nice tart flavor almost grapefruit with a lingering finish.
One of the best IPAs. Floral hops, dry and easy on the palate. Nice bitter finish. Bottle i had was perfectly carbonated.

Thanks to ditmier for this one.  Rating #500 for this beer.  Pour is cloudy orange with medium white head. Some floaties in there too.  Aroma is citrus hops, light caramel malt, some floral notes and notes of grass.  Flavor starts with a very nice burst of citrus hops.  Then the caramel malt kicks in and the hops turn to pine.  The finish is both citrus and pine hops with a touch of bread.  Very tasty stuff with a great citrus hop influence.

Bottle courtesy of Smokepot23.  Boy Russian River sure does know how to make an IPA.  Poured a slightly hazy orangeish golden color with about one finger of off-white head.  Aroma is soft grassy hops and pine.  Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.  The flavor is extremely balanced between sweet caramel malt and the bitter hops while still showcasing the hops.  This is what I love about Russian River, their IPAs are hoppy enough for a hop lover but so perfectly balanced.  Fantastic.

A very solid IPA.  Lots of hops on nose, tounge, aftertaste and more.  Another bigtime hop guy from RR.  An almost orange color, a nice fluffy off-white head.  A slightly varamel sweet taste to compliment the piney-citrus hops.

Bottle (500ml).  Shared by tupalev with me, blankboy, garthicus and gregclow.  Ah, THIS is an IPA (take notes, Beaus).  Slightly hazy orange with a solid frothy lasting off-white head.  Lush aroma - pungent "cat pee" (thats a good thing) bitterness and juicy citrus malt backing - facking hell, that smells terrific.  Taste of mild grapefruit pith, orange zest, quite a shifting medley of hop bitterness - only mild alcohol, overall very light and balanced, a real "drink it for hours" IPA.  Fairly light body, a little acidic, mildly carbonated and not at all boozy, up front or in the tail - pungently bitter, and it takes quite a while to finish - just what a drinkin IPA should be.  Are you paying attention, Ontario craft brewers?  Wake UP!!

Bottle.  Pours a nice golden-amber color with a light-medium sized white head.  Pine and citrus become apparent immediately after pour.  Surprisingly a little more sweet than I expected.  Goes down nice, light-medium bodied.  A nice brew.

Pours a very light amber with nice single finger white head. Aroma is candy sweetness and funky pine hop notes. Taste is far milder than I had assumed it would be. Words almost fail me right now. This beer is perfectly balanced. Definitely not too bitter, as many IPAs seem to be more bitter than hop flavor focused. Bitterness still accumulates the more you drink it, but that cant really be avoided in an IPA. The hop flavors are perfectly balanced by a nice, crisp amber malt taste. Very refreshing. This is one nice IPA. I wish that Id bought more.

Many thanks to Tupalev. Appearance: Light orange, small white head. Aroma: Super hoppy, weed like, mango skins, malt, sweet as heck, lovely. Flavour: Lovely light body, mango skins, hops, bitter, bitter goodness. Lovely.

pours a golden orange with a medium white head. aroma is bursting with grapefruit, orange, lemon, floral hops, malts. drinks crisp and fresh citrus listed above with a fine bitter floral hop finishing the end. long lasting hop bitterness on the tongue. great beer!

Bottle thanks to MrBunn. Pour is a creamy orange with a nice head. Smells strongly of grapefruit. Taste is the same, mostly grapefruit with a sour note that reminds me of an unripe orange. this seems to get better the more I drink it, and find myself wanting A LOT more.
Bottle.  Pours a hazy light orange. Aromas of fresh citrus and a little mango or something. Flavor is a good mix of caramel malt, grapefruit and oranges with a little bit of abv warmth.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle pours orangish golden with thick white head. Aroma is malt and strong citrus hops. First taste is sweet then the citrus hops(grapefruit) burn takes over. The finish is citrus hops and it lingers for a while. Really close the Sweetwater IPA

Bottle (in NZ). Pours an orange/gold with a large foamy white head. An explosive hop aroma of melon, grapefruit and manderins - but a bit perfumy. More balanced on the palate, Im quite surprised by the moderation of the hops. The malt is smoothless, though lacking a little in flavour, and merges like a zip with hops that are increasingly bitter in the finish. Im not liking this as much as others, but still a very nice beer.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2009 The color is a slightly hazy orange, the head was minimal in this pour. The aroma was that of a fresh orange. The flavor was a little malt sweetness with some floral and citrus hops but not as strong orange, more grapefruit than the aroma. A very well balanced IPA.

Bottled 030309.  Hazed orange color with a falling medium head.  Smells almost like I just ripped open a packet of Cascade hops.  Plenty of orange and a little vegetal/grassy.  Moderate orange taste.  Light bitterness.  Sweet, light malt.  Oddly pretty light for what I was expecting.  Its solid, but not overwhelming at all.

On tap at Falling Rock, Denver.  Golden orange/yellow, nice sized white head.  Great aroma - lots of grapefruit and citrus, some malt as well, very fresh.  Great taste - again, nothing remarkable in my description - lots more citrus with a piny edge to it.  Body is almost crisp with a solid malt base.  I drank two of these very quickly - one of the most flavourful and sessionable IPAs I have had.  Does not beat you over the head, but does not turn into hop juice either - perfectly balanced and made for fresh massive consumption.  It was my first visit to falling rock and I had 70 + taps to choose from with a ton of new and exciting options to choose from but I went back to this at the end of the night - that should tell you something.

This sampling has been a long time in the running.  You know that ennui you get when youre poring through the RB forums and people are talking about a beer like its an old friend?  Swapping stories and notes, and then doing it again the next day, and the next?  And you feel like the kid in the corner of the playground, exiled but not with malice?  Yeah, I hate that feeling.  So it was about time I gave this Russian River brew a try.  A thick wide head springs up from a calm pour, like political demagoguery - reliably overreactive.  Bubbles spring out from the center of the pours drop point, casting a net over the moderately clear, hypnotically rich looking orange beer.  The Blind Pig takes the initiative with a hoppy punch, followed by the tantalizing aromas of roast chicken skin/fat, fermenting pizza dough, a cluster of grains and barley.  The flavor capitalizes on this opening act with another round of mild but complex flavors beginning with apple and later indulging in cascades of hunger-satisfying grains.  When I like an IPA, its generally because its graciously included some sweets to offset the bitters, but the Blind Pig is certainly not a sweet beer.  Its an appetizing beer, and appetizing IPAs are very few and far between.  So this is something of a gem to me, and definitely tops my list of IPAs snatched away from the temping jaws os hop-bombery and steadfastly back into the realm of palate enriching drinkable nirvana.

Tasted 10/05/2009.  500ml bottle from beerstore.co.nz.  Nice drop but I dont think anything is going to compare that favourably to following a mint condition AleSmith IPA.  Richer base malt, slightly more minerally, tending English almost, but with all the hop characters of a new world ale. Bluddy guid.

My first ever Russian River beer..here goes.
Slightly murky orange/brown beer..great off white frothy creamy heid.
Nice fresh aromas of piney/spruce like hops..some lemon and honey in the back.
Good juicy hops, freshly squeezed or so it feels. Fresh grassy, grapefruit, brown sugar, toasted. Really nice and fresh..you should have this for breakfast!
Great palate too..very well  done.
Overall a great IPA

Smells like hops, pine, citrus, and heaven.

Looks medium/dark golden.

Head is fluffy and falls fast leaving behind substantial lacing.

Tastes like a DIPA. Tons of bitter hops, pine, sour citrus, the bitterness sticks to your lips. Ive actually never had an IPA with this aggressive of flavors.

Perfect levels of carbonation.

Im so in love with beer Id let that blind pig on the label sodomize me with his white cane. I know hed never call me again, and it wouldnt matter. I would have gotten what I wanted, his light juicy goodness. Mmmm

Centennial hops... has to be. This one is awfully close to Bells 2 Hearted or Ballast Point Big Eye IPA.

Pours slightly hazy golden hue with contrasting white head.

Nose is quite aromatic with pineapple and grapefruity, and grassy.

Palate is pleasantly sharp with hops up front, centennial is my guess, and leads into waves of tangy grapefruit and a light honeyed malt in the distant background. Very citrusy, grassy, and drinkable.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2009 Pours a hazy golden color with a two finger thick pure white head that remains.  Smells of terrific hops, citrus fruits, sweet lemons, and pine.  Some earthy grass also prevalent.  Tastes of rich citrus, deep earth tones, and wonderful bitter hops.  Finishes delicately bitter and wonderful!

deluxe golden colour, nice head, great lace.  classic NoCal hop aroma, citrus, pine.  rich flavour and plenty of malt to balance all the hop.  classic ipa that was clearly hand-crafted by someone who cares!  leaves me wanted more from vinny and RR....

Pours a golden color with a medium white head.  The aroma is straight out citrus with some earthy hop scents.  The taste is much the same--fairly one dimensional overall, but the flavor is really nice for a single ipa.

Bottle thanks to DuffManSW.  Copper-gold pour with a big, rocky, white head.  Nice floral, citrus aroma with a great balance of caramel and biscuit malts.  Dry, piny, grassy flavor with nice citrus notes and a well balanced biscuit and caramel malt profile.  Creamy, medium body with very soft carbonation.

Bottle: The highlight of the IPA samples series, after a few IPA samples (and losing the numbness) we tasted this one with ramenen. Bold, lots of pine, resin, grass surprisingly dry non of the oiliness one might expect. Clear with lots of fragments floating around.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2009  Rating # 300 , 500ml Bottle thanks to CaryTheDude. A dull golden color body with a big soapy white head,light to medium carbonation and tuns of stricky lace. Aroma is hoppy, piny,floral and citrus rind,Very nice. Flavor is bitter with some pine up front, a very tasty caramel malt backbone,more citrus hops,a bit of resin,hints of peppercorn,orange peel,just plain juice and balanced,very very good, a nice bitter finish with a hoppy aftertaste, medium body without being sticky feeling at all. A very drinkable top shelf IPA for sure.

500mL bottle from Beerstore.co.nz, bottled in December 08. Poured off the yeast, it is a hazy golden amber colour, with a frothy off white head. 
Aroma, wow. I havent smelt hops like this before in NZ. A lot of pine needle, which is new to me. An orange peel citrus underlies the strong piny aroma. The malt brings a little caramel to the aroma. 
Unsurprisingly; the flavour is dominated by piny, pleasantly bitter, resiny hops. Wow, now I know what resiny means. Hop flavour coats my mouth, leaving a long lasting pleasant bitterness which screams DRINK ME MORE! I left this out to warm for 1.5 hours, yet I still cant really detect any malt flavour through the huge hops, perhaps the Pliny the Elder will improve on this aspect, otherwise I cant really fault this beer.
This being my very first American craft beer tasted, I have big expectations for the rest!

Amber golden drop. White head. Aromas of pine, passionfruit, citrus. Taste; resiny itterness, more citrus, hints of caramel from the malt. RIch and smooth in the mouth, long lasting bitterness. Clean and very well crafted beer.

[2022-20090227] 1pt0.9floz bottle. Sweaty pine needles and lots of toasted orange rind hops aroma. Hazy, medium orange body with a medium-lasting creamy off-white head. Great orange rind hops and mild grapefruit flavour with lots of bitter citrus seeds. Medium body is very bitter. Very well-balanced, very tasty, this bitterness could hide even more percentage.
(w/ jerc)

hazy golden amber with a fluffy lingering white head. lemons, lime, grapefruit, passionfruit maybe a bit of peach on the piney resiny nose. flavour is fresh and zingy with a firm malty backbone, kinda high bitterness I suppose but Im loving it!

This beer is a hop party in my mouth!  I was accustomed to RRs big imperials, so I expected a much tamer hop taste to their regular old IPA. What I got was a brew with all the hop flavor and without the malty intensity of an IIPA. Id love to taste this next to a DFH 60. It would be a brutal competition. Where is my dream pub with both on tap?

Having this after Pliny the Elder may have been a bad idea. Its a delicious beer though. All grapefruit and wine biscuits. This beer is one of those "oh crap, Ive finished mine already" beers. Far more drinkable/sessionable than PtE, and another great beer from Russian River.
Well balanced with a nice malt backbone. Nice slightly opake amber color. Very nice and upfront Hoppy character.Nice dry finish with a solid hop mouthfeel. This is one Awesome beer.

Another great hoppy beer from Russian River. Though not quite aas good as the two Plinys this did not disappoint at all. Poured to a hazy golden orange, with a strong citrus grapefruit hop nose and taste, a tingly, bitter mouthfeel, and a crisp long finish.
Great job RR!!

Bottle Pours out a crisp clear fold topped with a long lasting white head. Aroma of citrus hops along with a nice sweetness. Tast a nice hop on it not over the top just a good bitterness. A nice balance with the malts. A tast IPA.

(500 ml bottle ("bottled on 12 008") via trade with WeeHeavySD, thanks Jon!) Pours hazy light amberish yellow with three fingers of stout, foamy off-white head. Big aroma of grapefruit, along with pine and a bit of sweat. Mouthfeel fairly smooth but lightly pebbly, medium-heft. Fairly big, foamy rings of lacing. Flavor is very hoppy, loads of grapefruit and pine and a bit sweaty. Medium-heavy bitterness overlays and carrries through into finish and aftertaste. There is a bit of malt sweetness underneath but its pretty faint. Pretty good but could use a little more balance, sweetness and smoothness to be up there with the really good IPAs IMO. Seems almost like a test batch for a big IPA.
bottle  Hazy Orange  with medium head hints of grapefruit little orange finishes nice and hoppy great IPA

Pours a nice hazy golden amber with a very thin head leaving a very minimal ring. Aroma of sweet citrus and nice malt backbone. Flavor is big hops on the outset with an awesomely bitter hop finish that sticks with you. The malt is there, but is no match for the hop profile. The palate is nice and dry with a moderately heavy mouthfeel and just the right touch of carbonation to finish. Fantastic IPA and just a notch below the Elder in my opinion.

Bottle from toncatcher.  Bottled 7-2008.  Pours a murky light amber with a thin, soapy head.  Aroma is dominated by peach with background shortbread maltiness.  Flavor is citrus hops and sweet malt with a long grassy bitterness to the finish.  Low carb and viscous mouthfeel.  Delicious IPA from the west-sayeeed.

Pint  Eastside Club Tavern  Olympia, WA
Aroma: Great IPA and nice malt backing.  
Appearance: Amber in color, clear with a thin head.  
Flavor: Huge IPA flavor this was a wonderful IPA. 
Palate: Deep Dry finish, with a good IPA Mouthfeel.  
Overall: A very nice brew.  This was one rocking IPA.  AWESOME.
Pours a perfect dark yellow with a nice head.  The body on this is strong but the hops take over after the first sip.  Citrusy hops right upfront, then a bitter finish.  Great beer.

Pours an amberish orange color with a foamy, off white head that quickly settles to a thin flim. The aroma shows hints of fresh oranges and grapefruit to go with some piney hops over a toasted toffee malt backbone. The flavor follows suit with the orange and grapefruit dominating the flavor with just the right amount of bitterness. The toffee malt comes through and add just a hint of sweetness. Medium bodied with good carbonation and very crisp and clean finish. A very easy drinking ipa that I would drink all the time if I could.

Pours a hazy amber gold with medium white head.  Aroma of citrusy hops, orange shavings, and maybe a little honey sweetness.  Flavor is hoppy and grassy with pine and caramel.  Medium bodied with an oily mouthfeel.  Its a very solid IPA.
On draft at Teresas Next Door Cafe.  Pours a clear orange gold with a medium off white head.  Aroma of orange peel, light pine and honey.  Taste of fresh orange peel, pine and grapefruit.  Hoppy.

On tap at Toronado, San Francisco, with Phyllis, 24th Mar 09. Amber, quite low carbonation and a hint of a head. Very hoppy, clean tasting with a lingering grassiness at the back of the throat. Nice stuff.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2012 This is a palate clobberer for sure. Hopheads love this beer. I have to be in the right mood. It has a very inviting aroma of citrus and grass in the nose, fresh and aromatic. It pours orange with lots of suspended particles floating around. It has a small but fluffy orange head. Light bodied grassy flavor with great hop profile. Not much else to balance it out. It feels nice and drinkable at the first few ounces, but as you near the end of the glass, it starts punishing you. But some people like that I guess. Overall a good IPARerate on 12/22/12 bottle dated 12/12/12. It pours a beautifully clear golden color with a disappearing white head. The aroma is filled with Simcoe goodness. Light onion, pine, citrus and garlic. Just a hint of tropical fruity sweetness. The flavor is very dry, grassy, onion, garlic, grapefruit with barely any perceptible maltiness or sweetness. Delicate mouthfeel. Very bitter finish. Intense hop experience for a relatively light IPA. 3.9

Bottled
Golden with a small, white head.
Loads of flowery and grassy hoppiness.
High bitterness.
Fruity and citric.

Had it on tap, so much better than the bottle.  Pale orange, straw colored.  Smells like green apple, pine, grapefruit and other citrus.  Crisp, refreshing entry of hops with a mellow fade on the back of the mouth.  Finish is a little oily, with perfect bitterness.  One of the better IPAs in the world in my opinion.

lower scores do to tasting fuckin Surly furiuos right before, stupid, but i have a few bottles coming my way so til then ... golden in color .. honey dipped hop aroma ... . my mouth is covered in hop oil .. very nice flavor profile, but all i can think of is the under-jerk ... . good stuff .. .

Sampled in 16 oz. Pours golden tan with a thin lacey head. Has a decent amount of sedenment in the bottle. A really fresh hoppy brew. Definitely a lot of hops in this brew with an equal amount of malts. A good brew.

Light copper coloured body with a thinnish off-white head. Potent hop aroma of floral and grapefruity hops and a very potent alcohol scent. Medium-bodied; Amazing bright hoppy flavour all with a good malt backbone and a very subtle fruity flavour. Aftertaste shows nothing but hop bitterness - NICE! Overall, a great IPA, definitely worth trying if you can find it! I sampled this pint on draught at Toronado in San Francisco, California in March 2008.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2011 Bottle.  Finally.
Pours a dull golden straw color with a solid inch of foamy white head that sticks around forever, lacing the hell out of the glass.
Nose starts with a big smack of grapefruit- noticeable from a foot or so away from the glass right after pour.  Aroma follows with oranges and tangerines.  Pungent, earthy, and fruity.
Flavor is immediately unique.  Plenty of that fruit from the nose, with grapefruit taking the forefront as it often does.  Earthy pine and resin notes fill out the hop profile.  Superb bitterness-immediately aggressive, remains thoughout the flavor, never overpowering.  Hop character overall shows an interesting flatness- tons of hops, but never overdone in any one aspect.  Minimal sweetness or malt flavors, and the palate/finish are superbly dry and clean, with only lingering hints of bitterness.
One of the more unique, interesting, and well-done IPAs available.

If someone could analyze my tastebuds and creat a beer perfet for me, I suspect it would taste a lot like this. Very, citrusy - grapefruit, to be exact - on the nose and in the mouthStick and bitter aftertaste. Its not overly thick, and what sweet malt characteristics that are present are subtle and understated. I could drink a ton of this. Thanks to robertjm for the trade. Brewed on 02/02/09, consumed 03/2809.

Bottle. Pours a golden honey color with a 2-finger white head. The head subsides to a thin layer that is soft and fluffy like cotton balls. The aroma is of bitter citrus (grapefruit) up front, that hides some sweeter fruit (pineapple?) in the background. There are also subtle hints of grass, hay, and pine in the aroma.

Flavor is intense with juicy hops and has a long-lasting bitterness that sticks to the inside of the cheeks. Fantastic beer that is easy to drink - a strong younger brother to the Pliny.

Clean, golden pour with a two finger off-white head.  Nice retention and lacing.  Pine and highly sweet citrus nose, excellent hop profile.  Medium carbonation and lingering bitterness, dry at the tail end.  Pine all over this one.  Pizza and this beer - delicious.  Nice IPA.
Pours golden, lots of grapefruit, kiwi, pine, and some floral.  Nice bitter finish.  Great brew.

Pour is a clear yellow with creamy off white head. Nose of pine, and grapefruit. 
Taste of pineapple, with a big piny dry finish. Thin mouth feel but thick enough to feel pleasant as it roles around the tongue. Great beer!

Bottle. Pours a clear amber golden color. Aroma is of citrus and hops. Flavor is very hoppy. Bitterness is lasting. Grapefruit bite is very present. Tasty IPA. But I much prefer the smoother bitterness of Pliny the Elder.
Pretty solid IPA for me. Nice and juicy hops and not too lingering with the bitterness. Pine and citrus dominant hops. easy to drink and very good.

Bottle purchased at Belmont Station, Portland, OR.  Snifter.  Big fluffy head.  Cloudy dark orange color.  Smells like Pliny, divided by 3.  Tastes like Pliny, divided by 3.  Palate is thin.  This is a good beer, but quite a step down from its Imperial siblings.

Draught at the brewery.   Gold with a white head.   Huge hoppy aroma of pine and grapefruit.   Dry, lightly toasted pale malt with lots of bitter, piney hop flavor.   A little lighter bodied and dryer than RRIPA, with a very dry and clean finish and lingering bitterness.   A pretty big hop charge, but the profile isnt quite as interesting as RRIPA.   Love the dry, clean malt profile though

500ml bottle. Pours a hazy, golden-yellow body with a thin, white, fizzy head that leaves a good amount of runny, soapy lacing. Aroma is very bright and fresh. Lots of zesty lemons and sweet caramels. Some light toffee and pine in the background as well as some tropical fruits. Flavor is nice and abundant, yet somewhat subdued. Doesnt jump out like some other CA brews. The flavor grows in the finish and increases more as it warms. The most intensely bitter taste comes about a minute after sipping. A very light bodied and dry IPA. Big, fresh, zesty, and bright citrus (mostly lemony) after an initial and brief caramel maltiness. Lots of pine and grass in the aftertaste. Very resiny. Some pineapple and tropical fruit flavors increase in the finish, which maintain a big zesty, tartness for a long duration. There is a malt presence, but its very light and in the background. The palate is very light and crisp. Overall, lots of tangy, puckering flavor for such a light bodied IPA. Very tasty.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2011 This is a re rate.  Fresh bottle.  Dark gold with a nice white head.  Familiar Russian river hop aroma.  Citrus rinds, tropical fruit and earthy pine.  Good flavor to follow.  Very citrusy hops, grapefruit pith, pine and pale malts.  Good bitterness.  Medium bodied with good carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2009 Great tasting IPA with a similar flavour profile to its big brother "Pliny the Elder". Allot of exotic fruit such as pineapple and passionfruit is all over the aroma and in the flavour. The brew could do with just a tad more carbonation but its still very drinkable and tasty. Thanks to fredandboboflo for this bottle.

Kick Ass IPA. If you know hoppy beers you know the deal. It is all here. Smell, taste, bitter, sweet. Ooooh that smell. That smell that surrounds me. Regular must have for sure. Vinnie is a beer genius. Hop Heads rejoice.

2009 Bottle - 1 month old, pours a semi-hazy golden with a large, lasting off-white head...aroma is big and bright, frest citrus, grass, peach, pine tar...flavour is similar, nice variance of bitters, I was actually expecting a few more IBUs given the hype, but it is good, very dry finish...I think more malt without going the DIPA route would have made me happier, still delicious....

Bottled. Thanks to larsniclas. 
Hazy golden colour, with low white head. Great aroma from dry-hopping, there is vanilla, grape and mandarines. Flavourwise an ultra-clean hop-juicy backbone from grapes and orange-peels. Well attenuated and really bitter. Medium bodied, and focused on the hops rather than the maltiness. Great beer!

Bottle thanks to larsniclasOn March 7, 2009Shady pale golden color, white head. Chinook hops, pineapple, sweet caramel scent, smells "bitter". Slight acidic, dry, bitter taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.

Bottle (50 cl), thanks larsniclas. Hazy golden, thin white head. Pineapple & grapefruit hops with some pineneedlse. Medium bodied and smooth. Very dry and bitter, slightly unbalanced. Very refreshing.

Great IPA, but more rough around the edges as compared to Pliny the Elder.  Slight astrigency on the nose and the alcohol is more noticeable, even though the ABC is 2% under Pliny.  Still, a well rounded, tasty IPA with strong hop flavor, that gets stronger as it warms.  Even with less hops, this is a hoppier beer than Pliny since there is less malt there to balance.  Very good Pacific NW IPA.

2009-02-28. Lightly hazy golden orange body with a lovely fluffy white head. Aroma is a touch muted at first in an overly chilled pour, but lovely hop profile develops as it warms. Resiny, light melange of citrus and citrus seeds comes out nicely. Flavour starts out with a rush of citrus, then moves toward more resiny hops and some lightly astringent grapefruit and other citrus seeds. Smooth average palate. Rather nice. Bottle c/o acrdz

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2009 On tap at Naked City.  Pours clear golden amber with a minimal white head.  Citrus hop smell.  Earthy floral hop taste with a loooooooooooong biiiiiiiiiittttttttttttter finish like leaving an aspirin on your tongue.
Pours gold with a white head.  Smells of layered citrus, peppery and some caramel.  Tastes citrussy and dry with a balanced bitterness on the finish.
gold body with a white head, very hoppy, flavors are sweet, washy, not bad, but surprisingly, not great, finishes very bitter, a bit chilly, which is killing flavor and aroma.

On tap at the Toronado and also at the Russian River brewpub 2 days apart while on vacation from my notes.

The beer poured a nice yellow/golden color with a bright white head that laced around the glass. the aroma of this beer has a very strong hoppy smell with a balance of citrus. Very pleasing. The taste had a nice balance between the bitter hops and the sweeter malt and citrus balance. There was a nice amount of carbonation in the Bling Pig which I really enjoy. The is a very drinkable beer and a very good example of an IPA.

[Bottle] brought back from S.F. Pours a bright orange with a medium fluffy beige head. Aroma is quite musty, with tons of grapefruit and tangerine. Flavor is still a bit musty, not too much malt, which lends to a quite dry mouthfeel. Bitterness grows as I drink it, and is a bit enhanced by the dry mustiness.

Bottle shared with MatSciGuy - Deep amber/orange color that pours with a low short lived head. Big fresh citrus aroma with some floral hints. Hops follow through in the flavor - big - with citrus and mine had a bit of bracing bitterness that lasted through the finish. A dry beer that was smooth on the tough. A great IPA

Bottle:  Sort of a pale golden pour with a finger of fluffy white head and lots of sticky lacing.  Aroma is rich with fruity and citrus sweetness and an underly sense of pine.  The hoppiness in the flavor is intense with florals and citrus, yet remains dangerously drinkable.  Finishes very well, hoppy with a smooth malty sweetness working with the citrus and fruity notes.  Really nice.

Nice yellow color, much lighter than the Pliny I had earlier. Smells good, some of that west coast. Very hoppy flavor and only slightly bitter. Probably too easy to drink. I think Russian River will have no problem selling beer in Colorado. I will buy it all.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 08-21-2008 04:01:24

Pours a light orange color with a large foamy off white head. Nose is definitely fresh and tempting, strong citrus, resin, grapefruit and pine. Initial taste is resin citrus similar to the aroma with touch of grapefruit and sweetness. Resin hop character is delicious, a medium IPA, balancing malts are light. A very drinkable IPA for more the common palate, since my girlfriend like it, haha. Head retention and lacing is out stating with a above average palate duration. Light body.

At brewpub and in bottles.   This is one bittler beer, and the hop flavor / bitterness really predominates.   A slightly lesser beer compared to PtE because it is not as balanced.   But if you strictly want a big pint of hops and bitterness, this is a great beer.

Clear light amber body, white head that fades, leaving lots of webby lacing on the glass.  Nice crisp hop aroma, not overly sweet, herbal, gassy, dank, pineapple and lemon.  Dry bitter flavor, slight sweet balance, bet lets hops dominate.  Finishes clean and dry.

Plinys younger brother has a pretty big shadow cast, but it manages to come out with some nice eccentricity from the king of the IPA world, Russian River.  Hawaiian punch in the smell, nice tropical taste, maybe a bit over carbonated, but a damn good IPA overall.

On draft at Teresas.  Poured light orange with egg-white head.  Nose of fresh grapefruits.  Flavor consists of freshly sliced fruits: orange, grapefruit, even some pineapple noticeable.  Probably underrated as some people try incorrectly to compare it to the Plinys.  One of the best IPAs out there.

Bottle from CelticBrew, thanks for this Jim!! Clear gold pour under a big foamy white head that settles to a 1/8" layer that lasts and lasts, leaving a fine, filmy lace. Huge citrus hop aroma with doses of spruce, honey , and even some light fruit. Medium body and lightly carbonated, resinous, but surprisingly smooth and even silky. Hops come on quickly, like chewing grapefruit rind, with some toffee like sweetness for support. An outstanding IPA in the best of West Coast style.

On draught Toronado - 

Very hoppy aroma - nice thick white head. Perfect IPA, well balanced hoppyness and overall goodness, though pales in comparison to eitherof the Plinys...

Fresh 22oz bottle. Perfect example of what I like in an IPA. Big pine hops that dont quit, just enough malt to keep it drinkable. Bitterness in the finish is stong, but not overwhelming. Just big and fresh. I love this beer.

Had in bottle and tap a few times, none was better than the growler brought to Kramers tasting - I think Axilla or Miver?  Insane stuff!
